original: bdag ni byed po za po sogs //
analyzed: bdag ni byed po za po sogs //
translated: The self is not the agent or the experiencer,

original: rten med brdzun pa'i 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: rten med brdzun pa'i 'dzin pa ni //
translated: It is a false conception without a basis.

original: des na spang ba kho nar gyis //
analyzed: des na spang ba kho nar gyis //
translated: Therefore, you should definitely abandon it.🔽If you delight in this nectar of reality, then you should definitely abandon this conception of a nonexistent self as the agent and experiencer, which is a false conception without a basis in reality, which obstructs the correct view.

original: gal te khyod de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi 'di la dga' bar byed na de lta na yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag byed pa po dang / zab po nyid du rten med par brdzun pa'i 'dzin pa yang dag pa'i lta ba'i bar du gcod par byed pa 'di nges par thong shig / gal te kho bo cag gi bdag dang khyed kyi bdag med pa gnyis 'dra bar gyur na des byed dang bdag cag
analyzed: gal te khyod de kho na nyid kyi bdud rtsi 'di la dga' bar byed na de lta na yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag byed pa po dang / zab po nyid du rten med par brdzun pa'i 'dzin pa yang dag pa'i lta ba'i bar du gcod par byed pa 'di nges par thong shig / gal te kho bo cag gi bdag dang khyed kyi bdag med pa gnyis 'dra bar gyur na des byed dang bdag cag
translated: If our self and your selflessness are similar, then our philosophical systems would be the same.

original: gi grub pa'i mtha' mtshungs bar 'gyur ro zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gi grub pa'i mtha' mtshungs bar 'gyur ro zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /

analyzed: dngos rnams rang bzhin skye med phyir /

original: de nyid du na skye med 'dod //
analyzed: de nyid du na skye med 'dod //

original: ngo bo nyid kyis skye med nyid //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis skye med nyid //
translated: Nonarising by its very nature

original: 'di yi ngo bo nyid du bstan //
analyzed: 'di yi ngo bo nyid du bstan //
translated: Is taught to be its very essence.

original: dngos med nyid ni bdag med pa //
analyzed: dngos med nyid ni bdag med pa //
translated: Nonexistence of things is selflessness.

original: de ni bdag min 'gal ba nyid //
analyzed: de ni bdag min 'gal ba nyid //
translated: It is contradictory to be not self.

original: bdag med bdag tu 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: bdag med bdag tu 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If it is said that the self is not self,

original: ba lang min pa'ang ba lang 'gyur //
analyzed: ba lang min pa'ang ba lang 'gyur //

original: rgyu dang rkyen dang mthun par skyes pa yin na yang /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen dang mthun par skyes pa yin na yang /
translated: Although things arise in accordance with causes and conditions,

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par khas blangs nas ma skyes pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin gyis ma skyes par khas blangs nas ma skyes pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //

original: de nyid ni rang bzhin med pa yin pas rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid do /
analyzed: de nyid ni rang bzhin med pa yin pas rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa nyid do /
translated: Since that is the absence of intrinsic nature, it is not produced intrinsically.

original: bdag ni rang bzhin dang don tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni rang bzhin dang don tha dad pa ma yin pa'o //

original: gang gi phyir de dang bral par gyur pa de ni bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dang bral par gyur pa de ni bdag med pa'o //

original: bdag med pa'i ngo bo ni bdag med pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ngo bo ni bdag med pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of selflessness is selflessness.

original: de ni bdag med pa yin pas bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bdag med pa yin pas bdag ma yin te /
translated: Since that is selfless, it is not a self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gal ba'i phyir te /🔽gang bdag yin na ni bdag med pa ji ltar yin /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir te / gang bdag yin na ni bdag med pa ji ltar yin /
translated: Because it is contradictory.🔽If it is a self, how can it be selfless?

original: 'on te bdag med pa yin na yang bdag ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bdag med pa yin na yang bdag ji ltar yin te /
translated: But if it is selfless, how can it be a self?

original: ji ltar rta'i ngo bo ba @270b lang gi ngo bo ma yin pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar rta'i ngo bo ba @270b lang gi ngo bo ma yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as the nature of a horse is not the nature of an ox,

original: de bzhin du bdag med pa 'di bdag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag med pa 'di bdag tu 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, this selflessness is not the self.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: dngos po'i ngo bo med 'di ni //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo med 'di ni //
translated: This nature of non-entity

original: ji ltar byed po za por rigs //
analyzed: ji ltar byed po za por rigs //
translated: How could it be a creator or experiencer?🔽Because,

original: gang phyir mo gsham dag gi bu //🔽byed po za bor ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: gang phyir mo gsham dag gi bu // byed po za bor ma yin bzhin //
translated: like the son of a barren woman,🔽it is not a creator or experiencer.

original: byed pa po dang / zab por yang de ni rigs te /
analyzed: byed pa po dang / zab por yang de ni rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that it is a creator or experiencer,

original: rang bzhin ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin ngo bo nyid med pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is essentially devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //🔽de ltar gyur la skye ji ltar //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no // de ltar gyur la skye ji ltar //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.🔽How could it arise in that way?

original: de las nyams par 'gyur ci ltar //
analyzed: de las nyams par 'gyur ci ltar //
translated: How could it be subject to destruction?

original: mkha' la me tog med pa la //
analyzed: mkha' la me tog med pa la //
translated: Just as a sky-flower does not exist,

original: ji ltar skye 'jig brtags pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar skye 'jig brtags pa bzhin //
translated: so too should you understand creation and destruction.

original: rnam pa de lta bur bdag med pa'i bdag la 'gro ba ma lus pa skye zhing 'gag pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur bdag med pa'i bdag la 'gro ba ma lus pa skye zhing 'gag pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: In that way, how could the entire world arise and cease in a self that is selfless?

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ji ltar nam mkha'i me tog bzhin /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ji ltar nam mkha'i me tog bzhin /
translated: How could a nature that is a non-entity be like a sky-flower?

original: skye ba dang / 'gag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'gag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it arises or ceases.

original: dngos po med pa'i yul dag la //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i yul dag la //
translated: With respect to objects that are non-existent,

original: ji srid blo ni 'jug gyur pa //
analyzed: ji srid blo ni 'jug gyur pa //
translated: for as long as the mind engages,

original: blo yis brtags pas sgro btags phyir //
analyzed: blo yis brtags pas sgro btags phyir //
translated: because the mind superimposes through conceptualization,

original: de srid gcig la sogs par 'dod //
analyzed: de srid gcig la sogs par 'dod //
translated: for that long, one and so on are asserted.

original: dngos po nyid med par gyur pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po nyid med par gyur pa ni dngos po med pa ste /
translated: That which becomes non-existent as an entity is non-existent.

original: yul de la dus ji srid du blo 'jug par gyur pa de srid du gcig la sogs pa'i rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul de la dus ji srid du blo 'jug par gyur pa de srid du gcig la sogs pa'i rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: With respect to that object, for as long as the mind engages, for that long, the conception of one and so on arises.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gcig nyid med du zin kyang blos brtags pas sgro btags nas gcig ces bya ba la sogs par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid med du zin kyang blos brtags pas sgro btags nas gcig ces bya ba la sogs par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though one does not exist, because the mind superimposes through conceptualization, it is said to be one and so on.

original: rtog bcas rtog pa med pa las //
analyzed: rtog bcas rtog pa med pa las //
translated: From conceptual and non-conceptual,

original: gang tshe blo ni log gyur pa //
analyzed: gang tshe blo ni log gyur pa //
translated: when the mind is reversed,

original: de tshe blo ni yul med phyir //
analyzed: de tshe blo ni yul med phyir //
translated: at that time, because the mind has no object,

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba nyid //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba nyid //
translated: proliferation is pacified and it is peace.

original: ngo bo dang bcas pa'am ngo bo med par rnam par brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag gnyi ga yang med pa'i bdag med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa las gang gi tshe blo log par gyur cing /
analyzed: ngo bo dang bcas pa'am ngo bo med par rnam par brtags pa'i rnam par rtog pa de dag gnyi ga yang med pa'i bdag med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa las gang gi tshe blo log par gyur cing /
translated: When the mind turns away from those conceptual thoughts that conceive of things as having an essence or as being essenceless, and from the nonconceptual state that focuses on the selflessness that is the nonexistence of both of those, at that time,🔽

original: blo'i yul thams cad med par gyur pa de'i tshe dngos po thams cad yongs su ma grub pa'i ngo bo de ni de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: blo'i yul thams cad med par gyur pa de'i tshe dngos po thams cad yongs su ma grub pa'i ngo bo de ni de kho na nyid de /
translated: When the mind turns away from those conceptual thoughts that conceive of things as having an essence or as being essenceless, and when all objects of the mind are eliminated, at that time, the nonestablishment of all things, their essencelessness, is suchness.

original: thams cad du gang gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pas nye bar zhi bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du gang gis brjod par bya ba ma yin pas nye bar zhi bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: Since it cannot be expressed in any way, it is peace.

original: de bzhin du ngag dang blo las shin tu 'das pa'i de kho na nyid ni de kho na nyid yin par rigs kyi khyod kyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag dang blo las shin tu 'das pa'i de kho na nyid ni de kho na nyid yin par rigs kyi khyod kyis kun du brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba ni ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, suchness is the suchness that is beyond speech and mind. It is not the self that you imagine,🔽because the errors previously explained would ensue.

original: sngar bstan pa'i skyon rnams yod par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang rngan pa byin nas nyal ba'i bud med bzhin nam /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i skyon rnams yod par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yang rngan pa byin nas nyal ba'i bud med bzhin nam /
translated: Moreover, it would be like a prostitute sleeping with a client for money.

original: blun po tha mar @271a * //
analyzed: blun po tha mar @271a * //
translated: Or it would be like a fool

original: gyur ba zhig la ba lang gi shan bas dbang po bcol ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gyur ba zhig la ba lang gi shan bas dbang po bcol ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of the butcher who was entrusted with the senses.

original: de lta bas na ji skad bstan pa'i de kho na nyid ni gnod pa med par gnas pa yin no //🔽dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel ba rtog ge 'bar ba las /
analyzed: de lta bas na ji skad bstan pa'i de kho na nyid ni gnod pa med par gnas pa yin no // dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel ba rtog ge 'bar ba las /
translated: Therefore, the reality as it has been taught remains unrefuted.🔽This concludes the eighth chapter in the commentary on the Heart of the Middle Way, called “Blazing Reasoning,”

original: rig byed kyi mtha' rgyur smra ba'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ste le'u brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: rig byed kyi mtha' rgyur smra ba'i de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ste le'u brgyad pa'o /
translated: which is an explanation of the entry into reality by the proponents of the Vedānta.

original: // / de nas da ni dpyod pa can gyi de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas le'u dgu pa'i rab tu byed pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas da ni dpyod pa can gyi de kho na nyid gtan la dbab pa la 'jug pas le'u dgu pa'i rab tu byed pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to establish the reality of the Mīmāṃsakas, I will begin the ninth chapter.

original: ngo tsha med pa kha cig ni //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa kha cig ni //
translated: Some shameless people🔽Say that the path to liberation and awakening,

original: byang grol legs lam bsam gtan dang // shes la skur 'debs bya ba tsam //
analyzed: byang grol legs lam bsam gtan dang // shes la skur 'debs bya ba tsam //
translated: Concentration and wisdom, are just for show,

original: bdag gis de ni thob par sems //
analyzed: bdag gis de ni thob par sems //

analyzed: rig byed kyi mtha' smra ba nyid las gzhan pa dpyod pa can zhes bya bas rig byed la gang snang ba ni rang byung yin te /
translated: The Mīmāṃsakas, who are different from the Vedāntins, say that what appears in the Vedas is self-arisen.

original: de ni de kho na nyid yin no zhes btags nas thar pa 'thob pa'i lam bzang po gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan dang / shes pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la 'gal bas skur pa 'debs shing mchod sbyin la sogs pa bya ba 'ba' zhig byang grol 'thob par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing bslus byed pa dang 'dra bas mkhas pa rnams la ngo tsha dang bral bar byas nas byas pa'i shugs
analyzed: de ni de kho na nyid yin no zhes btags nas thar pa 'thob pa'i lam bzang po gang yin pa dang / bsam gtan dang / shes pa dang / grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la 'gal bas skur pa 'debs shing mchod sbyin la sogs pa bya ba 'ba' zhig byang grol 'thob par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing bslus byed pa dang 'dra bas mkhas pa rnams la ngo tsha dang bral bar byas nas byas pa'i shugs
translated: They are like a swindler who says, “I will give you this, which is reality,” and then deceives you.

original: bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyis bram zer byed pa yin no zhes rgyas par brjod do //
analyzed: bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad kyis bram zer byed pa yin no zhes rgyas par brjod do //

analyzed: de la dang po mngal nye bar blangs pa'i dus su mngal gyi zla ba dang po la aom khyab 'jug mngal yin no //
translated: At the time of first entering the womb, in the first month of the womb, Om is Vishnu, the womb.

original: tva stas gzugs sbyangs so //
analyzed: tva stas gzugs sbyangs so //

original: tshangs pas sa gcod par byed do //
analyzed: tshangs pas sa gcod par byed do //

original: skye dgu'i bdag pos ni mngal sbengs  par byed do //
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag pos ni mngal sbengs  par byed do //

analyzed: de rnams kun gyis mngal du 'god par byed cing /

original: de rnams nyid kyis skyong zhing 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyis skyong zhing 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: They themselves nourish and sustain it.

original: de rnams dang lha tha skar gyis mngal rdzogs par ster bar byed do //
analyzed: de rnams dang lha tha skar gyis mngal rdzogs par ster bar byed do //

analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa dang gsum pa la ni skyes bu'i cha byad du byas pas so //

original: zla ba drug pa la ni gtsug tor dbye ba byas so //
analyzed: zla ba drug pa la ni gtsug tor dbye ba byas so //
translated: In the sixth month, the fontanelle is opened.

original: skyes pa'i dus na cho ga bzhin du bsrungs pa dang / skyes ma thag tu mar dang sbrang rtsi myangs pa dang / nyi ma bcu pa la ming btags pa dang / zla ba bzhi pa la nyi ma bsten pa dang / drug pa la zas byin pa dang /
analyzed: skyes pa'i dus na cho ga bzhin du bsrungs pa dang / skyes ma thag tu mar dang sbrang rtsi myangs pa dang / nyi ma bcu pa la ming btags pa dang / zla ba bzhi pa la nyi ma bsten pa dang / drug pa la zas byin pa dang /
translated: When the child is born, he is protected according to the rules, he tastes butter and honey, he is given a name on the tenth day, he is exposed to the sun in the fourth month, he is given solid food in the sixth month,🔽his hair is cut in the first year or in the third month,

original: lo gcig gam zla ba gsum nas gtsug phud bcings pa dang / mngal du zhugs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: lo gcig gam zla ba gsum nas gtsug phud bcings pa dang / mngal du zhugs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: and from the time of conception,

original: @271b lo brgyad na sta gon dug nas shing brtul zhugs lnga dang nye ba'i brtul zhugs lnga blangs pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i brtul zhugs lnga ma nyan pa dang / aa bo hi sba dang / me la bya ba rnams dang / bza' ba rnams dang /
analyzed: @271b lo brgyad na sta gon dug nas shing brtul zhugs lnga dang nye ba'i brtul zhugs lnga blangs pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i brtul zhugs lnga ma nyan pa dang / aa bo hi sba dang / me la bya ba rnams dang / bza' ba rnams dang /
translated: At the age of eight, he took the five major and five minor observances of the yogic disciplines, and he did not listen to the other five yogic disciplines.

original: bla ma rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dus gsum du 'thor 'thung bya ba dang / bzlas pa dang / mchod sbyin dang / nye reg dang / rlung 'byung ba dang / gzhug pa dang / rig byed rdzogs par bklags pa dang / bag ma blangs pa dang /
analyzed: bla ma rnams la bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / dus gsum du 'thor 'thung bya ba dang / bzlas pa dang / mchod sbyin dang / nye reg dang / rlung 'byung ba dang / gzhug pa dang / rig byed rdzogs par bklags pa dang / bag ma blangs pa dang /
translated: He served his gurus, performed the morning and evening rites, recited [mantras], made offerings, bathed, performed the wind yoga, inserted [the penis into the vagina], read the Vedas, took a wife,

analyzed: bzhi pa byas pa dang / sbyin sreg dang / me bsrungs pa dang / me la sbyin sreg byed pa bstan pa dang / zla ba gcig lon nas mchod sbyin byas pa dang / byol song bcings pa dang / zla ba bzhi pa'i nyi ma ldog pa'i dang po la nyer gnas kyi las dang /
translated: performed the four [rites], made fire offerings, protected the fire, taught the fire offering, made offerings after a month, freed the animals, performed the rites of the first day of the reversal of the sun in the fourth month,🔽and performed the rites of the full moon and the new moon.

original: brgyad pa gsum pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa gsum pa byas pa ste /
translated: The eighth is the third, making three.

original: lo ma dang / 'o ma dang / sha dang / khur bas mchod sbyin byas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu bram ze'i dbang du byas pa'i shugs bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad po 'di dag dang / bstan bcos las 'byung ba bzhin du 'bru dang /
analyzed: lo ma dang / 'o ma dang / sha dang / khur bas mchod sbyin byas pa zhes bya ba de lta bu bram ze'i dbang du byas pa'i shugs bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad po 'di dag dang / bstan bcos las 'byung ba bzhin du 'bru dang /
translated: These are the forty-eight types of brahmins who perform sacrifices with leaves, milk, meat and curd.

original: byol song dang / mar dang / chung ma dang 'brel pa'i las rnams byas pa'i yin tan gyi lam las gzhan gyis grol ba 'thob par rigs pa ma yin no zhes lung las 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: byol song dang / mar dang / chung ma dang 'brel pa'i las rnams byas pa'i yin tan gyi lam las gzhan gyis grol ba 'thob par rigs pa ma yin no zhes lung las 'byung ngo ;
translated: The scriptures state that liberation is not obtained through any other path than the path of the qualities of performing the rites of grains,🔽animals, clarified butter and marriage as they occur in the treatises.

original: / rig byed las bstan pa'i so ba dang / byol song dang / mar la sog pas mchod skyon bya ba dang / stegs bu'i dkyil du chung ma blang zhing 'brel pa'i bya ba las gzhan pa'i thar pa 'thob pa'i thabs ni med do //
analyzed: / rig byed las bstan pa'i so ba dang / byol song dang / mar la sog pas mchod skyon bya ba dang / stegs bu'i dkyil du chung ma blang zhing 'brel pa'i bya ba las gzhan pa'i thar pa 'thob pa'i thabs ni med do //
translated: The Vedas teach that there is no means of attaining liberation other than performing sacrifices with barley, animals and clarified butter and taking a wife in the center of the sacrificial altar.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know this?

original: rig byed kyi lung gi lugs tshad mar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi lung gi lugs tshad mar byed pa yin te /
translated: Because the scriptures of the Vedas are valid.

original: rig byed las ni dkar mo dang 'bru rnams kyis mchod sbyin byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig byed las ni dkar mo dang 'bru rnams kyis mchod sbyin byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Vedas declare that one should perform a sacrifice with white and black grains.

original: de bzhin du gang la lo gsum thub pa'i so ba khyim na sbas nas yod pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang la lo gsum thub pa'i so ba khyim na sbas nas yod pa'am /

analyzed: drag po ni bcu gcig ste yi ge bcu gcig pa'i gsum sngags kyi sdeb sbyor dang / gsum sngags kyi dbyangs dang / thod pa bcu gcig gis nyin phyed kyi dus su mchod do //
translated: Rudra is eleven, the eleven syllables, the meter of the three-syllable mantra, the melody of the three-syllable mantra, and the eleven skull cups, at the time of noon, he worships.

original: nyi ma bcu gnyis te dza ga ti zhes bya ba'i sdeb sbyor yi ge bcu gnyis pa'i dza ga ti'i dbyangs dang / thod pa bcu gnyis dang bcas pas thun gsum pa'i dus su mchod do //
analyzed: nyi ma bcu gnyis te dza ga ti zhes bya ba'i sdeb sbyor yi ge bcu gnyis pa'i dza ga ti'i dbyangs dang / thod pa bcu gnyis dang bcas pas thun gsum pa'i dus su mchod do //
translated: The twelve-syllabled Jagatī meter is the Jagatī melody of twelve syllables, together with the twelve skull-cups, one should make offerings at the time of the third watch.

original: yang na sbyin sreg byas pa'i me'am /
analyzed: yang na sbyin sreg byas pa'i me'am /
translated: Alternatively, the fire of a burnt offering,

original: grong ba'i me'am /
analyzed: grong ba'i me'am /
translated: the fire of a village,

original: lho phyogs kyi me ni rkang pa gsum zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi me ni rkang pa gsum zhes bya'o //
translated: or the fire of the south is called the three-footed fire.

original: mgo bo gnyis ni mchod sbyin byed pa dang de'i chung ma'o //
analyzed: mgo bo gnyis ni mchod sbyin byed pa dang de'i chung ma'o //
translated: The two heads are the sacrificer and his wife.

original: mchod sbyin med pa ni gang chung ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin med pa ni gang chung ma med pa'o //
translated: The one without a sacrifice is the one without a wife.

original: rje'u rigs kyi bya ba bcu drug me dang zla ba la yin la /
analyzed: rje'u rigs kyi bya ba bcu drug me dang zla ba la yin la /
translated: The sixteen activities of the kṣatriya are for the fire and the moon.

original: de'i chung mas kyang de'i rjes la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i chung mas kyang de'i rjes la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: His wife should also give after him.

original: yang na mgo bo gnyis ni yi ge aom dang dbyangs kyi sdeb sbyor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na mgo bo gnyis ni yi ge aom dang dbyangs kyi sdeb sbyor zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the two heads are called the syllable oṃ and the melody meter.

original: lag pa bdun gyi sdeb sbyor bdun te /
analyzed: lag pa bdun gyi sdeb sbyor bdun te /
translated: The seven-handed meter is seven.

original: de la yi ge drug pa'i dbyangs kyi sdeb sbyor ni dus drug go //
analyzed: de la yi ge drug pa'i dbyangs kyi sdeb sbyor ni dus drug go //
translated: Therein, the six-syllabled melody meter is the six times.

original: au snig zhes bya ba'i sdeb sbyor yi ge bdun pa ni drang srong bdun yin no //
analyzed: au snig zhes bya ba'i sdeb sbyor yi ge bdun pa ni drang srong bdun yin no //
translated: The seven-syllable meter called uṣṇig is the seven sages.

original: yi ge brgyad pa ni rjes su bsngags pa zhes bya ba'i sdeb sbyor te nor lha brgyad yin no //
analyzed: yi ge brgyad pa ni rjes su bsngags pa zhes bya ba'i sdeb sbyor te nor lha brgyad yin no //
translated: The eight-syllable meter called anustubh is the eight wealth gods.

original: yi ge dgu pa'i sdeb sbyor bri ha ti zhes bya ba ni gza' dgu yin no //
analyzed: yi ge dgu pa'i sdeb sbyor bri ha ti zhes bya ba ni gza' dgu yin no //
translated: The nine-syllable meter called bṛhatī is the nine planets.

original: yi ge bcu pa'i sdeb sbyor phreng ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu yin no //
analyzed: yi ge bcu pa'i sdeb sbyor phreng ba zhes bya ba ni phyogs bcu yin no //
translated: The ten-syllable meter called mālinī is the ten directions.

original: yi ge bcu gcig pa'i sdeb sbyor gsum bsngags zhes bya ba ni drag po bcu gcig yin no //
analyzed: yi ge bcu gcig pa'i sdeb sbyor gsum bsngags zhes bya ba ni drag po bcu gcig yin no //
translated: The eleven-syllable meter called triṣṭubh is the eleven Rudras.

original: yi ge bcu gnyis pa'i sdeb sbyor dza ga ti zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bcu gnyis yin te /
analyzed: yi ge bcu gnyis pa'i sdeb sbyor dza ga ti zhes bya ba ni nyi ma bcu gnyis yin te /
translated: The twelve-syllable meter called jagatī is the twelve suns.

original: 'di dag ni rig byed kyi lag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rig byed kyi lag pa'o //
translated: These are the limbs of the Vedas.

original: gsum nas bcings zhes bya ba ni snying kha dang / mgrin pa dang / mgo bo gnas te /
analyzed: gsum nas bcings zhes bya ba ni snying kha dang / mgrin pa dang / mgo bo gnas te /
translated: The three-bound is the location of the heart, throat, and head.

original: ngag khyu mchog gi yi ge aom 'di'o //
analyzed: ngag khyu mchog gi yi ge aom 'di'o //
translated: The syllable oṃ of the bull of speech is this.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi mchog yin pas khyu mchog go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi mchog yin pas khyu mchog go //
translated: Since it is the best of the worldly, it is the bull.

original: nga ro 'don zhes bya ba ni nang du sgra byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nga ro 'don zhes bya ba ni nang du sgra byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term roar means that he makes a sound within.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug dang bde byed dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams ni dbang phyug yin la /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug dang bde byed dang / tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams ni dbang phyug yin la /
translated: The term great means that he is the lord of Viṣṇu, Brahmā, and so on.

original: de dag pas kyang lhag par gyur pas na chen po'o //
analyzed: de dag pas kyang lhag par gyur pas na chen po'o //
translated: Since he is superior to them, he is called great.

original: gtso bor gyur pa dang mnga' bdag tu gyur pas na lha chen po'o //
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa dang mnga' bdag tu gyur pas na lha chen po'o //
translated: Since he is the principal and the lord, he is called great god.

original: @274a * // 'jig rten 'di'i 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa nas gnas pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: @274a * // 'jig rten 'di'i 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sogs pa nas gnas pa'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The term of this world means from Brahmā to the highest heaven.

original: de ni thams cad la khyab nas gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni thams cad la khyab nas gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term he pervades all means that he abides in all.

original: de lta bu'i rig byed las bstan pa'i 'bru dang / byol song dang / mar dang / chung ma dang 'brel pa'i bya ba dag gi 'bras bu ni 'chi ba las thar pa dang / sdig pa las thar pa dang / bram ze bsad pa las thar pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rig byed las bstan pa'i 'bru dang / byol song dang / mar dang / chung ma dang 'brel pa'i bya ba dag gi 'bras bu ni 'chi ba las thar pa dang / sdig pa las thar pa dang / bram ze bsad pa las thar pa ste /
translated: The result of the rites related to grains, cattle, clarified butter, and wives, which are taught in the Vedas, is freedom from death, freedom from sin, and freedom from killing a brahmin.

original: gang rta'i dag pa'i mchod sbyin byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang rta'i dag pa'i mchod sbyin byas pa'o //
translated: The one who performs the horse sacrifice.

original: de las gzhan pa byol song bcing ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten mngon par rgyal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa byol song bcing ba la sogs pas ni 'jig rten mngon par rgyal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The other sacrifices, such as the animal sacrifice, are for the conquest of the world.

original: de la mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg mchod sbyin bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg mchod sbyin bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: There it is said: “One who desires heaven should perform the fire sacrifice.”

original: me la sbyin sreg ces smos pas ni 'bru dang mar gyis mchod pa dang / chung ma dang 'brel pa'i bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg ces smos pas ni 'bru dang mar gyis mchod pa dang / chung ma dang 'brel pa'i bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mention of the fire sacrifice indicates the worship with grains and clarified butter and the rites connected with the wife.

original: byol song bcings pas ni skyes bus dag pa dang / rta yis dag pa dang / ba lang gi cha byad dang / me la mchod pa dang / rgyal pos 'os pa dang / rlung za ba dang / padma dkar po la sogs pa'i mchod sbyin bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byol song bcings pas ni skyes bus dag pa dang / rta yis dag pa dang / ba lang gi cha byad dang / me la mchod pa dang / rgyal pos 'os pa dang / rlung za ba dang / padma dkar po la sogs pa'i mchod sbyin bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The animal sacrifice indicates the purification by the man, the purification by the horse, the wearing of the cow’s hide, the worship of the fire, the royal consecration, the eating of wind, and the performance of the sacrifice with white lotuses, and so on.

original: gzhan yang der smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang der smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said there:

original: me khyod kyi zas ni bdun no //🔽lce ni bdun no //
analyzed: me khyod kyi zas ni bdun no // lce ni bdun no //
translated: “Your food, O fire, is seven.🔽Your tongue is seven.

original: drang srong ni bdun no //
analyzed: drang srong ni bdun no //
translated: Your ṛṣis are seven.

original: khyim ni bdun no //
analyzed: khyim ni bdun no //
translated: Your houses are seven.

original: nyin zhag bdun du lan bdun du khyod mchod do //
analyzed: nyin zhag bdun du lan bdun du khyod mchod do //
translated: I worship you seven times a day for seven days.

original: skye gnas bdun du khyod mar gyis tshim par bya'o sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skye gnas bdun du khyod mar gyis tshim par bya'o sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I satisfy you with ghee for seven births, svāhā.

original: me khyod kyi zas ni bdun no zhes bya ba ni bil ba dang / pa la sha dang / aa shvad tha dang / au dum b'a ra dang / aa rka dang / shi mi dang / seng ldeng zhes bya ba sreg rdzas bdun bstan pa'o//
analyzed: me khyod kyi zas ni bdun no zhes bya ba ni bil ba dang / pa la sha dang / aa shvad tha dang / au dum b'a ra dang / aa rka dang / shi mi dang / seng ldeng zhes bya ba sreg rdzas bdun bstan pa'o//
translated: Your food, O fire, is sevenfold: the seven oblations are taught to be bilva, palāśa, aśvattha, udumbara, arka, śami, and khadira.

original: lce bdun zhes bya ba ni sdeb sbyor bdun te /
analyzed: lce bdun zhes bya ba ni sdeb sbyor bdun te /
translated: Seven tongues: seven meters.

original: ga ya tri dang / aa shni dang / au nu shthu ba dang / 'bri ha ti dang / sang ga ti dang / ti shthu pa dang / dza ga ti zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ga ya tri dang / aa shni dang / au nu shthu ba dang / 'bri ha ti dang / sang ga ti dang / ti shthu pa dang / dza ga ti zhes bya'o //
translated: They are gāyatrī, aśini, anuṣṭubh, bṛhatī, saṃjñā, tiṣṭhubh, and jagatī.

original: drang srong bdun ni dbang po dang / gsal ba dang / sde can dang / bden ldan ma dang / gser can dang / phyogs can dang / ka shu na dang / sa la ga zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: drang srong bdun ni dbang po dang / gsal ba dang / sde can dang / bden ldan ma dang / gser can dang / phyogs can dang / ka shu na dang / sa la ga zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Seven sages: Indra, Dyu, Viśvāmitra, Vasiṣṭha, Jamadagni, Bharadvāja, and Kaśyapa.

original: yang na 'bri ku dang / aang gi ra sa dang / pu la skya dang / pu la ha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'bri ku dang / aang gi ra sa dang / pu la skya dang / pu la ha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the names of the seven planets: the sun, moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, and Saturn.

original: nyin zhag bdun zhes bya ba ni aang dhva rdzu dang / sbyin sreg dang / me bstan pa dang / byams pa rlung lha dang / mnyam sgrol dang / tshangs pa dang / mthong @274b ston zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag bdun zhes bya ba ni aang dhva rdzu dang / sbyin sreg dang / me bstan pa dang / byams pa rlung lha dang / mnyam sgrol dang / tshangs pa dang / mthong @274b ston zhes bya'o //
translated: The seven days are the names of the seven rishis: Angiras, Bhrigu, Pulastya, Pulaha, Atri, Vasishtha, and Narada.

original: lan bdun du khyod mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga dro dang phyi dro sbyin sreg bya ba dang / snod kyi nang du btso ba dang / 'dod pa brgyad dang / dbang du byed pa zhes byas lan bdun du mchod pa'o //
analyzed: lan bdun du khyod mchod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga dro dang phyi dro sbyin sreg bya ba dang / snod kyi nang du btso ba dang / 'dod pa brgyad dang / dbang du byed pa zhes byas lan bdun du mchod pa'o //
translated: You should worship for seven times means that you should worship seven times: in the morning and evening, in the fire, in the vessel, in the eight desires, and in the subjugation.

original: skye gnas bdun nis dang / rdo dang / shing dang / lcags dang / blugs gzar dang / chu dang / padma dang / padma'i 'dab ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye gnas bdun nis dang / rdo dang / shing dang / lcags dang / blugs gzar dang / chu dang / padma dang / padma'i 'dab ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The seven wombs are the names of the seven elements: earth, water, fire, air, space, mind, and soul.

original: khyod mar gyis tshim par bya'o zhes bya ba la mar zhes bya ba'i chu ste /
analyzed: khyod mar gyis tshim par bya'o zhes bya ba la mar zhes bya ba'i chu ste /
translated: You should satisfy with ghee means that you should satisfy with the water called ghee.

original: mchod sbyin gyi me la chu dang reg par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi me la chu dang reg par byed pa ste /
translated: One should touch the fire of sacrifice with water.

original: bden pas khyod la dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: bden pas khyod la dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: By the truth, I consecrate you.🔽With the oblations, I pour you out.

original: ro rnams kyis khyod la blugs so zhes bya ba ni sa gnas bdun du khyod mar gyis tshim par bya'o zhes rig byed kyi lung las rab tu grags so //
analyzed: ro rnams kyis khyod la blugs so zhes bya ba ni sa gnas bdun du khyod mar gyis tshim par bya'o zhes rig byed kyi lung las rab tu grags so //
translated: This is well known from the Vedic scriptures.

original: de yang ji ltar /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar /
translated: And how is this?

original: bsangs sogs byas nas dur khrod par //
analyzed: bsangs sogs byas nas dur khrod par //
translated: Having purified the cremation ground,

original: sngags las bstan pa'i cho ga can //
analyzed: sngags las bstan pa'i cho ga can //
translated: one should perform the rites taught in the mantra texts.

original: da ni bstan bcos 'dir dbang bar //
analyzed: da ni bstan bcos 'dir dbang bar //
translated: Now, in this treatise, one should understand the consecration

original: shes par bya yi gzhan 'ga'ang min //🔽zhes bstan pas gang grangs can pa dang / bye brag pa dang / gcer bu pa dang / med par smra ba pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi ser skya dang / gzegs can dang / gcer bu dang / 'jig rten 'di pa dang /
analyzed: shes par bya yi gzhan 'ga'ang min // zhes bstan pas gang grangs can pa dang / bye brag pa dang / gcer bu pa dang / med par smra ba pa dang / sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams kyi ser skya dang / gzegs can dang / gcer bu dang / 'jig rten 'di pa dang /
translated: and nothing else.🔽This is taught. But it is not reasonable to teach that Kapila, Kaṇāda, the Nirgranthas, the Lokāyatas, and the Buddhists, etc.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams ni tshad mar gyur pa'i skyes bu nyid yin no zhes bstan pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa rnams ni tshad mar gyur pa'i skyes bu nyid yin no zhes bstan pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: are authoritative persons.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because🔽the words of a person are false

original: chags sogs skyon gyis nyams pa'i phyir //🔽skyes bu'i tshig ni brdzun nyid yin //
analyzed: chags sogs skyon gyis nyams pa'i phyir // skyes bu'i tshig ni brdzun nyid yin //
translated: because of being corrupted by faults such as attachment.

original: rig byed skyes bus ma byas phyir //
analyzed: rig byed skyes bus ma byas phyir //
translated: The Vedas are valid because they are not made by a person.

original: des na tshad mar gsung bar bya //
analyzed: des na tshad mar gsung bar bya //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be valid.

original: skyes bu rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag dang / ma rig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag dang / ma rig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because persons are followed by attachment and so on and ignorance,

original: don gzhan du rnam par gnas la gzhan du sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan du rnam par gnas la gzhan du sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: they establish something as one thing when it abides as something else.

original: dper na chu glud 'di'i 'gram na 'bras bu gnas so zhes bya ba ni bden par yang 'gyur la brgyal ni bden par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lung bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu glud 'di'i 'gram na 'bras bu gnas so zhes bya ba ni bden par yang 'gyur la brgyal ni bden par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i lung bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is true that the fruit is located near this water spirit, but it is also true that the water spirit is not there.

original: gal te skyes bu'i tshig tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu'i tshig tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: If the words of a person are not valid,

original: tshad mar gyur pa gang zhig yin zhe na /🔽rang byung ba'i rig byed tshad mar gyur pa yin te //
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa gang zhig yin zhe na / rang byung ba'i rig byed tshad mar gyur pa yin te //
translated: what is valid?

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Vedas, which are self-originated, are valid because they are not made by a person.

original: 'di skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How are they not made by a person?

original: byed po mi dran par 'dod phyir //
analyzed: byed po mi dran par 'dod phyir //
translated: because it is maintained that the author is not remembered.

original: rig byed skyes bus ma byas la //🔽brgyud nas 'ongs pa @275a * //
analyzed: rig byed skyes bus ma byas la // brgyud nas 'ongs pa @275a * //
translated: The Vedas are not the work of a person,

original: ma chad phyir //
analyzed: ma chad phyir //
translated: because the transmission has come down without interruption.

original: des na lung yin de med na //
analyzed: des na lung yin de med na //
translated: Therefore, they are scripture.

original: ma nu dang dza ga nya ba la ka la dang 'bya sa  dang / aa shtha la sogs pa'i thub pa rnams kyis kyang rig byed rjes su bstan pa yin gyi byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nu dang dza ga nya ba la ka la dang 'bya sa  dang / aa shtha la sogs pa'i thub pa rnams kyis kyang rig byed rjes su bstan pa yin gyi byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The sages Manu, Atri, Aṅgiras, Yājñavalkya, Aśvajit, and so on taught the Vedas, but they did not compose them.

original: rig byed kyi yi ge dang lugs mthar gyis thub pa snga ma'i rgyud las rjes su bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: rig byed kyi yi ge dang lugs mthar gyis thub pa snga ma'i rgyud las rjes su bsgrubs shing /
translated: The letters of the Vedas and the images of the gods were gradually established by the sages of the past.

original: brgyud nas 'ongs pa rgyun ma chad par byung ba yin pa'i phyir lung zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: brgyud nas 'ongs pa rgyun ma chad par byung ba yin pa'i phyir lung zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because the transmission has come down without interruption, they are called scripture.

original: de 'das shing med par gyur pa ni med pa ste /
analyzed: de 'das shing med par gyur pa ni med pa ste /
translated: When they passed away and no longer existed, they did not exist.

original: rig byed ces bya ba'i lung de lkog tu gyur pa yin na yang mtho ris ni yod do //
analyzed: rig byed ces bya ba'i lung de lkog tu gyur pa yin na yang mtho ris ni yod do //
translated: Although the scripture called the Vedas is hidden, heaven exists.

original: thar pa ni yod do zhes lung las rnam par shes so //
analyzed: thar pa ni yod do zhes lung las rnam par shes so //
translated: Liberation exists. This is known from scripture.

original: sngon med pa'i chos kyang rtags dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / dbang po'i yul las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir mthong bar gyur pa yin na yang /
analyzed: sngon med pa'i chos kyang rtags dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir dang / dbang po'i yul las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir mthong bar gyur pa yin na yang /
translated: Also, because a non-existent phenomenon has no relation to a reason, and because it is beyond the scope of the senses, it is not seen.

original: rig byed kyi lung nyid kyi chos ni yod do zhes rnam par shes par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rig byed kyi lung nyid kyi chos ni yod do zhes rnam par shes par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: But it is understood that the Dharma of the Vedas exists.

original: rig byed las gzhan du ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig byed las gzhan du ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not perceived apart from the Vedas.

original: de'i phyir rig byed kho na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rig byed kho na tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Vedas alone are valid.

original: gang sangs rgyas pa dang bye brag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sgra ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bstan pa de ni yongs su mi shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas pa dang bye brag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi sgra ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bstan pa de ni yongs su mi shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: Those who teach that the sound of Buddhists, Vaiśeṣikas, and so on is impermanent do not understand this.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: sgra rtag dbyangs kyis gsal bar byed //🔽don dang 'brel ba rtag pa nyid //
analyzed: sgra rtag dbyangs kyis gsal bar byed // don dang 'brel ba rtag pa nyid //
translated: Sound is permanent, it is clarified by melody.🔽It is related to meaning, it is permanent.

original: don la rtogs pa dang ldan la //
analyzed: don la rtogs pa dang ldan la //
translated: When it is related to meaning,

original: rtogs pa rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rtogs pa rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
translated: understanding arises.

original: sgra ni rtag tu gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: sgra ni rtag tu gnas pa yin la /
translated: Sound always exists.

original: de yang gnas dang byed pa dang / 'bad pa las yang dag par 'byung ba'i dbyangs kyis gsal bar byed pa yin gyi byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang gnas dang byed pa dang / 'bad pa las yang dag par 'byung ba'i dbyangs kyis gsal bar byed pa yin gyi byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is expressed by a sound that arises from a place, an action, and effort, but it is not created.

original: ji ltar sgra ni brjod ma thag tu nyams par 'gyur ba yin na yang /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra ni brjod ma thag tu nyams par 'gyur ba yin na yang /
translated: Even though a sound is destroyed immediately after it is uttered,

original: de lta na yang gang don dang ni dus thams cad du mngon bar 'byor ba yin pas de rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang don dang ni dus thams cad du mngon bar 'byor ba yin pas de rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: nevertheless, since it is always present in the object, it is permanent.

original: ji ltar ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nog dang / lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don dang rtag tu 'brel ba yin te ;
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nog dang / lkog shal la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don dang rtag tu 'brel ba yin te ;
translated: The word “cow,” for example, is always related to an object that has a dewlap, a hump, and so on.

original: gang la don du nges par gzung bar bya ba de ni sgra nyid las don du nges par 'dzin pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi sgra med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la don du nges par gzung bar bya ba de ni sgra nyid las don du nges par 'dzin pa 'byung bar 'gyur gyi sgra med par ni ma yin no //
translated: When the object is ascertained, the meaning is ascertained from the word itself, not from anything else.

original: de'i phyir na sgra ni rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sgra ni rtag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the word is permanent.

original: de'i phyir na rigs pa nyid dang tshad mas kyang yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na rigs pa nyid dang tshad mas kyang yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable and valid.

original: lan cig 'jug phyir goms pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lan cig 'jug phyir goms pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is used once and because it is familiar,

original: phyes kyang @275b shes phyir de bzhin du //
analyzed: phyes kyang @275b shes phyir de bzhin du //
translated: Even if it is divided, it is so because it is cognized.

original: mnyan bya yin phyir sgra nyid bzhin //
analyzed: mnyan bya yin phyir sgra nyid bzhin //
translated: It is like sound itself, because it is heard.

original: sgra ni rtag par shes par bya //
analyzed: sgra ni rtag par shes par bya //
translated: Sound is cognized as permanent.

original: lkog shal dang rnga ma dang nog dang rmig pa dang / rva dang ldan pa'i ril po la lan cig ba lang zhes brjod pa na yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin gyi brjod pa gnyis pa la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: lkog shal dang rnga ma dang nog dang rmig pa dang / rva dang ldan pa'i ril po la lan cig ba lang zhes brjod pa na yid ches pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin gyi brjod pa gnyis pa la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: When the whole that possesses a dewlap, a tail, a hump, hooves, and horns is called “an ox,” confidence arises, but it does not depend on a second expression.

original: gang gi phyir rig byed la sogs pa yang dang yang du goms par byas shing 'dris par byas pa las brjed pa med pa 'byor bas don dang bcas par rtag tu sems la gnas pa'i phyir dang / sngon ming dang 'brel par yongs su shes pa de yang phrad cing mthong bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig byed la sogs pa yang dang yang du goms par byas shing 'dris par byas pa las brjed pa med pa 'byor bas don dang bcas par rtag tu sems la gnas pa'i phyir dang / sngon ming dang 'brel par yongs su shes pa de yang phrad cing mthong bar gyur pa na /
translated: Because the Vedas and so on are repeatedly cultivated and familiarized, they are always present in the mind with meaning through the mastery of nonforgetting, and because when that which is previously known in connection with a name meets and is seen,

original: lha sbyin de nyid 'di yin no zhes shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: lha sbyin de nyid 'di yin no zhes shes pa 'byung ba'i phyir dang / rtag tu rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: the cognition “that very one is Devadatta” arises, and because it is always apprehended by the ear faculty,🔽it is like sound.

original: dbang po gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po gzhan gyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not apprehended by any other sense faculty.

original: de la sgra ni chos can no //
analyzed: de la sgra ni chos can no //
translated: Sound is the subject.

original: rtag pa nyid ni de'i chos so //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ni de'i chos so //
translated: Permanence is its property.

original: chos dang chos can bsdoms pa ni phyogs so //
analyzed: chos dang chos can bsdoms pa ni phyogs so //
translated: The combination of the property and the subject is the position.

original: lan cig gis 'jug pa dang goms pa dang / yang shes pa 'byung ba dang / mnyan par bya ba nyid ces bya ba bzhin ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lan cig gis 'jug pa dang goms pa dang / yang shes pa 'byung ba dang / mnyan par bya ba nyid ces bya ba bzhin ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is like “because of the arising of cognition from the mere engagement of the sense faculty and from habituation” or “because of being audible.”

original: sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: sgra nyid bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: The example is like “sound itself.”

original: ji ltar tha dad du chad cing gnas pa'i ba lang sngon po dang / ser po la sogs par dbye ba yod kyang ba lang nyid ces bya ba ni rdzas thams cad la thun mong du zhugs par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad du chad cing gnas pa'i ba lang sngon po dang / ser po la sogs par dbye ba yod kyang ba lang nyid ces bya ba ni rdzas thams cad la thun mong du zhugs par gyur pa yin la /
translated: Just as a cow is a universal that pervades all individual cows, such as a blue cow, a yellow cow, and so on, which are distinct and remain separate,

original: ba lang gi rdzas ni tha dad du yod pa de bzhin du sgra nyid ces bya ba yang rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: ba lang gi rdzas ni tha dad du yod pa de bzhin du sgra nyid ces bya ba yang rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: in the same way, sound itself is permanent.

original: rtag tu sgra dang 'brel pa yin pas de bzhin du sgra yang rtag pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di lta bu ni rig byed kyi lung nyid las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu sgra dang 'brel pa yin pas de bzhin du sgra yang rtag pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di lta bu ni rig byed kyi lung nyid las shes par bya'o //
translated: and since it is always related to sound, sound also must be permanent.

original: gang yang sangs rgyas pas lung gi rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su gtogs so zhes btags pa de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang sangs rgyas pas lung gi rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su gtogs so zhes btags pa de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: But the assertion of the Buddhist that the Vedas are included in inference is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because🔽Direct perception, inference,

original: mngon sum rjes su dpag pa dang // sgra las byung dang nyer 'jal bcas //
analyzed: mngon sum rjes su dpag pa dang // sgra las byung dang nyer 'jal bcas //
translated: verbal testimony, analogy,🔽and presumption

original: don gyis go dang dngos med pa'i //🔽gtan tshigs bsgrub bya sgrub par byed //
analyzed: don gyis go dang dngos med pa'i // gtan tshigs bsgrub bya sgrub par byed //
translated: are the means of knowing the truth.

original: ces bya ba dag 'di skad kyang smra bar nus te /
analyzed: ces bya ba dag 'di skad kyang smra bar nus te /
translated: One can also say this:

original: 'di ni rjes dpag las tha dad //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes dpag las tha dad //
translated: This is different from inference,

original: tshad ma yin phyir gzhan de bzhin //🔽yang na gcig dang du ma'i yul //
analyzed: tshad ma yin phyir gzhan de bzhin // yang na gcig dang du ma'i yul //
translated: because it is a means of knowing, like the others.

original: rtogs par gyur pa ji bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs par gyur pa ji bzhin no //
translated: Or, it is like the cognition of the one and the many,🔽which is different from inference.

original: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan yin @276a * //
analyzed: lung ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan yin @276a * //
translated: Verbal testimony is different from inference.

original: te ; tshad ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no //
analyzed: te ; tshad ma yin pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin no //
translated: because it is a valid cognition, like the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: yang na mngon sum ni dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir yul gcig gi don rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: yang na mngon sum ni dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir yul gcig gi don rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, direct perception is the understanding of the meaning of a single object because it observes the particular of a thing.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir yul du ma'i don rtogs pa yin pa de bzhin du lung yang thar pa zhes bya ba gcig gi don dang mtho ris la sogs pa du ma'i don yang rtogs par 'gyur ba yin pas
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi yul can yin pa'i phyir yul du ma'i don rtogs pa yin pa de bzhin du lung yang thar pa zhes bya ba gcig gi don dang mtho ris la sogs pa du ma'i don yang rtogs par 'gyur ba yin pas
translated: Inference is the understanding of the meaning of many objects because it has a universal for its object. Likewise, scripture is the understanding of the meaning of one thing, such as liberation, and the meaning of many things, such as heaven.

original: de'i phyir / lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te /🔽mngon sum bzhin du yul gcig gi don rtogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / lung ni rjes su dpag pa las don gzhan du gyur pa yin te / mngon sum bzhin du yul gcig gi don rtogs pa yang yin no //
translated: Therefore, scripture is a different object than inference,🔽and like direct perception, it is the understanding of the meaning of a single object.

original: rjes su dpag pa bzhin du yul du ma'i don rtogs pa yang yin no //🔽gzhan yang / rtags dang 'brel pa ma mthong ba'i //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bzhin du yul du ma'i don rtogs pa yang yin no // gzhan yang / rtags dang 'brel pa ma mthong ba'i //
translated: And like inference, it is the understanding of the meaning of many objects.🔽Moreover,

original: dngos don blo yi rgyu phyir ram //
analyzed: dngos don blo yi rgyu phyir ram //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition of a thing that is not seen to be related to a reason,

original: yang na tha dad blo bskyed pa'i //
analyzed: yang na tha dad blo bskyed pa'i //
translated: or because it generates a different cognition,

original: rgyur gyur pa nyid yin phyir ro //🔽ma mthong ba yang de yin la //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa nyid yin phyir ro // ma mthong ba yang de yin la //
translated: because it is the cause of that.🔽It is not seen,

original: rtags kyang de yin pas rtags ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rtags kyang de yin pas rtags ma mthong ba'o //
translated: and it is also a reason, so it is a reason that is not seen.

original: de dang 'brel pa gang la ma mthong ba de ni rtags dang 'brel pa ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa gang la ma mthong ba de ni rtags dang 'brel pa ma mthong ba ste /
translated: That which is related to it is related to the reason that is not seen.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: Whose?

original: mtho ris la sogs pa'i dngos po'i don gyi'o //
analyzed: mtho ris la sogs pa'i dngos po'i don gyi'o //
translated: The meaning of the thing that is heaven, etc.

original: gang la rtags dang 'brel ba'i dngos po'i don ma mthong ba'i blo yod pa de ni rtags dang 'brel ba'i dngos po'i don ma mthong ba'i blo can no //
analyzed: gang la rtags dang 'brel ba'i dngos po'i don ma mthong ba'i blo yod pa de ni rtags dang 'brel ba'i dngos po'i don ma mthong ba'i blo can no //
translated: One who has a mind that does not see the meaning of the thing that is related to the reason is one who has a mind that does not see the meaning of the thing that is related to the reason.

original: de'i rgyu'i ngo bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyu'i ngo bor gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the cause of that.

original: rtags dang 'brel pa ma mthong ba'i //
analyzed: rtags dang 'brel pa ma mthong ba'i //
translated: The reason that is not seen

original: dngos don blo yi rgyu phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos don blo yi rgyu phyir ro //
translated: is the cause of the mind that is the meaning of the thing.

original: zhes bya ba'o //🔽blo gang la tha dad pa'i spyod yul yod pa de ni /🔽tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // blo gang la tha dad pa'i spyod yul yod pa de ni / tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo yin no //
translated: This is what it says.🔽That which has a different object is🔽a mind that has a different object.

original: tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo dag skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo dag skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa ni /
translated: That which becomes the cause of the arising of minds that have different objects

original: tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo dag skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo dag skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin te /
translated: The reason is that the cognition of a different object arises.

original: de lta bas na tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir lung ni rjes su dpog pa las gzhan yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir lung ni rjes su dpog pa las gzhan yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because the reason is the arising of the cognition of a different object, scripture is known to be different from inference.

original: sngon med pa yang bya bas gsal //
analyzed: sngon med pa yang bya bas gsal //
translated: The unseen is also manifested by action.

original: thar pa'ang bya ba sgrub par byed //
analyzed: thar pa'ang bya ba sgrub par byed //
translated: Liberation is also accomplished by action.

original: mkhas gang zla ba'i btung sogs kyis //
analyzed: mkhas gang zla ba'i btung sogs kyis //
translated: The wise one, by drinking the moon, etc.,

original: mthar byed pa las nges par rgyal //
analyzed: mthar byed pa las nges par rgyal //
translated: is certainly victorious over the end-maker.

original: sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni chos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon med pa zhes bya ba ni chos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The unseen is the meaning of the term “dharma.”

original: de yang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya bas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya bas gsal bar byed do //
translated: And that is manifested by the action of sacrifice, etc.

original: sngon med pa gsal bar byed @276b pa'i bya ba de ni thar pa sgrub par gyur pa yang yin no //
analyzed: sngon med pa gsal bar byed @276b pa'i bya ba de ni thar pa sgrub par gyur pa yang yin no //
translated: That action which manifests the unseen also accomplishes liberation.

original: gang gi phyir zla ba btung ba la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i bya ba de dag nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa de mthar byed pa las rnam par rgyal zhing 'chi ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zla ba btung ba la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i bya ba de dag nyid kyis rnal 'byor pa de mthar byed pa las rnam par rgyal zhing 'chi ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: Because by those actions exemplified by drinking the moon and so on, that yogin conquers the end of life and becomes immortal.

original: ji ltar zla ba 'thungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zla ba 'thungs so //
translated: He drinks the moon.

original: 'chi ba med par gyur to //
analyzed: 'chi ba med par gyur to //
translated: He becomes immortal.

original: skye ba med pa'i ye shes su gyur to //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i ye shes su gyur to //
translated: He becomes the pristine wisdom of nonarising.

original: de lta bu ni rig byed shes pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni rig byed shes pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: Such is the knowledge of the Vedas.

original: yang de lta bur rig byed la smras pa rnams ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang de lta bur rig byed la smras pa rnams ni 'di yin te /
translated: Moreover, those who speak of the Vedas in this way say:

original: drang srong lhas bsten dam pas 'dod //
analyzed: drang srong lhas bsten dam pas 'dod //
translated: The supreme god attended by the gods

original: lam snying bzang po rig don 'di //
analyzed: lam snying bzang po rig don 'di //
translated: knows this meaning of the good, pure path.

original: phyi rol dmangs rigs bud med gzugs //
analyzed: phyi rol dmangs rigs bud med gzugs //
translated: The form of the external, low-caste woman

original: 'dzin pas rigs ldan gsum 'di spangs //
analyzed: 'dzin pas rigs ldan gsum 'di spangs //
translated: is abandoned by the three castes.

original: lha tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams dang / nga /
analyzed: lha tshangs pa la sogs pa rnams dang / nga /
translated: The gods, Brahmā, and so on,

original: rga dang / 'ba' shistha la sogs pa thub pa rnams kyis bsten pa dang / dam pa ste mkhas pa rnams kyis 'dod par gyur pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rga dang / 'ba' shistha la sogs pa thub pa rnams kyis bsten pa dang / dam pa ste mkhas pa rnams kyis 'dod par gyur pa 'di ni /
translated: This is the essence of the Veda, because it has been practiced for a long time by the sages, such as

original: dus ring po nas 'jug pa yin pas snying po'o //
analyzed: dus ring po nas 'jug pa yin pas snying po'o //
translated: Arvāvasu, Āpas, and Śvetaketu, and is desired by the holy ones, that is, the wise.

original: bgrod par bya bas na lam mo //
analyzed: bgrod par bya bas na lam mo //
translated: It is a path because it is to be traversed.

original: dga' ba bskyed pas na bzang po'o //
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed pas na bzang po'o //
translated: It is good because it generates joy.

original: rigs pas 'thad pas na rigs pa dang ldan pa'i rig byed kyi don ni phyi rol du gyur pa bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin pa dmangs rigs sangs rgyas pa zhes bya bas lam gsum po de spong bar byed do //
analyzed: rigs pas 'thad pas na rigs pa dang ldan pa'i rig byed kyi don ni phyi rol du gyur pa bud med kyi gzugs 'dzin pa dmangs rigs sangs rgyas pa zhes bya bas lam gsum po de spong bar byed do //
translated: The meaning of the Veda that is tenable by reason is rejected by the outsider who holds the form of a woman, the Buddhist called a caṇḍāla.

original: snyan dngags dang / mchod sbyin dang / srid srung zhes bya ba gsum po de nyid gsum yin la de rnams kyis ni sems can gyi don yang bsdus shing grub pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi yang rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: snyan dngags dang / mchod sbyin dang / srid srung zhes bya ba gsum po de nyid gsum yin la de rnams kyis ni sems can gyi don yang bsdus shing grub pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi yang rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The three, namely, poetry, sacrifice, and statecraft, are the three Vedas, and they include the welfare of sentient beings and are the root of all tenets.

original: ci ltar zhe na /🔽'di la gang yod gzhan la yod //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / 'di la gang yod gzhan la yod //
translated: How is that?🔽Whatever exists in this world exists in others.

original: 'di la gang med 'ga' la'ang med //
analyzed: 'di la gang med 'ga' la'ang med //
translated: Whatever does not exist in this world does not exist in others.

original: chos la sogs pa bzhi po yang //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa bzhi po yang //
translated: The four, Dharma and so on,

original: de nyid gzhan na'ang mthong ba min //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan na'ang mthong ba min //
translated: are not seen in any other system.

original: gang cung zhig chos dang 'dod pa dang / don dang thar pa zhes bya ba bzhi por brjod pa rig byed 'di la yod pa de dag nyid grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la yang yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang cung zhig chos dang 'dod pa dang / don dang thar pa zhes bya ba bzhi por brjod pa rig byed 'di la yod pa de dag nyid grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la yang yod pa yin gyi /
translated: Whatever is called the four, Dharma, desire, purpose, and liberation, exists in this Veda alone.

original: gang yang rig byed la med pa de ni mu stegs gzhan gang la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rig byed la med pa de ni mu stegs gzhan gang la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Whatever does not exist in the Veda does not exist in any other tīrthika system.

original: de bas na chos dang / 'dod pa dang / don dang / thar pa zhes bya ba bzhi po'i sten du gyur pa ni rig byed 'ba' zhig kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chos dang / 'dod pa dang / don dang / thar pa zhes bya ba bzhi po'i sten du gyur pa ni rig byed 'ba' zhig kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore the Veda alone is the basis of the four, Dharma, desire, purpose, and liberation.

original: gzhan yang / gtan tshigs @277a * //🔽smra bas gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gtan tshigs @277a * // smra bas gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: Moreover,🔽the logician refutes the three paths

original: lam gsum po ni sun 'byin te //
analyzed: lam gsum po ni sun 'byin te //
translated: with logic,

original: rjes su dpag pa gtsor gyur phyir //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gtsor gyur phyir //
translated: because inference is primary.

original: rang gi lugs ni gsal byed gang //
analyzed: rang gi lugs ni gsal byed gang //
translated: Whatever clarifies one’s own system

original: lam gsum zhes bya bar grags pa ste /
analyzed: lam gsum zhes bya bar grags pa ste /
translated: is known as the three paths.

original: gtan tshigs kyis sun dbyung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis sun dbyung bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not refute with logic.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: snying dang shes pa can gyi chos //
analyzed: snying dang shes pa can gyi chos //
translated: The Dharma of the wise is the heart,

original: yan lag dang bcas rig gso ba //🔽gnang bas grub pa bzhi po ni //
