original: 'das par ma gyur pa dang / phung po gsum pa dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum gyis 'tsho ba dang / 'jug pa pa dang / grangs can gyi rnal 'byor can dang / 'ug pa pa dang / nags na gnas pa dang / be'i khan sa ba dang /
analyzed: 'das par ma gyur pa dang / phung po gsum pa dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum gyis 'tsho ba dang / 'jug pa pa dang / grangs can gyi rnal 'byor can dang / 'ug pa pa dang / nags na gnas pa dang / be'i khan sa ba dang /
translated: the past, the three aggregates, the two, the three-lived, the engaged, the Sāṃkhya yogis, the owl practitioners, the forest dwellers, the Vālakhilya ascetics,

original: ba la khi lya ba dang ; tshangs par spyod pa dang / spyod pa po dang / phyugs bdag pa dang / goo ta ma pa dang / zhib ma can dang / shin tu khrus byas pa dang / mtshe'u'i 'gram na gnas pa dang / 'tsho ba pa dang /
analyzed: ba la khi lya ba dang ; tshangs par spyod pa dang / spyod pa po dang / phyugs bdag pa dang / goo ta ma pa dang / zhib ma can dang / shin tu khrus byas pa dang / mtshe'u'i 'gram na gnas pa dang / 'tsho ba pa dang /
translated: the celibate, the practitioners, the cattle herders, the Gautamas, the refined, the well-washed, the lake-dwellers, the livelihood practitioners,

original: 'khor ba las grol ba dang / thog ma pa dang / 'thor byed pa dang / ba ra dhva dza pa dang / pa sha'i grangs can pa dang / ba tan dza la pa dang / lha mchod pa pa dang / gzhan la mi 'dud pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba las grol ba dang / thog ma pa dang / 'thor byed pa dang / ba ra dhva dza pa dang / pa sha'i grangs can pa dang / ba tan dza la pa dang / lha mchod pa pa dang / gzhan la mi 'dud pa dang /
translated: the liberated from saṃsāra, the original, the Saṃkhyas, the Bādarāyaṇas, the Pāśa Sāṃkhyas, the Bātanajalas, the worshipers of the gods, the non-bowers to others,

original: gos kyi dum bu can dang / 'ug pa'i gshog pa can dang / lan gsum du chur 'jug pa dang / 'gal bar mi byed pa dang / mes po can dang / mkha' lding ba dang / khyim gyis ra ba na gnas pa pa dang /
analyzed: gos kyi dum bu can dang / 'ug pa'i gshog pa can dang / lan gsum du chur 'jug pa dang / 'gal bar mi byed pa dang / mes po can dang / mkha' lding ba dang / khyim gyis ra ba na gnas pa pa dang /
translated: the cloth-holder, the owl-wing holder, the triple-immersion, the non-violator, the grandfather, the sky-walker, the one who lives in a house,

original: mchog gi mchog pa dang / gcer bu ba nyen gyi bu pa dang / 'gengs byed pa dang / dge sbyong ba dang / ka ta ya'i bu dang / lhag spyod kyi bu dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs can dang / ri dags kyi brtul zhugs can dang /
analyzed: mchog gi mchog pa dang / gcer bu ba nyen gyi bu pa dang / 'gengs byed pa dang / dge sbyong ba dang / ka ta ya'i bu dang / lhag spyod kyi bu dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs can dang / ri dags kyi brtul zhugs can dang /
translated: the supreme of the supreme, the naked one, the son of Nyagrodha, the one who fills, the ascetic, the son of Katayana, the son of Udraka, the one with the cow practice, the one with the deer practice,

original: rta'i brtul zhugs can dang / @279a * //
analyzed: rta'i brtul zhugs can dang / @279a * //
translated: the one with the horse practice,

original: khyi'i brtul zhugs can dang / gsol ba mi 'debs pa'i brtul zhugs can dang / zhib po'i brtul zhugs can dang / me'i brtul zhugs can dang / gzhon nu'i brtul zhugs can dang / mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das par smra ba dang /
analyzed: khyi'i brtul zhugs can dang / gsol ba mi 'debs pa'i brtul zhugs can dang / zhib po'i brtul zhugs can dang / me'i brtul zhugs can dang / gzhon nu'i brtul zhugs can dang / mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das par smra ba dang /
translated: the one with the dog practice, the one with the practice of not begging, the one with the practice of thoroughness, the one with the fire practice, the one with the youth practice, and the one who advocates nirvana in this life.

original: chu las skyes pa'i phreng pa can dang / so'i gtun rdung can dang / rdo 'thag pa pa dang / yang dag par khrus byed pa dang / chos yang dag par lta ba dang / skyes nas dag pa dang / las kyis dag pa pa dang /
analyzed: chu las skyes pa'i phreng pa can dang / so'i gtun rdung can dang / rdo 'thag pa pa dang / yang dag par khrus byed pa dang / chos yang dag par lta ba dang / skyes nas dag pa dang / las kyis dag pa pa dang /
translated: The garland-bearer born from water, the one with a tooth-pestle, the one who grinds with a stone, the one who bathes properly, the one with correct view of phenomena, the one pure from birth, the one pure by action,🔽the one who makes a hole in water, the one in the wilderness, the one who views earth, water, fire, wind, and space as having mind, and so on—all these three hundred and sixty-three views come from a lineage and are uninterrupted.

original: chu la byi 'dzul byed pa dang / dgon pa pa dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' la sems yod par lta ba la sogs pa lta ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum po thams cad kyang brgyud nas 'ongs pa rgyun chad pa med pas thams cad kyang rang gi dam tshig las grags pa'i lung gi bsngags pa brjod pa la shin tu🔽dpa' bas rgol bar byed do //
analyzed: chu la byi 'dzul byed pa dang / dgon pa pa dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' la sems yod par lta ba la sogs pa lta ba sum brgya drug cu rtsa gsum po thams cad kyang brgyud nas 'ongs pa rgyun chad pa med pas thams cad kyang rang gi dam tshig las grags pa'i lung gi bsngags pa brjod pa la shin tu dpa' bas rgol bar byed do //
translated: Since all of them are very brave in praising the scriptures renowned from their own commitments, they argue.

original: de ltar gyur na lung thams cad kyang grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na lung thams cad kyang grub par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would follow that all scriptures would be established.

original: gal te 'di dag thams cad grub tu zad mod /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag thams cad grub tu zad mod /
translated: If it is said, “All of this may be established,

original: ser snas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: ser snas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: but what is the use of miserliness?”

original: de ni 'gal ba yang med do //
analyzed: de ni 'gal ba yang med do //
translated: But there is no contradiction here.

original: 'on kyang gang thams cad grub par gyur na de 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //🔽de lung gzhan thos par gyur pas blo gzhan bskyed par gyur pa'i rgol ba rnams 'di ni rigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang thams cad grub par gyur na de 'grub par mi 'gyur ro // de lung gzhan thos par gyur pas blo gzhan bskyed par gyur pa'i rgol ba rnams 'di ni rigs pa'o //
translated: However, if everything were established, then that would not be established.

original: 'di ni mi rigs pa'o zhes rtsod pa 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs pa'o zhes rtsod pa 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: When the opponent hears another scripture, another mind arises, and a dispute occurs: “This is reasonable,” and “This is unreasonable.”

original: gal te rigs pas rtag bzod pa'i //
analyzed: gal te rigs pas rtag bzod pa'i //
translated: If one can reasonably endure,

original: tshig gang yin pa de lung yin //
analyzed: tshig gang yin pa de lung yin //
translated: then that statement is scripture.

original: re zhig de nyid dpyad par bya //
analyzed: re zhig de nyid dpyad par bya //
translated: First, that must be investigated.

original: phyi nas de yis gang bstan pa'o //🔽brgyud nas 'ongs pa rgyun chad med pa bden du zin kyang ston pa rang gi tshig rigs pas brtag bzod pa yin par 'dod pa'i tshig de nyid re zhig 'di ltar ston pa ji lta bu zhig gis rigs pa gang gis 'di lta bu bstan pa yin zhes
analyzed: phyi nas de yis gang bstan pa'o // brgyud nas 'ongs pa rgyun chad med pa bden du zin kyang ston pa rang gi tshig rigs pas brtag bzod pa yin par 'dod pa'i tshig de nyid re zhig 'di ltar ston pa ji lta bu zhig gis rigs pa gang gis 'di lta bu bstan pa yin zhes
translated: Later, it is what is taught by that.🔽Even if it is true that the transmission is unbroken, it is asserted that the statement of the teacher himself is a statement that can withstand investigation by reasoning.

original: brtag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: brtag par bya ba yin la /
translated: First, it must be investigated in this way: “In what way did the teacher teach this? By what reasoning was this taught?”

original: phyi nas ni de'i tshig don cung zhig dang bcas par bstan pa de rnams kyang /
analyzed: phyi nas ni de'i tshig don cung zhig dang bcas par bstan pa de rnams kyang /
translated: But later, when the words and their meanings are taught,

original: ci brtag bzod pa zhig yin nam ma yin zhes dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci brtag bzod pa zhig yin nam ma yin zhes dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: they should be examined to see if they can withstand analysis.

original: ji ltar mi mkhas pa 'ga' zhig nor bu mching bu la /🔽yang dag pa'i rin po che yin no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar mi mkhas pa 'ga' zhig nor bu mching bu la / yang dag pa'i rin po che yin no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: For example, an ignorant person might think that a piece of glass🔽is a real gem.

original: de ni rin po che ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni rin po che ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: But it is only a gem-like thing,

original: bsregs dang bdar ba la sogs pa mi bzod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsregs dang bdar ba la sogs pa mi bzod pa'i phyir /
translated: because it cannot withstand the tests of being cut, polished, and so on.

original: mching bu yin no zhes bstan @279b pa bzhin zhes bsgrubs pa na de nyid yang lung yin no zhes sgrub par byed cing rtog pa ni rigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mching bu yin no zhes bstan @279b pa bzhin zhes bsgrubs pa na de nyid yang lung yin no zhes sgrub par byed cing rtog pa ni rigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not right to argue that the scriptures are valid because they are like the gem,

original: yang gang zhig bsreg pa dang bdar dang bzod pa'i gser bzang po bzhin du rnam par 'gyur ba med pa de ni lung yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang gang zhig bsreg pa dang bdar dang bzod pa'i gser bzang po bzhin du rnam par 'gyur ba med pa de ni lung yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but rather that they are valid because they are like a good gold that does not change when it is heated, cut, and rubbed.

original: 'di'i rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i rigs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning here?

original: de la de yi gnyen po'i phyir //
analyzed: de la de yi gnyen po'i phyir //
translated: The scriptures are valid because they are the antidote to that.

original: ye shes grol ba zhes 'dod de //
analyzed: ye shes grol ba zhes 'dod de //
translated: and that knowledge is liberation.

original: nad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the antidote to the illness,

original: sman gyis nad las grol ba nyid //
analyzed: sman gyis nad las grol ba nyid //
translated: medicine liberates from the illness.

original: ye shes ni grol ba yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' kun la rab tu grags pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: ye shes ni grol ba yin no zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' kun la rab tu grags pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Knowledge is liberation. This is a position that is well known in all philosophical systems.

original: de ni mi shes pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de ni mi shes pa'i mi mthun par gyur pa gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is: “because it is the antidote to ignorance.”

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nad kyi gnyen po nyid kyi sman gyis nad las grol bar byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: nad kyi gnyen po nyid kyi sman gyis nad las grol bar byed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like medicine, which liberates from the illness because it is the antidote to the illness.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / bya bas grol ba 'thob pa min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bya bas grol ba 'thob pa min //
translated: Liberation is not attained through action,

original: bya ba yin phyir zhing las bzhin //
analyzed: bya ba yin phyir zhing las bzhin //
translated: because it is an action, like farming.

original: blo ma yin phyir brjod bya'i phyir //
analyzed: blo ma yin phyir brjod bya'i phyir //
translated: It is not the intellect, because it is the object of expression,

original: cung zad dus can yin phyir yang //
analyzed: cung zad dus can yin phyir yang //
translated: and because it is momentary, like a seed.

original: 'bru dang / byo la song dang / mar dang / chung ma'i 'brel pa'i bya ba rnams kyis grol ba 'thob par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bru dang / byo la song dang / mar dang / chung ma'i 'brel pa'i bya ba rnams kyis grol ba 'thob par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Liberation is not attained through the actions of a seed, a bamboo plant, butter, or a wife.

original: bya ba yin pa'i phyir thong gshol gyi las kyi bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bya ba yin pa'i phyir thong gshol gyi las kyi bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is a human statement, like the statement of a plowman.🔽Moreover,🔽if you maintain that it is not a valid cognition

original: gzhan yang / skyes bu'i tshig gi skyon bcas phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / skyes bu'i tshig gi skyon bcas phyir //
translated: because the words of a human being are faulty,

original: tshad ma min par 'dod ce na //🔽gser rtog shes sogs tshig rnams kyi //
analyzed: tshad ma min par 'dod ce na // gser rtog shes sogs tshig rnams kyi //
translated: then the reason is not established,

original: gtan tshigs nyid ni ma nges 'gyur //
analyzed: gtan tshigs nyid ni ma nges 'gyur //
translated: because the words of one who knows gold, etc. are not faulty.

original: 'jig rten na skyes bu gang dag gi tshig la the tshom za bar 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten na skyes bu gang dag gi tshig la the tshom za bar 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: There are some human beings in the world whose words are doubted.

original: ji ltar chu dogs 'di na 'bras bu yod do zhes zer la /
analyzed: ji ltar chu dogs 'di na 'bras bu yod do zhes zer la /
translated: For example, someone might say, “There is a fruit in this water pot,”

original: brgya la ni yod kyang srid //
analyzed: brgya la ni yod kyang srid //
translated: but it is possible that there is one,

original: brgyal ni med kyang srid pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: brgyal ni med kyang srid pa lta bu'o //
translated: and it is possible that there is not.

original: yang gang dag gi tshig la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
analyzed: yang gang dag gi tshig la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur ba yang yod de /
translated: There are also some whose words are not doubted.

original: 'jig rten thams cad la tshad mar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gser la sogs pa rtog shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad la tshad mar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gser la sogs pa rtog shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the words of one who knows gold, etc., because they are authoritative for the whole world.

original: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin par nges par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin par nges par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the reason is not established.

original: skyes bu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is a person.

original: ci chu klung gi 'gram na 'bras bu yod do zhes smra bar byed pa'i skyes bu'i tshig tshad ma ma yin pa lta bu zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci chu klung gi 'gram na 'bras bu yod do zhes smra bar byed pa'i skyes bu'i tshig tshad ma ma yin pa lta bu zhig yin nam /
translated: Is the word of a person who says, “There are fruits on the bank of the river,” not a valid cognition?

original: 'on te gser rtog shes pa'i skyes bu la sogs pa'i tshig bzhin du 'di'i tshig tshad mar gyur pa nyid gcig yin zhes bya ba de lta @280a * //
analyzed: 'on te gser rtog shes pa'i skyes bu la sogs pa'i tshig bzhin du 'di'i tshig tshad mar gyur pa nyid gcig yin zhes bya ba de lta @280a * //
translated: Or is it like the words of a person who knows gold, etc.?

original: bu ni ma nges pa nyid yin no //🔽gal te skyes bu skyon gyis nyams par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bu ni ma nges pa nyid yin no // gal te skyes bu skyon gyis nyams par gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, it is not ascertained.

original: skyes bu'i tshig brdzun pa yin no zhes ni bdag mi smra'i /
analyzed: skyes bu'i tshig brdzun pa yin no zhes ni bdag mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that the words of a person are false because he is a person who is flawed.

original: 'on kyang byas pa nyid kyi phyir na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang byas pa nyid kyi phyir na'o //
translated: However, they are false because they are made.

original: rig byed ni 'dir byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rig byed ni 'dir byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The Vedas are valid because they are not made.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be stated.🔽If you prove that the Vedas are valid

original: 'on te byas pa min pa'i phyir //🔽rig byed tshad mar sgrub ce na //
analyzed: 'on te byas pa min pa'i phyir // rig byed tshad mar sgrub ce na //
translated: Because they are not made,🔽The reason is not common to both parties

original: gtan tshigs thun mong min nyid dang // ma grub pa yi don yang yin //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thun mong min nyid dang // ma grub pa yi don yang yin //
translated: And the meaning is not established.

original: rig byed ni byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed ni byas pa ma yin te /
translated: The Vedas are not a product.

original: byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have no author.

original: ji lta zhes dris na dpe yod pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji lta zhes dris na dpe yod pa ma yin pas gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: If you ask how, the answer is that there is no example of a product that is not a product. Therefore, the reason is not common to both parties.

original: sangs rgyas pa la ni byas pa ma yin pa cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin par grags pas de gzhan lam grub pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa la ni byas pa ma yin pa cung zhig kyang yod pa ma yin par grags pas de gzhan lam grub pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: But it is well known that Buddhists do not accept anything that is not a product. Therefore, the reason is not established for the other party.

original: gzhan yang khyod nyid kyi lung las kyang //🔽snyan dang gas ril snyan rig byas //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod nyid kyi lung las kyang // snyan dang gas ril snyan rig byas //
translated: Moreover, in your own scriptures it says:🔽The Vedas are heard by the ears.

original: srid srung ril srid rig byas //
analyzed: srid srung ril srid rig byas //
translated: The Vedas are heard by the whole body.

original: skal ldan gyis ni phug ron can //
analyzed: skal ldan gyis ni phug ron can //
translated: The fortunate one is the pigeon.

original: nges brjod aanggi ra sas byas //
analyzed: nges brjod aanggi ra sas byas //
translated: The Vedas were composed by Angiras.

original: zhes 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is this not what your scriptures say?

original: gal te / rjes su bstan yin skyon med do //
analyzed: gal te / rjes su bstan yin skyon med do //
translated: If you say that this is not a fault because the Vedas are a teaching,

original: zhe na sangs rgyas kyi'ang ma byas //
analyzed: zhe na sangs rgyas kyi'ang ma byas //
translated: then the Vedas were not composed by the Buddha.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rdzogs sangs rgyas //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rdzogs sangs rgyas //
translated: The perfect Buddhas of the past

original: ji ltar rtogs de gsal byas yin //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs de gsal byas yin //
translated: have made clear what they realized.

original: gal te rjes su bstan pa yin pas rig byed byas pa ma yin pa nyid yin no zhes khyed 'dod na sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di yang byas pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su bstan pa yin pas rig byed byas pa ma yin pa nyid yin no zhes khyed 'dod na sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di yang byas pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: If you assert that because it is a teaching it is not a product, then this statement of the Buddha is also not a product.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /🔽bstan pa de dag nyid yi ge mang nyung med pas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas kyis rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas / bstan pa de dag nyid yi ge mang nyung med pas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because the Buddha taught the same doctrine that the previous buddhas taught after attaining complete enlightenment.🔽The doctrine taught by the Bhagavat is the same doctrine taught by the previous buddhas, with no difference in the number of syllables.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung yang rjes su bstan pa yin gyi byas pa ni ma yin pas tshad ma nyid yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung yang rjes su bstan pa yin gyi byas pa ni ma yin pas tshad ma nyid yin no /
translated: Therefore, because the Buddha’s words are a teaching and not a product, they are valid.

original: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i snying po'i 'grel pa rtog ge 'bar ba /
translated: The Blaze of Reasoning, a commentary on the Essence of the Middle Way

original: bam po nyi shu bzhi pa /🔽byas pa nyid du rjes dpag pas //
analyzed: bam po nyi shu bzhi pa / byas pa nyid du rjes dpag pas //
translated: Chapter XXIV🔽Inference from the effect

original: phyogs la rjes su dpag pas gnod //
analyzed: phyogs la rjes su dpag pas gnod //
translated: is undermined by inference from the nature of things.

original: byed po mi dran ma grub pas //
analyzed: byed po mi dran ma grub pas //
translated: Since the creator is not remembered,

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub nyid //
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni ma grub nyid //
translated: this reason is not established.

original: rig byed byas pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par mi nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rig byed byas pa ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub par mi nus pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is impossible to prove that the Vedas are not a product.

original: ji skad smra bar yang mi nus te /
analyzed: ji skad smra bar yang mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to say that it is.

original: rig byed ni tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed ni tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The Vedas are not a valid means of knowledge,

original: byas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are produced.

original: grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig bzhin no //
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig bzhin no //
translated: Like the words of the Sāṃkhya and so on.

original: gang yang rig byed @280b ma byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rig byed @280b ma byas pa yin te /
translated: Some say, “The Vedas are not produced,🔽because we do not remember their author.”

original: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes zer ba de la yang dgon pa stong pa na yod pa'i khron pa bzhin du /
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran pa'i phyir zhes zer ba de la yang dgon pa stong pa na yod pa'i khron pa bzhin du /
translated: But we would say that, like a well in an empty wilderness,

original: byed pa po mi dran du zin kyang byed pa po yod pa nyid yin pas bdag dang gzhan la don ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa po mi dran du zin kyang byed pa po yod pa nyid yin pas bdag dang gzhan la don ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: even though we do not remember the author, the author exists. Therefore, the meaning of “self” and “other” is not established.

original: gzhan yang gal te sngags kyi byed po sngon //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sngags kyi byed po sngon //
translated: Moreover, if the author of the Vedas

original: sngags dang bcas par byung gyur pas //
analyzed: sngags dang bcas par byung gyur pas //
translated: appeared in the past with the Vedas,

original: byed pos byas kyang ma byas par //
analyzed: byed pos byas kyang ma byas par //
translated: then even though the author created them,🔽you say that they are not created.

original: khyod kyis bstan bcos sngon 'dod pas //
analyzed: khyod kyis bstan bcos sngon 'dod pas //
translated: But you assert that the treatise existed in the past.

original: gal te kho bo cag gi sngags kyi byed pa po ni skye dgu'i bdag po yin pa de ni sngags dang lhan cig tu byung ba yin pas de'i phyir des byas su zin kyang ma byas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kho bo cag gi sngags kyi byed pa po ni skye dgu'i bdag po yin pa de ni sngags dang lhan cig tu byung ba yin pas de'i phyir des byas su zin kyang ma byas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the creator of the mantra is Prajapati, because he exists simultaneously with the mantra, therefore, even though he is the creator, he is not the creator.

original: de dang lhan cig byung bcas phyir //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig byung bcas phyir //
translated: Because he exists simultaneously with it,

original: skye ba dran pas smras pa bzhin //
analyzed: skye ba dran pas smras pa bzhin //
translated: like one who remembers his previous lives.

original: bstan bcos byed po dang bcas na //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed po dang bcas na //
translated: If the treatise has a creator,

original: 'di ltar ci phyir smra mi byed //
analyzed: 'di ltar ci phyir smra mi byed //
translated: why does it not speak like that?

original: sngags zlos pa dang bcas bzhin du skye dgu'i bdag po skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: sngags zlos pa dang bcas bzhin du skye dgu'i bdag po skyes pa yin na /
translated: If Prajapati was born simultaneously with the recitation of the mantra,

original: ci'i phyir 'di 'di'i byed pa por mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di 'di'i byed pa por mi 'gyur /
translated: why is he not the creator of that?

original: ji ltar skye ba dran pa cung zhig smra ba dang bcas bzhin du skye bar gyur pa na de la skye ba dran pas byas pa zhes rjod par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar skye ba dran pa cung zhig smra ba dang bcas bzhin du skye bar gyur pa na de la skye ba dran pas byas pa zhes rjod par byed do //
translated: Just as one who remembers his previous lives speaks like that, when he is born, he is said to be created by the memory of his previous lives.

original: de bzhin du gal te skye dgu'i bdag po sngags brjod pa dang bcas par skye bar gyur pas de byas pa yin bzhin du ma byas pa zhes ji ltar brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te skye dgu'i bdag po sngags brjod pa dang bcas par skye bar gyur pas de byas pa yin bzhin du ma byas pa zhes ji ltar brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise, if the lord of beings were born with the recitation of mantras, how could it be said that he is not the creator even though he is the creator?

original: rtogs dang rjes su mthun phyir ram //
analyzed: rtogs dang rjes su mthun phyir ram //
translated: Because it is in conformity with the realization,

original: de bzhin yi ge'i lugs ldan phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin yi ge'i lugs ldan phyir //
translated: and because it has the same order of syllables,

original: rig byed tshig rnams gzung bya min //
analyzed: rig byed tshig rnams gzung bya min //
translated: the words of the Vedas are not to be accepted.

original: byed po skyes bu min nam ci //🔽rig byed kyi tshig ni skyes bus byas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: byed po skyes bu min nam ci // rig byed kyi tshig ni skyes bus byas pa nyid yin te /
translated: Is the creator not a person?

original: yi ges rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / yi ges rjes su phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / yi ge'i lugs dang ldan pa'i phyir grangs can la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: yi ges rtogs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / yi ges rjes su phan 'dogs pa'i phyir dang / yi ge'i lugs dang ldan pa'i phyir grangs can la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: The words of the Vedas are created by a person because they are to be understood through syllables, because they are assisted by syllables, and because they have the same order of syllables, like the Sāṃkhya and so on.

original: ji ltar 'dir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir /
translated: Here it is said:

original: lte ba'i phyogs na gnas pa'i srog gi rlung steng du 'byung bar byed pa na snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / mgo bo dang / mtshog ma dang / sna'i rtse mo dang / so dang / mchu la sogs pa'i gnas rnams la thug bar gyur pa dang /
analyzed: lte ba'i phyogs na gnas pa'i srog gi rlung steng du 'byung bar byed pa na snying ga dang / mgrin pa dang / mgo bo dang / mtshog ma dang / sna'i rtse mo dang / so dang / mchu la sogs pa'i gnas rnams la thug bar gyur pa dang /
translated: When the life-force vāyu that resides in the navel area moves upward, it reaches the heart, the throat, the head, the fontanel, the tip of the nose, the teeth, the lips, and so on.

original: byed pa dang / 'bad pa'i rkyen tshogs par gyur bas ka la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams bskyed nas /🔽bdag dang gzhan rnams kyis yi ge'i cha rtogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rig byed kyi tshig kyang 'bad pas bskyed nas yi ge'i @281a * //
analyzed: byed pa dang / 'bad pa'i rkyen tshogs par gyur bas ka la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams bskyed nas / bdag dang gzhan rnams kyis yi ge'i cha rtogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rig byed kyi tshig kyang 'bad pas bskyed nas yi ge'i @281a * //
translated: When the conditions of the effort of the vāyu and the mind coming together generate the syllables such as ka,🔽the recognition of the parts of the syllables arises in oneself and others.

original: cha rtogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: cha rtogs pa skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the words of the Vedas are generated through effort and the recognition of the parts of the syllables arises.

original: ji ltar skyes bu'i tshig yi ger sgrub pa la rjes su mthun pa yin pa de bzhin du rig byed kyi tshig kyang yi ger mngon par grub pa la rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu'i tshig yi ger sgrub pa la rjes su mthun pa yin pa de bzhin du rig byed kyi tshig kyang yi ger mngon par grub pa la rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: Just as the words of a person are suitable for establishing syllables, the words of the Vedas are also suitable for establishing syllables.

original: yang na ji ltar grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig rnams yi ge brjod pa'i rim gyis 'don par byed pa de bzhin du rig byed kyi tshig kyang yin no //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar grangs can la sogs pa'i tshig rnams yi ge brjod pa'i rim gyis 'don par byed pa de bzhin du rig byed kyi tshig kyang yin no //
translated: Or, just as the words of the Sāṃkhya and so on are recited through the sequence of enunciated syllables, so too are the words of the Vedas.

original: des na 'di skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa yin zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: des na 'di skyes bus byas pa ma yin pa yin zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin /
translated: In that case, how could it be said that the Vedas are not created by a person?

original: gnas dang / byed pa dang / 'bad pa la sogs pa gang dag gis yi ge mngon par bsgrubs pa las rjes su dpag nas ma skyes pa'i yi ge ni yod pa ma yin pas rig byed ni skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ma grub la /
analyzed: gnas dang / byed pa dang / 'bad pa la sogs pa gang dag gis yi ge mngon par bsgrubs pa las rjes su dpag nas ma skyes pa'i yi ge ni yod pa ma yin pas rig byed ni skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ma grub la /
translated: Since it is inferred that syllables are produced through the effort of abiding, acting, and striving, and so on, and since there are no unborn syllables, it is not established that the Vedas are not created by a person.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba dang grags pas kyang gnod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba dang grags pas kyang gnod pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also undermined by inference and what is commonly acknowledged.

original: 'jig rten na ni skye dgu'i 'bad pa la ltos nas yi ge mngon par 'grub pa mthong gi / glo bur du nam mkha'am ri la sogs pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni skye dgu'i 'bad pa la ltos nas yi ge mngon par 'grub pa mthong gi / glo bur du nam mkha'am ri la sogs pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: In the world, the production of syllables is seen to depend on the effort of living beings, but not suddenly from space, mountains, and so on.

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: rig byed skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brtags pa tsam kho na yin no //
analyzed: rig byed skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni brtags pa tsam kho na yin no //
translated: The assertion that the Vedas are not the work of a person is mere postulation.

original: 'dis kyang rig byed tshig rnams ni //
analyzed: 'dis kyang rig byed tshig rnams ni //
translated: And this shows that the words of the Vedas

original: skyes bus byas pa yin par 'dod //🔽brjod 'dod don gyi blo skye ba'i //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa yin par 'dod // brjod 'dod don gyi blo skye ba'i //
translated: are the work of a person.🔽Because they are the cause of the arising of the cognition

original: rgyu phyir 'dod pa spyod pa bzhin //
analyzed: rgyu phyir 'dod pa spyod pa bzhin //
translated: of the object that one wishes to express, like the use of words.

original: brjod par 'dod pa ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don to //
translated: The object that one wishes to express is the object that one wishes to express.

original: de la brjod par 'dod pa'i don gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu ni brjod 'dod don gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la brjod par 'dod pa'i don gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu ni brjod 'dod don gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of the arising of the cognition of the object that one wishes to express is the cause of the arising of the cognition of the object that one wishes to express.

original: de'i phyir dngos po ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po ni brjod par 'dod pa'i don gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the thing is the cause of the arising of the cognition of the object that one wishes to express.

original: de'i phyir na /🔽brjod 'dod don gyi blo skye ba'i //
analyzed: de'i phyir na / brjod 'dod don gyi blo skye ba'i //
translated: Therefore,🔽because they are the cause of the arising of the cognition

original: rgyu phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: of the object that one wishes to express,🔽like the use of words.

original: dper na 'dod pa dang / brjod pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa bsams shing 'dod pa ni don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa dang / brjod pa dang / 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa bsams shing 'dod pa ni don zhes bya ste /
translated: For example, the object is called the object that one wishes to express, because it is thought of and desired in the use of words, in the expression of desire, in going, in coming, and so on.

original: de lta bu'i gtan tshigs yod pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gtan tshigs yod pa yin no zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like saying, There is such a reason.

original: de bzhin du chu sa mkha' zhes bya ba ni chu dang / sa dang nam mkha'i don mngon par brjod pa can gyi tshig yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du chu sa mkha' zhes bya ba ni chu dang / sa dang nam mkha'i don mngon par brjod pa can gyi tshig yin la /
translated: Similarly, water, earth, space are words that express the meanings of water, earth, and space.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rig byed kyang brjod pa'i don gyi blo skyed ba'i rgyu yin pas ji ltar na 'di skyes bus byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i rig byed kyang brjod pa'i don gyi blo skyed ba'i rgyu yin pas ji ltar na 'di skyes bus byas pa ma yin /
translated: Since such Vedic texts are also the cause for generating the cognition of the expressed meaning, how could they not be created by a person?

original: yang bstan bcos phal cher ni skyes bu dam pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: yang bstan bcos phal cher ni skyes bu dam pas byas pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, most treatises are composed by holy beings,

original: dge ba'i chos kun du sdud pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kun du sdud pa'i phyir //
translated: because they gather all virtuous dharmas.

original: khyad par du skyes bu mi bzad pas byas @281b pa ;
analyzed: khyad par du skyes bu mi bzad pas byas @281b pa ;
translated: In particular, treatises composed by excellent beings

original: rig byed 'di ni gzhal bya ste //
analyzed: rig byed 'di ni gzhal bya ste //
translated: are to be evaluated.

original: 'byung po 'tshe dang chang 'thung brdzun //
analyzed: 'byung po 'tshe dang chang 'thung brdzun //
translated: Because they harm beings, drink alcohol, and lie,

original: smra phyir ma ga'i bstan bcos bzhin //
analyzed: smra phyir ma ga'i bstan bcos bzhin //
translated: they are like the treatises of Magha.

original: ma ga la sogs pa phyin ci log gi brtul zhugs can /
analyzed: ma ga la sogs pa phyin ci log gi brtul zhugs can /
translated: Magha and others have distorted observances.

original: par sig la sogs kla klo'i gnas na gnas pa de dag gi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di ltar grags te sa la gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: par sig la sogs kla klo'i gnas na gnas pa de dag gi grub pa'i mtha' ni 'di ltar grags te sa la gnod pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The tenets of the Persians and other barbarians are renowned as follows:

original: grog ma la sogs pa bsad pa ni chos ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grog ma la sogs pa bsad pa ni chos ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Because they harm the earth, killing ants and so on is not a nonvirtue.

original: ba lang bsad na rva brtsegs pa la brten nas mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang bsad na rva brtsegs pa la brten nas mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one kills a cow, one will go to the higher rebirths by relying on the peak of the roof.🔽Similarly, if one fumigates the heart of an animal with smoke, one will be reborn in the higher realms of space.

original: de bzhin du phyugs kyi snying bsregs pas bdugs na gnas mthon po gong ma'i nam mkhar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu dang ; de bzhin du bud med thams cad ni gtun dang / me tog dang 'bras bu dang g-yos zin pa'i zas dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyugs kyi snying bsregs pas bdugs na gnas mthon po gong ma'i nam mkhar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba lta bu dang ; de bzhin du bud med thams cad ni gtun dang / me tog dang 'bras bu dang g-yos zin pa'i zas dang /
translated: Similarly, all women are mortars, flowers, fruits, and cooked food.

original: khrus bya ba'i 'bab stegs dang / lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang 'dra ba yin bsam dang / sring mo dang / bu mo la sogs pa la bgrod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ba ni legs pa ma yin no zhes smra bar byed pa'i ma ga'i grub pa'i mtha' de dang rig byed la khyad par ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: khrus bya ba'i 'bab stegs dang / lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang 'dra ba yin bsam dang / sring mo dang / bu mo la sogs pa la bgrod par bya ba ma yin no zhes zer ba ni legs pa ma yin no zhes smra bar byed pa'i ma ga'i grub pa'i mtha' de dang rig byed la khyad par ci zhig yod de /
translated: What is the difference between this view of the Mimaṃsakas and the Vedas?

original: gang gi phyir rig byed pas smras pa /

analyzed: gal te sngags sngon song ba'i las //

original: der ni dge  'dod gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: der ni dge  'dod gzhan ma yin //

original: zhe na lung ni 'dra ba la //
analyzed: zhe na lung ni 'dra ba la //
translated: If you say that the scriptures are similar,

analyzed: gtan tshigs khyad par smra dgos so // gal te srog chags sngags btab pas //
translated: you must state a special reason.🔽If a living being is bound

original: gang yang bcing ba ma byas la //
analyzed: gang yang bcing ba ma byas la //
translated: by a mantra, without being bound,

original: g-yo ba med par bya zhe na //
analyzed: g-yo ba med par bya zhe na //

original: de lta na yang khyad par med //
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par med //
translated: then even so, there is no difference.

original: gang phyir sgo kun bsubs nas ni //
analyzed: gang phyir sgo kun bsubs nas ni //
translated: Because, having closed all the doors,🔽the powerless animals are seized

original: bzung nas nus med byol song dag / mtshon cha rnon pos gsod pa la //
analyzed: bzung nas nus med byol song dag / mtshon cha rnon pos gsod pa la //
translated: and killed with sharp weapons,

original: de la sngags kyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de la sngags kyis ci zhig bya //
translated: what use is there for a mantra?

original: gal te yang 'di skad du /🔽rang nyid rang byung gyur pa yis //
analyzed: gal te yang 'di skad du / rang nyid rang byung gyur pa yis //
translated: If someone says this:🔽“For the sake of the sacrifice,🔽the animals are born

original: mchod sbyin don du byol song bskyed //
analyzed: mchod sbyin don du byol song bskyed //

original: des na de la dgos pa'i phyir //
analyzed: des na de la dgos pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because they are needed for that,

original: mchod sbyin chos yin 'di ltar dper //
analyzed: mchod sbyin chos yin 'di ltar dper //
translated: the sacrifice is a religious act, just like

original: bram ze'i don du 'tshe byed pa //
analyzed: bram ze'i don du 'tshe byed pa //
translated: the violence for the sake of the brahmins

original: 'di ltar chos min min pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos min min pa bzhin //
translated: is not a non-religious act.”

original: zhe na 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhe na 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: mchod sbyin byol song rnams gtses kyang //
analyzed: mchod sbyin byol song rnams gtses kyang //
translated: Even if the animals are harmed for the sake of the sacrifice,

analyzed: 'bras bu mi 'dod min de yi // don phyir zhe na bram ze'i phyir //

original: ci ltar 'dod pas 'tshe byed bzhin //
analyzed: ci ltar 'dod pas 'tshe byed bzhin //
translated: then it is just like the violence for the sake of the brahmins.

original: mchod sbyin de'i don gang yin pa de ni de'i don te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin de'i don gang yin pa de ni de'i don te /
translated: What is for the sake of the sacrifice is for the sake of that.

original: de'i don gyi ngo bo ni de'i don nyid do //
analyzed: de'i don gyi ngo bo ni de'i don nyid do //
translated: The nature of what is for the sake of that is being for the sake of that.

original: de lta bas na de'i don du zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i don du'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i don du zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i don du'o //
translated: Therefore, “for the sake of that” means for the sake of the cause.

original: de ltar pha rol pos smras pa'i tshad ma la rgol ba'i rtog ges gnod pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar pha rol pos smras pa'i tshad ma la rgol ba'i rtog ges gnod pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the opponent’s argument is undermined by the thought of the challenger, he says:

original: byol song spyad pa'i phyir bskyed de //
analyzed: byol song spyad pa'i phyir bskyed de //
translated: They are produced for the sake of using animals.

original: spyad bya yin phyir bud med bzhin //
analyzed: spyad bya yin phyir bud med bzhin //
translated: Like women, they are for use.

original: de phyir mchod sbyin phyin ma grub //
analyzed: de phyir mchod sbyin phyin ma grub //
translated: Therefore, the sacrifice is not established.

original: byol song gtan tshigs ma grub phyir //
analyzed: byol song gtan tshigs ma grub phyir //
translated: Because the animal is not established as a reason.

original: byol song rnams ni mchod sbyin gyi phyir bskyed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byol song rnams ni mchod sbyin gyi phyir bskyed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Animals are not produced for the sake of sacrifice.

original: 'on kyang 'dir dge ba'i las byas pa'i spyod pa po rnams kyi las nye bar bsags pa'i dbang gis 'o ma dang mar dang / bal la sogs pa nye @285b bar spyod pa'i don du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dir dge ba'i las byas pa'i spyod pa po rnams kyi las nye bar bsags pa'i dbang gis 'o ma dang mar dang / bal la sogs pa nye @285b bar spyod pa'i don du byung ba yin no //
translated: However, here they arise for the sake of using milk, butter, wool, and so on, through the power of the accumulation of the karma of those who engage in virtuous actions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyad par bya ba yin pas na spyad bya ste /
analyzed: spyad par bya ba yin pas na spyad bya ste /
translated: Because they are for use, they are for use.

original: de'i ngo bo ni spyad bya nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni spyad bya nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is being for use.

original: de'i phyir na spyad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir na spyad par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “for the sake of use.”

original: dper na bud med la 'khyud pa dang / rtse ba dang / reg pa la sogs pa ni nye bar longs spyad par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: dper na bud med la 'khyud pa dang / rtse ba dang / reg pa la sogs pa ni nye bar longs spyad par bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: For example, embracing, playing with, and touching a woman is for the sake of sexual enjoyment,

original: gsad pa'i phyir ni ma yin pa de bzhin du byol song rnams kyang yin no //
analyzed: gsad pa'i phyir ni ma yin pa de bzhin du byol song rnams kyang yin no //
translated: but not for the sake of killing. It is the same for animals.

original: de'i phyir na mchod sbyin gyi don du yin par ma grub pas de'i don du zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na mchod sbyin gyi don du yin par ma grub pas de'i don du zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs gzhan la ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not established that the purpose is a sacrifice, the reason, “for the sake of that,” is not established for the other party.

original: dbus kyi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su bsad na mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba dang / sngags kyis yongs su bzung nas bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du byas na yang zhes bya ba 'di la yang lan /
analyzed: dbus kyi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su bsad na mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba dang / sngags kyis yongs su bzung nas bstan bcos las 'byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du byas na yang zhes bya ba 'di la yang lan /
translated: If one kills in the central place of sacrifice, the undesirable result does not occur, and if one kills after being protected by a mantra and acting according to the ritual described in the treatise,🔽then the response to that is:

original: dbus kyi mchod sbyin gnas bsad na'ang //
analyzed: dbus kyi mchod sbyin gnas bsad na'ang //
translated: Even if one kills in the central place of sacrifice,

original: ma 'khrul bsams bzhin bsad pa'i phyir //🔽phyi mar byed pa mi 'dod pa'i //
analyzed: ma 'khrul bsams bzhin bsad pa'i phyir // phyi mar byed pa mi 'dod pa'i //
translated: because of killing without confusion and as intended,🔽the undesirable result

original: 'bras bur 'gyur te gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bur 'gyur te gzhan bzhin no //
translated: will occur in the next life, just like in other cases.

original: dbus kyi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su gang bsad pa de ma bsad pa yin no zhes 'dod pa de la yang byed pa po la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
analyzed: dbus kyi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su gang bsad pa de ma bsad pa yin no zhes 'dod pa de la yang byed pa po la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs so //
translated: In response to the assertion that “the one who is killed in the central place of sacrifice is not killed,” the opponent’s position is that “the unwanted result arises for the agent.”

original: bsams bzhin du ma 'khrul bar zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /🔽ma bsams par yengs pas bsad kyang srog gcad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du ma 'khrul bar zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te / ma bsams par yengs pas bsad kyang srog gcad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: The reason is “intentionally and without error.”🔽If one kills without intending to, or if one is distracted, then one does not commit the act of killing.

original: byol song gsad par 'dod pa las mi bsad par gyur na yang 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir mi bsad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byol song gsad par 'dod pa las mi bsad par gyur na yang 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir mi bsad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one intends to kill an animal but kills a human by mistake, then one does not commit the act of killing.

original: don de'i phyir khyad par gnyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don de'i phyir khyad par gnyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: For this reason, two qualifications are stated.

original: dbus kyi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su yang spang bar bya ba'i phyir bya gsod pa dang / lug gsod pa la sogs pa byas pa'i mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ni dpe ste /
analyzed: dbus kyi mchod sbyin gyi gnas su yang spang bar bya ba'i phyir bya gsod pa dang / lug gsod pa la sogs pa byas pa'i mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ni dpe ste /
translated: The example is the unwanted result of the act of killing birds and sheep in the central place of sacrifice.

original: skye ba gzhan la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan la mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: The unwanted result arises in another life.

original: de yang ji ltar nges brjod byed pa dgon pa na 'di ltar 'don par byed de /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar nges brjod byed pa dgon pa na 'di ltar 'don par byed de /
translated: The following is recited in the monasteries in the manner of the recitation of the Vedas:🔽The teaching of the eighteen unseen sacrifices is lost.

original: ma mthong ba'i mchod sbyin bco brgyad bstan pa ni nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang gang las 'di la brten cing mngon bar dga' ba de ni rga ba dang 'chi ba yang 'byung zhing lhung bar 'gyur ro //🔽gzhan yang gsum ldan gyi dus na sna tshogs zang zhes bya ba'i mchod sbyin la drang srong @286a * //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i mchod sbyin bco brgyad bstan pa ni nyams pa yin no zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang gang las 'di la brten cing mngon bar dga' ba de ni rga ba dang 'chi ba yang 'byung zhing lhung bar 'gyur ro // gzhan yang gsum ldan gyi dus na sna tshogs zang zhes bya ba'i mchod sbyin la drang srong @286a * //
translated: Moreover, whatever is based on and delights in this, will also arise and fall due to aging and death.

original: rnams rtsod par gyur pa na /
analyzed: rnams rtsod par gyur pa na /

analyzed: der aa shvad tha'i 'bras bu za ba la sogs pas smras pa /

analyzed: byol song rnams kyis mchod sbyin bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The sacrifice should be performed by animals.

original: skra yegs la sogs pas smras pa /
analyzed: skra yegs la sogs pas smras pa /
translated: The sages who had matted hair and so on said:

original: byol song gsad par mi bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: byol song gsad par mi bya'o zhes zer te /

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: go bil mchod sbyin shing shun can //

original: 'be sham pa na shes bya dag / sngon 'dir byol song gsad bya bar //
analyzed: 'be sham pa na shes bya dag / sngon 'dir byol song gsad bya bar //
translated: In Besham, the learned ones said, In the past, this was a place for slaughtering animals.

original: 'di dag gis ni nye bar btags //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni nye bar btags //

original: der ni gnyis skyes mang thos kyis //
analyzed: der ni gnyis skyes mang thos kyis //
translated: There, a learned person said,

original: 'di skad zer ba chos min zhes //
analyzed: 'di skad zer ba chos min zhes //
translated: This is not Dharma.

original: de yi gzhung de rab tu bkang //
analyzed: de yi gzhung de rab tu bkang //
translated: His text was filled with that.

original: de ltar shin tu rtsod par gyur //
analyzed: de ltar shin tu rtsod par gyur //

original: de na ae dha drang srong rgyal //
analyzed: de na ae dha drang srong rgyal //

original: gcig de gnyis kyis dbang po byas //
analyzed: gcig de gnyis kyis dbang po byas //

analyzed: de yis bden par smras pa dang // sha za 'dod rnams khros gyur te //

original: gnyis skyes pa de bsad nas zos //
analyzed: gnyis skyes pa de bsad nas zos //

original: da dung sa ke ta'i yul na //
analyzed: da dung sa ke ta'i yul na //
translated: Even now, in the land of Saketa,

analyzed: ae dha gtubs  pa zhes byar sgrogs //

analyzed: gnyis skyes gang gis ae dha'i sha / ma zos pa de spangs gyur na //
translated: Those who did not eat the flesh of Eḍa were expelled.

analyzed: gral du bsnyen par ma gyur te //

analyzed: da dung gral med pa zhes brjod // de las gzhan yang dbang po ni //
translated: Even now, it is called the place without rows.🔽Moreover, the king

original: rgyal po'i drang srong 'ba' su dris //
analyzed: rgyal po'i drang srong 'ba' su dris //
translated: was the sage Ṛṣi.

original: ae dha bsad pas 'jigs skrag nas //
analyzed: ae dha bsad pas 'jigs skrag nas //
translated: Fearing the killing of Eḍa,

original: de yis brdzun gyi tshig gcig smras //
analyzed: de yis brdzun gyi tshig gcig smras //
translated: He spoke a single word of falsehood.🔽That very moment, the earth opened up

original: de ni lus de sags  par //
analyzed: de ni lus de sags  par //
translated: And swallowed him up.

original: 'jug dus chos smra ba dag gis //
analyzed: 'jug dus chos smra ba dag gis //
translated: The Dharma teachers said,

original: smras pa 'dir ni bden par smros //
analyzed: smras pa 'dir ni bden par smros //
translated: “Speak the truth here!

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar gyur ta re //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar gyur ta re //
translated: Otherwise you will go to the lower realms!”🔽The king, who had been deceived by his ministers,

analyzed: chos kyi phyogs ni nyams byed cing // chos min phyogs dag rgyal byed pa'i //
translated: Spoke the word “truth.”

original: brdzun gyi tshig de smras pas na //
analyzed: brdzun gyi tshig de smras pas na //
translated: Because he spoke that word of falsehood,🔽Which undermined the side of Dharma🔽And made the side of non-Dharma victorious,

analyzed: rgyal de sa gas nang du song // brdzun gyi dbang po'i bram ze la //
translated: The king fell into the earth.🔽In order to benefit the brahmin

original: phan gdags par ni bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: phan gdags par ni bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Who was the lord of falsehood,

original: kun gyis nges par mchod sbyin dus //
analyzed: kun gyis nges par mchod sbyin dus //
translated: All the people, at the time of the sacrifice,

original: sa la rgyun dag sbreng bar byed //
analyzed: sa la rgyun dag sbreng bar byed //
translated: Made a stream of water on the ground.

original: ces bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na /
translated: Therefore,

original: mchod sbyin la ni bsad pa yang //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la ni bsad pa yang //
translated: Even though he was killed at the sacrifice,
