analyzed: mi 'dod pa yi 'bras bu 'byung // bsams bzhin du ni srog 'chad pa'i //
translated: The result was not what he wanted.🔽Because it produced suffering,

original: sdug bsngal bskyed phyir gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bskyed phyir gzhan bzhin no //
translated: Like killing another, intentionally.

original: gsad par bya'o zhes nges par bsam pa byas nas /
analyzed: gsad par bya'o zhes nges par bsam pa byas nas /
translated: Having made the definite decision, “He must be killed,”

original: srog 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal 'di la yod pas srog 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: srog 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal 'di la yod pas srog 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of the cutting off of life is present in this, thus it is the suffering of the cutting off of life.

original: de bskyed pa ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: de bskyed pa ni rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of that is the reason.

original: srog 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i'o //
analyzed: srog 'chad pa'i sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i'o //
translated: The reason for the suffering of the cutting off of life.

original: dper na 'thab mo dang / @286b g-yul ngor mtshon gyis brgyab nas bsad pa mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa yin pa ltar mchod sbyin la bsad ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'thab mo dang / @286b g-yul ngor mtshon gyis brgyab nas bsad pa mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bskyed pa yin pa ltar mchod sbyin la bsad ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one is killed by a weapon in a battle or a war, the result is unwanted. In the same way, the killing in a sacrifice is also like that.

original: yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can yin par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu can yin par 'dod ce na /
translated: Again, why is it considered to have an unwanted result?

original: smras pa / bya ba ji ltar byas pa las //
analyzed: smras pa / bya ba ji ltar byas pa las //
translated: It is said:

original: de 'dra'i 'bras bu lus la mthong //
analyzed: de 'dra'i 'bras bu lus la mthong //
translated: The result is seen in the body🔽in accordance with the action that was done.

original: byed po de 'dra'i ma mthong yang //
analyzed: byed po de 'dra'i ma mthong yang //
translated: Although the agent is not seen in that way,

original: bsad pa yin phyir gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: bsad pa yin phyir gzhan bzhin no //
translated: because of the killing, it is like the other.

original: gang la srog dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal lus 'di nyid la sdug bsngal du gyur pa mthong ba de bzhin du ji ltar mchod sbyin la byas pa yin yang mi dge ba'i las nye bar bsags pa yongs su smin pa thob par gyur pa las de dang 'dra
analyzed: gang la srog dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal lus 'di nyid la sdug bsngal du gyur pa mthong ba de bzhin du ji ltar mchod sbyin la byas pa yin yang mi dge ba'i las nye bar bsags pa yongs su smin pa thob par gyur pa las de dang 'dra
translated: Just as you see the suffering of being deprived of life as suffering for this body, so too, you should see the suffering of being deprived of life in the hells as suffering for this body.🔽

original: ba'i srog dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu skye ba gzhan brgya stong mang por mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba'i srog dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu skye ba gzhan brgya stong mang por mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the suffering of being deprived of life is seen as suffering for this very body, in the same way, even if one performs a sacrifice, the result of the fully ripened suffering of being deprived of life will be produced in many hundreds of thousands of other lives due to the fully ripened result of the non-virtuous karma accumulated.

original: dper na bram ze'i srog bcad cing bsad pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bram ze'i srog bcad cing bsad pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the killing of the Brahmin and so on.

original: 'dir drang srong skyed byed kyi yal ga les smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir drang srong skyed byed kyi yal ga les smras pa /
translated: Here, the sage Vṛddhiparṇīputra said:

original: sngon dus gnyis ldan 'jig rten 'di //
analyzed: sngon dus gnyis ldan 'jig rten 'di //
translated: In this world, which had two suns in the past,

original: thams cad 'tshe ba med par gnas //
analyzed: thams cad 'tshe ba med par gnas //
translated: all lived without harm.

original: des na don la bsdu gyur bas //
analyzed: des na don la bsdu gyur bas //
translated: Therefore, in reality,

original: byol song dag ni bsad pa nyid //
analyzed: byol song dag ni bsad pa nyid //
translated: only animals were killed.

original: chos ldan ae dha bsad byas shing //
analyzed: chos ldan ae dha bsad byas shing //
translated: The righteous Eḍa was killed

original: sngon gyi rig byed bor nas ni //
analyzed: sngon gyi rig byed bor nas ni //
translated: and the Vedas of the past were abandoned.

original: rdzas kyi don du rig byed kyang //
analyzed: rdzas kyi don du rig byed kyang //
translated: And for the sake of material things,

original: rigs las gzhan du sgrub par byed //
analyzed: rigs las gzhan du sgrub par byed //
translated: They will even perform the Vedic rites.

original: 'jig rten 'jug par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jug par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to engage with the world,

original: ma khyab rigs pa mi ldan pa //
analyzed: ma khyab rigs pa mi ldan pa //
translated: They will do what is not pervasive and what is illogical.

original: khyim pa'i dngos po la dga' bas //
analyzed: khyim pa'i dngos po la dga' bas //
translated: Delighting in the things of householders,

original: chags dang 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur //
analyzed: chags dang 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur //
translated: They will be governed by attachment and desire.

original: bsam gtan byed pa mi nus phyir //
analyzed: bsam gtan byed pa mi nus phyir //
translated: Because they are unable to practice concentration,

original: dgon par gnas pa'i cho ga spangs //
analyzed: dgon par gnas pa'i cho ga spangs //
translated: They will abandon the rules for dwelling in the forest.

original: de las 'ga' zhig dka' thub ste //
analyzed: de las 'ga' zhig dka' thub ste //
translated: Some of them will be ascetics,

original: de bzhin 'ga' zhig me la brten //
analyzed: de bzhin 'ga' zhig me la brten //
translated: And likewise, some will rely on fire.

original: gzhan pa dag ni mchod sbyin rtsom //
analyzed: gzhan pa dag ni mchod sbyin rtsom //
translated: Others will engage in sacrificial rites,

original: bdag kyang mchod cing gzhan la skul //
analyzed: bdag kyang mchod cing gzhan la skul //
translated: Worshiping themselves and encouraging others.

original: sdig can rmongs pa 'bras bu 'dod //
analyzed: sdig can rmongs pa 'bras bu 'dod //
translated: Sinful and deluded, they will desire results,

original: thos mang dag la smod byed cing //
analyzed: thos mang dag la smod byed cing //
translated: And they will disparage those with much learning.

original: chags pas rmongs pa dag la brten //
analyzed: chags pas rmongs pa dag la brten //
translated: Deluded by attachment, they will rely on others,

original: las ngan chos su 'du shes shing //
analyzed: las ngan chos su 'du shes shing //
translated: And they will perceive evil actions as the Dharma.

original: de dag rnams kyi bya ba rtsom //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi bya ba rtsom //
translated: They will engage in the activities of those

original: rgyal po de ni bdag mi 'dod //
analyzed: rgyal po de ni bdag mi 'dod //
translated: But not of the king.

original: tshangs pa nas brtsams dmyal ba'i bar //
analyzed: tshangs pa nas brtsams dmyal ba'i bar //
translated: From Brahma down to the hells,

original: srog chags kun la srog phangs na //
analyzed: srog chags kun la srog phangs na //
translated: All beings value their lives.

original: gzhan gyi de ni bcad byas pas //
analyzed: gzhan gyi de ni bcad byas pas //
translated: But when you destroy another’s happiness,

original: ji lta bur na bde bar gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na bde bar gyur //
translated: how can you be happy?

original: 'byung po rnams ni bde 'dod la //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams ni bde 'dod la //
translated: All beings desire happiness,

original: 'jig rten kun ni sdug bsngal ldan //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun ni sdug bsngal ldan //
translated: but the world is full of suffering.

original: gang la mang du gnod byas na //
analyzed: gang la mang du gnod byas na //
translated: How can one who causes much harm

original: de bde'i snod du ji ltar 'gyur //🔽zhes smras pa 'byung ba dang / myos 'gyur btung @287a * //
analyzed: de bde'i snod du ji ltar 'gyur // zhes smras pa 'byung ba dang / myos 'gyur btung @287a * //
translated: be a vessel of happiness?🔽It is said that alcohol is also to be abandoned,

original: sogs kyang bshad pa //
analyzed: sogs kyang bshad pa //
translated: because it is the cause of heedlessness.

original: ji ltar bstan bzhin spang bya ste //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan bzhin spang bya ste //
translated: As taught, so it is to be abandoned,

original: des na myos 'gyur bsten mi bya //
analyzed: des na myos 'gyur bsten mi bya //
translated: therefore one should not drink alcohol.

original: myos par 'gyur phyir myos sogs bzhin //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur phyir myos sogs bzhin //
translated: Because it is the cause of heedlessness, like the four:🔽drinking, gambling, wandering at night, and bad companionship.

original: mchod sbyin la chang 'thung ba yang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin la chang 'thung ba yang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Also, drinking alcohol at a sacrifice produces an undesirable result,

original: myos par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rmongs pa myos chad la dga' ba bzhin no //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rmongs pa myos chad la dga' ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is the cause of heedlessness, like the pleasure of a fool who is heedless and confused.

original: de'i phyir mchod sbyin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir mchod sbyin nam /
translated: Therefore, in a sacrifice,

original: gzhan du yang rung ba thams cad du myos par 'gyur ba bsten par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du yang rung ba thams cad du myos par 'gyur ba bsten par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: or anywhere else, one should not drink alcohol,

original: myos par 'gyur ba bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it produces heedlessness.

original: da du ra'am aa ga ta'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: da du ra'am aa ga ta'i me tog la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the flower of the dhurā or the flower of the atag.

original: gal te sngags kyis yongs su bzung ba'i myos par 'gyur ba ni mchod sbyin gyi dus su skyon med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sngags kyis yongs su bzung ba'i myos par 'gyur ba ni mchod sbyin gyi dus su skyon med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the intoxicating drink which is consecrated by a spell is without fault at the time of the sacrifice,

original: mchod sbyin sngags kyis yongs bzung ba'i //
analyzed: mchod sbyin sngags kyis yongs bzung ba'i //
translated: intoxicating drink consecrated by a spell

original: myos 'gyur skyon med ma yin te //
analyzed: myos 'gyur skyon med ma yin te //
translated: is not without fault at the sacrifice.

original: myos phyir dper na gzhan bzhin te //
analyzed: myos phyir dper na gzhan bzhin te //
translated: Because it intoxicates, like any other,

original: sngags kyis btab pas mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: sngags kyis btab pas mthong ba bzhin //
translated: like the sight of one who has been bewitched.

original: mchod sbyin gyi dus kyi sngags kyis yongs su bzung ba'i myos par 'gyur ba yang skyon med pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi dus kyi sngags kyis yongs su bzung ba'i myos par 'gyur ba yang skyon med pa ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: The intoxicating drink which is consecrated by a spell at the time of the sacrifice is not without fault.

original: myos par 'gyur ba'i nus pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myos par 'gyur ba'i nus pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not free from the power to intoxicate.

original: gal te de la de'i dri dang ro dang myos par 'gyur ba med par gyur na ni 'thung bar yang su yang 'dod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te de la de'i dri dang ro dang myos par 'gyur ba med par gyur na ni 'thung bar yang su yang 'dod par mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were without the smell, taste, and power to intoxicate, no one would want to drink it.

original: dri dang ro la mngon bar chags pa nyid kyis der de dag 'thung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dri dang ro la mngon bar chags pa nyid kyis der de dag 'thung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: But it is because of attachment to its smell and taste that people drink it.

original: de'i phyir na chang la dga' ba la sogs pa rnams sngags bzlas nas myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba bzhin du skyon dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na chang la dga' ba la sogs pa rnams sngags bzlas nas myos par 'gyur ba 'thung ba bzhin du skyon dang bcas pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, those who delight in alcohol and so on, like drinking alcohol that has been enchanted with a spell, are flawed,

original: myos par byed pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myos par byed pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not free from intoxication.

original: gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: Someone might say this:

original: rig byed kyi lung med na sngon med pa la sogs pa rtags ma mthong ba rnams rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de la yang 'dir /
analyzed: rig byed kyi lung med na sngon med pa la sogs pa rtags ma mthong ba rnams rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de la yang 'dir /
translated: “If there is no Vedic scripture, then one would not understand the previously unseen signs, such as the one that says, ‘If one offers a horse sacrifice, one will go to heaven.’”🔽In response to that, Aryadeva says:

original: rtags ni mthong ba med ces te //
analyzed: rtags ni mthong ba med ces te //
translated: The sign is not seen.

original: gal te mtho ris sogs mi nges //
analyzed: gal te mtho ris sogs mi nges //
translated: If you say that heaven is not ascertained,🔽then why is it not ascertained

original: zhe na rtags las rjes dpag des //🔽nges pas nges pa min nam ci //
analyzed: zhe na rtags las rjes dpag des // nges pas nges pa min nam ci //
translated: by the inference based on that sign?

original: 'di na la la ni rtags dang 'brel pa nges par mthong ba gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di na la la ni rtags dang 'brel pa nges par mthong ba gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Here someone might say that the sign must be seen and grasped in order to ascertain the object that is related to the sign.

original: ji ltar gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa la sogs pa'o //🔽la la ni rjes su dpag pas yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa la sogs pa'o // la la ni rjes su dpag pas yin te /
translated: For example, one sees form, sound, smell, taste, and so on.

original: ji ltar du ba las me yod pa nyid lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar du ba las me yod pa nyid lta bu'o //
translated: Someone else infers the existence of fire from smoke.

original: de bzhin du zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / skar ma la sogs pa @287b mthong ba las de las gzhan ba'i mtho ris kyang yod par shes la /
analyzed: de bzhin du zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / skar ma la sogs pa @287b mthong ba las de las gzhan ba'i mtho ris kyang yod par shes la /
translated: Likewise, one should know that there are other heavens besides the heavens of the moon, sun, stars, etc.,

original: bde ba nyid dang / sdug bsngal nyid dang / rigs dman pa dang / rigs mchog dang / phyug po dang / dbul po la sogs pa'i skye bo mthong ba las sngon med pa yod pa nyid du shes te /
analyzed: bde ba nyid dang / sdug bsngal nyid dang / rigs dman pa dang / rigs mchog dang / phyug po dang / dbul po la sogs pa'i skye bo mthong ba las sngon med pa yod pa nyid du shes te /
translated: and that there are other beings besides those who are happy, miserable, of low caste, of high caste, rich, poor, etc.

original: yul la chags pa spangs pa las 'di nyid du yang yon tan dang ldan pa mthong la yul la chags pa dang bcas par gyur pa'i phye ma leb dang / sbrang ma dang / glang po dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi skyon mthong ba las ngan 'gro yang yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag cing nges par gzung bar bya'o ;
analyzed: yul la chags pa spangs pa las 'di nyid du yang yon tan dang ldan pa mthong la yul la chags pa dang bcas par gyur pa'i phye ma leb dang / sbrang ma dang / glang po dang / 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi skyon mthong ba las ngan 'gro yang yod pa nyid du rjes su dpag cing nges par gzung bar bya'o ;
translated: One should infer and ascertain that there are also bad rebirths, since one sees that those who have abandoned attachment to objects have good qualities in this life, and one sees the faults of those who are attached to objects, such as butterflies, bees, elephants, and lustful men.

original: / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs pa bden par mthong ba nyid kyis de las rjes su dpags nas mtho ris dang thar pa yang yod pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yang bden par 'gyur bas rjes su dpag🔽pa dang bral ba'i lung 'ba' zhig gis ni mtho ris dang sngon med pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gtan la dbab par mi nus so //
analyzed: / de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes gsungs pa bden par mthong ba nyid kyis de las rjes su dpags nas mtho ris dang thar pa yang yod pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yang bden par 'gyur bas rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba'i lung 'ba' zhig gis ni mtho ris dang sngon med pa la sogs pa'i dngos po gtan la dbab par mi nus so //
translated: Likewise, the statement of the Blessed One that all conditioned things are impermanent is true, and by seeing that truth, one can infer that heaven and liberation exist.🔽Therefore, it is not possible to establish the existence of heaven, liberation, and so on, by scripture alone, without inference.

original: des na 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis mtho ris la sogs pa gtan la phebs par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis mtho ris la sogs pa gtan la phebs par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur na /
translated: So why not establish heaven and so on by inference?

original: rig byed btags pas ci zhig bya //🔽gang yang sngar sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub pa byas pa de sun dbyung ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rig byed btags pas ci zhig bya // gang yang sngar sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir bsgrub pa byas pa de sun dbyung ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: What is the use of the Vedas, which are mere fabrications?🔽Now, in order to refute the proof that sound is permanent, which was presented earlier, it is said:

original: lan cig 'jug phyir zhes bya 'dir //
analyzed: lan cig 'jug phyir zhes bya 'dir //
translated: Here, it is said that sound is impermanent

original: mar me'ang lan cig nyid 'jug pas //
analyzed: mar me'ang lan cig nyid 'jug pas //
translated: Because it is produced, like a pot.

original: gtan tshigs ma nges nyid yin phyir //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma nges nyid yin phyir //
translated: because the reason is inconclusive.

original: sgra yi rtag pa nyid kyang brdzun //🔽mar me yang rab tu 'bar ba dang po nyid kyis mthong bar 'dod pa'i don mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sgra yi rtag pa nyid kyang brdzun // mar me yang rab tu 'bar ba dang po nyid kyis mthong bar 'dod pa'i don mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The permanence of sound is false.

original: de 'bar ba gnyis pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no //🔽de la lan cig 'jug pa yin pas ci mar me bzhin du sgra 'di mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig yin nam /
analyzed: de 'bar ba gnyis pa la ltos pa ni ma yin no // de la lan cig 'jug pa yin pas ci mar me bzhin du sgra 'di mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ba zhig yin nam /
translated: The light of a lamp is seen at the very first instant of its burning, and it is not the case that it is seen later on, in dependence on a second instant of burning.🔽If it is argued that sound is impermanent because it is momentary, like a lamp,

original: 'on te lan cig 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin du rtag pa zhig yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on te lan cig 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir sgra nyid bzhin du rtag pa zhig yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: then it follows that sound is permanent because it is momentary, like the impermanence of sound.

original: des na sgra ni rtag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sgra ni rtag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba nyams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the permanence of sound is undermined.

original: gzhan gyis nye bar bkod pa'i rjes su dpag pa sun dbyung ba byas nas rang gi tshad ma nye bar 'god par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis nye bar bkod pa'i rjes su dpag pa sun dbyung ba byas nas rang gi tshad ma nye bar 'god par byed pa ni /
translated: Having refuted the inference presented by the opponent, the author now presents his own valid cognition:

original: yod phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste //🔽ci phyir bya ba @288a * //
analyzed: yod phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste // ci phyir bya ba @288a * //
translated: Sound is impermanent because it exists,🔽why not accept it as such,

original: bzhin mi gzung //
analyzed: bzhin mi gzung //
translated: like an action?

original: yang na lus kyi g-yo ba bzhin //
analyzed: yang na lus kyi g-yo ba bzhin //
translated: Or else, like the movement of the body,

original: blo yi rgyu phyir nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: blo yi rgyu phyir nyams par 'gyur //
translated: it is impaired because it is the cause of the cognition.

original: sgra ni chos can no //
analyzed: sgra ni chos can no //
translated: Sound is the subject.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni chos so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni chos so //
translated: Impermanence is the property.

original: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: Because it exists is the reason.

original: gang dang gang yod pa de ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang yod pa de ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Whatever exists is impermanent,

original: dper na 'gro ba dang btso blag la sogs pa'i bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na 'gro ba dang btso blag la sogs pa'i bya ba yin no //
translated: like the activities of going, cooking, etc.

original: yang na sgra ni nyams par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: yang na sgra ni nyams par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Or else, sound is impaired

original: blo'i rgyu yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo'i rgyu yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition.

original: gang dang gang blo'i rgyur gyur pa de dang de ni nyams par 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang blo'i rgyur gyur pa de dang de ni nyams par 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is the cause of the cognition is impaired,

original: ji ltar steng du 'byin pa dang 'og tu gnon pa dang / brkyang ba dang bskum pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi g-yo ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar steng du 'byin pa dang 'og tu gnon pa dang / brkyang ba dang bskum pa la sogs pa'i lus kyi g-yo ba bzhin no //
translated: like the movement of the body, such as extending and contracting the arms, etc.🔽Moreover,🔽because of the prior teaching,

original: gzhan yang sngar bstan pa dag gi / goms phyir phyis shes zhes pa yang //
analyzed: gzhan yang sngar bstan pa dag gi / goms phyir phyis shes zhes pa yang //
translated: the statement “because of the prior practice, later it is known”

original: gtan tshigs rjes 'gro med pa nyid //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rjes 'gro med pa nyid //
translated: is also without the invariable relation of the reason.

original: goms dang phyis kyang shes pa ni //
analyzed: goms dang phyis kyang shes pa ni //
translated: The prior practice and the later knowledge

original: rtag min nam yang ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: rtag min nam yang ma mthong phyir //
translated: It is not permanent, because it is never perceived.

original: yang dang yang goms par byas kyang sgra ni brjod pa nyid na nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dang yang goms par byas kyang sgra ni brjod pa nyid na nyams par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Even if one were to cultivate it again and again, the sound would be lost as soon as it was uttered.

original: de la yi ge dang po brjod pa'i blo 'gag par 'gyur ba na skye mched drug la nus pa bzhag nas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yi ge dang po brjod pa'i blo 'gag par 'gyur ba na skye mched drug la nus pa bzhag nas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the cognition of the first letter ceases, it leaves an impression in the six sense spheres.

original: nus pa de yongs su smin pa thob nas yi ge gnyis pa brjod pa'i blo mngon bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: nus pa de yongs su smin pa thob nas yi ge gnyis pa brjod pa'i blo mngon bar sgrub par byed do //
translated: When that impression ripens, it produces the cognition of the second letter.

original: de bzhin du ji srid don rdzogs kyi bar du yin no ;
analyzed: de bzhin du ji srid don rdzogs kyi bar du yin no ;
translated: And so on until the meaning is completed.

original: / de'i phyir yi ge rnams la phan tshun gyi 'brel ba med pa dang / skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: / de'i phyir yi ge rnams la phan tshun gyi 'brel ba med pa dang / skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how can the letters be permanent, since they have no mutual connection and are momentary?

original: yi ge re re la yang thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma la sogs pa'i dus mang po nyid yod pa yin la /
analyzed: yi ge re re la yang thog ma dang / bar dang / tha ma la sogs pa'i dus mang po nyid yod pa yin la /
translated: Each letter has many temporal parts, such as beginning, middle, and end.

original: rna ba'i dbang po ni skad cig ma nyid yin pas sgra ma lus pa nges bar 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po ni skad cig ma nyid yin pas sgra ma lus pa nges bar 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The auditory sense faculty is momentary, so it cannot grasp all of the sound.

original: des na sgra nyid kyang re zhig bsgrub bar dka' na sgra de la goms pa lta ga la yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na sgra nyid kyang re zhig bsgrub bar dka' na sgra de la goms pa lta ga la yod par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if sound itself is difficult to establish, how could there be familiarity with that sound?

original: phyis shes pa'i shes pa yang blo snga ma 'gags par gyur pa dang / blo phyi ma skye bar 'gyur ba de la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir phyis shes pa yang rtag pa yin no//
analyzed: phyis shes pa'i shes pa yang blo snga ma 'gags par gyur pa dang / blo phyi ma skye bar 'gyur ba de la 'brel pa med pa'i phyir phyis shes pa yang rtag pa yin no//
translated: Also, later cognition is permanent because there is no connection between the cessation of the former cognition and the arising of the later cognition.

original: gzhan yang / sgra nyid rtag pa nyid ma grub //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sgra nyid rtag pa nyid ma grub //
translated: Moreover, the permanence of sound itself is not established.

original: sgra nyid dpe yang ma yin la //
analyzed: sgra nyid dpe yang ma yin la //
translated: Sound itself is not an example.

original: mngon bar gsal byed pa yang bkag /'di ni ngag gis gsal byed min //
analyzed: mngon bar gsal byed pa yang bkag /'di ni ngag gis gsal byed min //
translated: The manifestation of sound is also refuted. This is not manifested by speech.

original: sgra'i rtag pa nyid grub na ni sgra nyid rtag par 'gyur na gang gi phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa nyid kyis de bzhin du sgra nyid kyang @288b mi rtag pa yin na /
analyzed: sgra'i rtag pa nyid grub na ni sgra nyid rtag par 'gyur na gang gi phyir sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrubs pa nyid kyis de bzhin du sgra nyid kyang @288b mi rtag pa yin na /
translated: If the permanence of sound were established, sound itself would be permanent. But because sound is established as impermanent, sound itself is also impermanent.

original: ji lta na dpe nyid du nye bar dgod par bya /
analyzed: ji lta na dpe nyid du nye bar dgod par bya /
translated: How could it be posited as an example?

original: rkan dang / mchu sbyar ba la sogs pa dang / gnas dang / byed ba dang / 'bad pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pas sgra byas pa yin par nges par gzung bar bya ba yin pas sgra ni mngon bar gsal bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rkan dang / mchu sbyar ba la sogs pa dang / gnas dang / byed ba dang / 'bad pa la sogs pa'i tshogs pas sgra byas pa yin par nges par gzung bar bya ba yin pas sgra ni mngon bar gsal bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable to say that sound is manifested by the assembly of the palate, lips, tongue, and so on, or by the assembly of the place, action, effort, and so on, because sound is definitely apprehended as produced by the assembly of the palate, lips, tongue, and so on, or by the assembly of the place, action, effort, and so on.

original: gzhan yang / gal te sgra de mnyan bya na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te sgra de mnyan bya na //
translated: Moreover, if that sound is audible,

original: ngag gis gsal bar ji ltar 'dod //
analyzed: ngag gis gsal bar ji ltar 'dod //
translated: how is it manifested by speech?

original: rtogs pa zhes bya'ang brda nyid pas //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya'ang brda nyid pas //
translated: Since “understanding” is also just a convention,

original: 'di nyid sgra ru thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di nyid sgra ru thal bar 'gyur //
translated: it follows that it is sound.

original: gal te sgra'i rang gi ngo bo rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na sgra de yang dbyangs yin pas des na dbyangs gzhan gyis yang ji ltar gsal bar byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i rang gi ngo bo rna ba'i dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid yin na sgra de yang dbyangs yin pas des na dbyangs gzhan gyis yang ji ltar gsal bar byed par 'gyur /
translated: If the intrinsic nature of sound is to be apprehended by the auditory sense faculty, then since that sound is melody, how could another melody manifest it?

original: sgra dang don dag rtag tu 'brel ba yod pas sgras don rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi bden te /
analyzed: sgra dang don dag rtag tu 'brel ba yod pas sgras don rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi bden te /
translated: It is not true that meaning is understood from sound because sound and meaning are always related.

original: bskal pa dang po la shes pa dang ldan pa rnams tshogs nas 'di la ni ba lang zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa dang po la shes pa dang ldan pa rnams tshogs nas 'di la ni ba lang zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the first eon, those who possessed knowledge assembled and agreed upon the convention: “This is called a cow.”

original: 'di la ni mi zhes bya'o zhes brda byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la ni mi zhes bya'o zhes brda byas pa yin gyi /
translated: “This is called a man.”

original: ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra la lkog shal dang rnga ma la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i ril po yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: ba lang zhes bya ba'i sgra la lkog shal dang rnga ma la sogs pas nye bar mtshon pa'i ril po yod pa ma yin la /
translated: But the word “cow” does not exist as a whole that is indicated by the dewlap, tail, and so on.

original: mi zhes bya ba'i sgra la yang mgo dang rkang pa dang lag pas nye bar mtshon pa'i lus nye bar dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba'i sgra la yang mgo dang rkang pa dang lag pas nye bar mtshon pa'i lus nye bar dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: And the word “man” is not perceived as a body that is indicated by the head, legs, and arms.

original: des na 'di ltar sgra dang don 'brel pa yod nas rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar sgra dang don 'brel pa yod nas rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the meaning is understood from the word once the relation between the word and the meaning has been established.

original: gzhan du na brnga las yin pas gang las don rtogs par 'gyur ba de la sgra zhes bya ba yin na brda nyid sgra yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na brnga las yin pas gang las don rtogs par 'gyur ba de la sgra zhes bya ba yin na brda nyid sgra yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the word is that from which the meaning is understood because of the convention, then it follows that the convention itself is the word.

original: gal te 'di ltar brda las don rtogs par 'gyur gyi sgra las ma yin te /🔽dang po brda ni med pa na //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar brda las don rtogs par 'gyur gyi sgra las ma yin te /🔽dang po brda ni med pa na //
translated: If the meaning is understood from the convention, not from the word,🔽then the convention would be the word.🔽But the convention is not the word.

original: rtog pa yod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtog pa yod par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that there is a concept without a name.

original: bskal pa dang po pa'i sems can gang dag skyes par gyur po pa na brda shes pa ni med na de rnams kyis ba lang zhes brjod pa'i sgra'i don rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bskal pa dang po pa'i sems can gang dag skyes par gyur po pa na brda shes pa ni med na de rnams kyis ba lang zhes brjod pa'i sgra'i don rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the beings who were born in the first eon did not know the conventional expressions, how could they have understood the meaning of the word cow?

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa ltar //🔽brda yang rjes su 'jug pa nyid //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa ltar // brda yang rjes su 'jug pa nyid //
translated: Just as samsara has no beginning,🔽so also the conventional expressions.

original: de lta bur rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de lta bur rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest of the sentence is understood: “The conventional expressions have existed from the beginning of time.”

original: ji ltar 'khor ba la thog ma yod pa ma yin pa ltar brda yang de bzhin te /🔽sreg pa'i bskal pa'i dus na mi rnams 'di nas shi 'phos nas thams cad 'od @289a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba la thog ma yod pa ma yin pa ltar brda yang de bzhin te / sreg pa'i bskal pa'i dus na mi rnams 'di nas shi 'phos nas thams cad 'od @289a * //
translated: Just as samsara has no beginning, so also the conventional expressions.

original: gsal gyi lha'i nang du skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: gsal gyi lha'i nang du skyes par gyur to //
translated: At the time of the conflagration that destroys the third meditative state, humans die here and are reborn among the Abhasvara gods.

original: yang sa 'di chags par gyur pa na lha de dag 'dir babs nas rol chags te gnas so //
analyzed: yang sa 'di chags par gyur pa na lha de dag 'dir babs nas rol chags te gnas so //
translated: When this earth is destroyed, those gods descend here and, playing, remain here.

original: de dag 'phags pa'i skad kyis smra bar byed cing bskal pa dang po la ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming du grags pa yang dang yang brdar byas pa yin pas des na dang po brda med pa ma yin no /
analyzed: de dag 'phags pa'i skad kyis smra bar byed cing bskal pa dang po la ba lang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming du grags pa yang dang yang brdar byas pa yin pas des na dang po brda med pa ma yin no /
translated: They speak in the language of the āryas, and the names of the first eon, such as “cow,” and so on, are repeatedly created by convention. Therefore it is not that there was no convention in the beginning.

original: gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: Also, someone says,

original: 'di ni rjes dpag las tha dad //
analyzed: 'di ni rjes dpag las tha dad //
translated: “This is different from inference.”

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste /🔽rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smras pa de la yang brjod par bya ste / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma nyid //
translated: And so on, we reply:🔽Inference is not different

original: de bdag nyid las tha dad min //🔽des na tshad ma yin phyir zhes //
analyzed: de bdag nyid las tha dad min // des na tshad ma yin phyir zhes //
translated: from valid knowledge.🔽Therefore, the reason,

original: bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges //🔽rjes su dpag pa med par lung tsam gyis bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni med de /
analyzed: bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges // rjes su dpag pa med par lung tsam gyis bsgrub bya 'grub pa ni med de /
translated: “because it is valid knowledge,” is not established.

original: rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir dang / du ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The probandum is not established by mere scripture without inference because it is not different from its own nature and because it is manifold.

original: tshad ma nyid ces bya ba 'di ci mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin du rjes su dpag pa lung las tha dad par 'gyur ba zhig yin nam /
analyzed: tshad ma nyid ces bya ba 'di ci mngon sum gyi tshad ma bzhin du rjes su dpag pa lung las tha dad par 'gyur ba zhig yin nam /
translated: Is this called “valid cognition” because it is different from inference and scripture, like direct perception?

original: 'on te tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du tha mi dad par gyur pa zhig yin na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du tha mi dad par gyur pa zhig yin na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or is it not different from the nature of the valid cognition of inference, because it is valid cognition?🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / tha dad spyod yul can gyi blo //🔽rgyud nyid du ni khyod kyi de //
analyzed: gzhan yang / tha dad spyod yul can gyi blo // rgyud nyid du ni khyod kyi de //
translated: Your cognition of a different object🔽Is not established in a continuum.

original: ma grub tha dad yul yin phyir //
analyzed: ma grub tha dad yul yin phyir //
translated: Because it has a different object,

original: gtan tshigs ma grub nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The reason is not established.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni lung las tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo skye ba'i rgyur gyur ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni lung las tha dad pa'i spyod yul can gyi blo skye ba'i rgyur gyur ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Inference does not exist as the cause of the arising of a cognition that has a different object from scripture.

original: lung las rjes su dpag pa dang bcas na bsgrub bya sgrub par nus par 'gyur gyi rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba'i lung gis yin par ni mkhas pa rnams kyis 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lung las rjes su dpag pa dang bcas na bsgrub bya sgrub par nus par 'gyur gyi rjes su dpag pa dang bral ba'i lung gis yin par ni mkhas pa rnams kyis 'dod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If scripture has inference, then it would be able to establish the probandum. But the wise do not assert that it is without inference.

original: mgon por smra ba dang / 'dod bzhin 'jug pa dang / thabs kyis rgyal bar sgrub pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
analyzed: mgon por smra ba dang / 'dod bzhin 'jug pa dang / thabs kyis rgyal bar sgrub pa'i bstan bcos bzhin no //
translated: It is like the treatises of the protector, the one who engages as he wishes, and the one who establishes victory through skillful means.

original: des na lung ni rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no zhes kho bo cag la grags pas tha dad pa'i yul gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na lung ni rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin no zhes kho bo cag la grags pas tha dad pa'i yul gyi blo skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, we accept that scripture is included within inference. Thus, the meaning of the reason, “because it is the cause of the arising of a cognition that has a different object,” is not established.

original: gang yang 'di skad du gcig dang du ma'i don gyi yul rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni lung las gzhan yin te /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du gcig dang du ma'i don gyi yul rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni lung las gzhan yin te /
translated: Also, someone might say, “Inference is different from scripture because it is the means of comprehending the object of a single or multiple meanings.🔽It is like the valid knowledge that arises from sound.”

original: sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma bzhin no zhes bya ba de la yang /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i tshad ma bzhin no zhes bya ba de la yang /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: du ma'i don dngos tha dad @289b phyir ;
analyzed: du ma'i don dngos tha dad @289b phyir ;
translated: Because the object of multiple meanings is different,

original: / don gcig min pa rtogs pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: / don gcig min pa rtogs pa'i rgyu //
translated: it is the cause of comprehending that it is not a single object.

original: rjes su dpag par yang 'dod pas //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par yang 'dod pas //
translated: Because it is accepted as inference,

original: de phyir sgra byung las gzhan min //
analyzed: de phyir sgra byung las gzhan min //
translated: it is not different from what arises from sound.

original: sgra gang gis byang grol zhes bya ba'i sgra mngon par brjod pa na don gcig yang dag par rtogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sgra gang gis byang grol zhes bya ba'i sgra mngon par brjod pa na don gcig yang dag par rtogs par 'gyur la /
translated: When the word “liberation” is uttered, one understands a single meaning.

original: mtho ris zhes bya ba'i sgra mngon par brjod pa na ni don du ma rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtho ris zhes bya ba'i sgra mngon par brjod pa na ni don du ma rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when the word “heaven” is uttered, one understands many meanings.

original: de yang rjes su dpag pa med par ma yin pas sgra las byung ba zhes bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang rjes su dpag pa med par ma yin pas sgra las byung ba zhes bya ba yang rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: And since this is not without inference, what is called “derived from testimony” is included in inference.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / rtags dang 'brel ba ma mthong bas //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rtags dang 'brel ba ma mthong bas //
translated: Since the connection with the reason is not seen,

original: mthong ba'i don las rjes dpag nyid //
analyzed: mthong ba'i don las rjes dpag nyid //
translated: Inference is from what is seen.

original: gang phyir rtogs bya rtogs par byed //
analyzed: gang phyir rtogs bya rtogs par byed //
translated: Since what is to be understood is understood,

original: de phyir de ma thag tu min //
analyzed: de phyir de ma thag tu min //
translated: It is not immediate.

original: mtho ris la sogs pa'i rtags mthong ba med na yang mthong ba'i don la rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis rtogs bya rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtho ris la sogs pa'i rtags mthong ba med na yang mthong ba'i don la rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis rtogs bya rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even when there is no seeing of the reason such as “heaven,” the object to be understood is understood by inference from what is seen.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mtho ris ni yod do thar pa ni yod do zhes de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i lung gang yin pa la'o //
analyzed: mtho ris ni yod do thar pa ni yod do zhes de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i lung gang yin pa la'o //
translated: The scriptures are the words of the Tathagata, who said, “There is a heaven, there is liberation.”

original: de las 'di skad du 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag go zhes brjod cing gsungs ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de las 'di skad du 'dus byas thams cad ni mi rtag go zhes brjod cing gsungs ba lta bu ste /
translated: And from that scripture, it is said, “All conditioned things are impermanent.”

original: des na rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi mtho ris dang thar pa yang yod par rtogs par bya ba yin gyi lung tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi mtho ris dang thar pa yang yod par rtogs par bya ba yin gyi lung tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that heaven and liberation exist by inference itself, not just by scripture.

original: de ltar na yang lung ni rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang lung ni rjes su dpag pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, scripture is included within inference.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / rjes dpag sgra byung tha dad min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rjes dpag sgra byung tha dad min //
translated: Inference from words is not different from inference.

original: lkog gyur shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin //
analyzed: lkog gyur shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin //
translated: It is the cause of knowing the hidden.

original: 'brel pa dran la ltos bcas phyir //
analyzed: 'brel pa dran la ltos bcas phyir //
translated: It depends on remembering the relation,

original: ji ltar rjes dpog rang nyid bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes dpog rang nyid bzhin //
translated: just like an inference for oneself.

original: sgra las byung bas na sgra byung ste /
analyzed: sgra las byung bas na sgra byung ste /
translated: It is from words that it arises, so it is from words.

original: lung nyid do //
analyzed: lung nyid do //
translated: It is scripture.

original: de la de yang me tog dang 'bras bu dang yal ga dang bcas pa'i shing la sogs pa'i don sgra thos pa nyid ni rtogs par 'gyur ba ni gang shing la me tog la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'brel pa sngar mthong ba las dran pa skye bar
analyzed: de la de yang me tog dang 'bras bu dang yal ga dang bcas pa'i shing la sogs pa'i don sgra thos pa nyid ni rtogs par 'gyur ba ni gang shing la me tog la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'brel pa sngar mthong ba las dran pa skye bar
translated: In that regard, the meaning of the words “tree” and so on, along with “flower,” “fruit,” and “branch,” is understood. But the memory that arises from previously seeing the connection between a tree and its flowers and so on is not the cause of the understanding of the meaning of the words.

original: 'gyur ba yin pas de ni sngar gyi 'brel pa la ltos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin pas de ni sngar gyi 'brel pa la ltos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, that is called “dependent on a previous connection,”

original: 'brel ba dran pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba dran pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it depends on the memory of the connection.

original: de ltar rjes su dpag pa rang nyid me dang nye bar gnas su zin kyang du ba dang mer 'brel pa mthong ba dran pa la ltos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar rjes su dpag pa rang nyid me dang nye bar gnas su zin kyang du ba dang mer 'brel pa mthong ba dran pa la ltos pa bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, even though inference itself is present near the fire, it depends on the memory of seeing the connection between smoke and fire.

original: sngon med bya bas gsal mi byed //
analyzed: sngon med bya bas gsal mi byed //
translated: An unestablished object is not clarified

original: sgra yi gsal byed bkag pa bzhin //
analyzed: sgra yi gsal byed bkag pa bzhin //
translated: Like the sound of a word that is blocked.

original: gsal par byas pa'i bum pa ltar //
analyzed: gsal par byas pa'i bum pa ltar //
translated: Like a clarified pot,

original: sngon med pa yang mi rtag @290a * //
analyzed: sngon med pa yang mi rtag @290a * //
translated: An unestablished object is not clarified.

original: 'dod ; / chos kyang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya bas bsgrubs pa nyid yin gyi gsal bar byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod ; / chos kyang mchod sbyin la sogs pa'i bya bas bsgrubs pa nyid yin gyi gsal bar byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma is also accomplished by the activity of worship, sacrifice, etc., but it is not manifested.

original: byas pa yin pa'i phyir sgra dang mes gsal bar byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa yin pa'i phyir sgra dang mes gsal bar byas pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not manifested by sound or fire, because it is produced.

original: gal te rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos ni bya bas gsal bar byas pa nyid yin gyi byas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos ni bya bas gsal bar byas pa nyid yin gyi byas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the Dharma is manifested by activity, but is not produced, because it is eternal,

original: ji ltar mun pa'i nang na gnas pa'i bum pa mar mes gsal bar byed pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mun pa'i nang na gnas pa'i bum pa mar mes gsal bar byed pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like a pot in the darkness is manifested by a lamp,

original: mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin du lta gzhug na de lta na yang sngon med pa de bum pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar byed pa yin du lta gzhug na de lta na yang sngon med pa de bum pa bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: even if it is manifested, it would be impermanent, like a pot, because it did not previously exist.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa nyams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, your assertion is undermined.🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / zla ba'i btung sogs bya ba'i 'bras //
analyzed: gzhan yang / zla ba'i btung sogs bya ba'i 'bras //
translated: The result of the activity of drinking the moon, etc.

original: rtag pa min pa nyid du 'dod //🔽bya ba'i 'bras bu yin phyir dper //
analyzed: rtag pa min pa nyid du 'dod // bya ba'i 'bras bu yin phyir dper //
translated: Is asserted to be impermanent.🔽Because it is the result of activity,

original: 'dod pa'i rgyu byung 'bras bu bzhin //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu byung 'bras bu bzhin //
translated: Like the result of the desire-born cause.

original: zla ba'i btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gang dag yin pa'i 'bras bu de ni bdud rtsi nyid dang / rtag pa nyid yin par mngon par 'dod du zin kyang mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: zla ba'i btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba gang dag yin pa'i 'bras bu de ni bdud rtsi nyid dang / rtag pa nyid yin par mngon par 'dod du zin kyang mi rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even though you assert that the effect of the actions of drinking the moon, etc. is nectar itself and is permanent, it is impermanent.

original: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the effect of an action.

original: gang dang gang bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa de ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang bya ba'i 'bras bu yin pa de ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Whatever is the effect of an action is impermanent,

original: dper na 'dod pa'i sems pa'i rjes thogs la skyes pa'i yul gyi bde ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod pa'i sems pa'i rjes thogs la skyes pa'i yul gyi bde ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, the effect of the pleasure of an object that arises immediately after the intention to enjoy sense objects.

original: de bzhin du /🔽zla ba'i btung sogs bya ba yis //
analyzed: de bzhin du / zla ba'i btung sogs bya ba yis //
translated: Similarly,

original: thar pa 'thob par mi rigs te //🔽bya ba yin phyir 'dod pa yi //
analyzed: thar pa 'thob par mi rigs te // bya ba yin phyir 'dod pa yi //
translated: it is not logical that liberation is attained🔽through the actions of drinking the moon, etc.🔽Because they are actions, like the cause of sense objects,

original: rgyu mtshan bya ba mi 'dod ltar //

translated: The king, the ṛṣi Mucukunda,

original: khri yi 'og tu zhugs gyur par //
analyzed: khri yi 'og tu zhugs gyur par //
translated: having entered under the throne,

original: nag por gyur pa min nam ci //
analyzed: nag por gyur pa min nam ci //
translated: did not become black, did it not happen?

original: grong khyer mang por gnas pa na //
analyzed: grong khyer mang por gnas pa na //
translated: When he was living in many cities,

original: khung nas rkun mo bzhin 'bros pa //
analyzed: khung nas rkun mo bzhin 'bros pa //
translated: he fled like a thief from a hole.

original: gal te srid gsum de bskyed na //
analyzed: gal te srid gsum de bskyed na //
translated: If he created the three worlds,

original: lha ma yin la ci phyir 'jigs //
analyzed: lha ma yin la ci phyir 'jigs //
translated: why is he afraid of the asuras?

original: gang tshe rgas byed mdas phog nas //
analyzed: gang tshe rgas byed mdas phog nas //
translated: When he was struck by the arrow of old age,

original: 'di ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i tshe //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i tshe //
translated: at the time of his death,

original: de nyid mthong ba'i shes pa dang ; / de yi stobs kyang gang du song //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba'i shes pa dang ; / de yi stobs kyang gang du song //
translated: where did the knowledge that saw reality and his power go?

original: sgyu dang g-yo yis rmongs byas te //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo yis rmongs byas te //
translated: Having deceived him with trickery and deceit,

original: ngan pa'i las la sbyar byas nas //
analyzed: ngan pa'i las la sbyar byas nas //
translated: he was made to engage in evil actions.

original: bla ma gnyen bsad 'jigs pa yis //
analyzed: bla ma gnyen bsad 'jigs pa yis //
translated: Through the fear of killing his guru and friend,

original: srid sgrub tu gyur ji lta bu //
analyzed: srid sgrub tu gyur ji lta bu //
translated: he became the one known as “Siddha.”

original: dgra tshogs zad par bya ba la //
analyzed: dgra tshogs zad par bya ba la //
translated: In order to destroy the host of enemies,

original: nges par rang la nus med pas //
analyzed: nges par rang la nus med pas //
translated: he definitely had no power over himself.

original: gang phyir snying rje med pas gzhan //
analyzed: gang phyir snying rje med pas gzhan //
translated: Since he was without compassion,

original: bskul ba'i don du song bar gyur //
analyzed: bskul ba'i don du song bar gyur //
translated: he went for the sake of inciting others.

original: zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang 'dis thams cad bskyed pa yin na bsil byed ma 'phrog par byed pa'i ma ra na ci'i phyir skyed par byed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / gzhan yang 'dis thams cad bskyed pa yin na bsil byed ma 'phrog par byed pa'i ma ra na ci'i phyir skyed par byed /
translated: And also, if he generated everything, why did he generate Mara, who stole Sita?

original: kun la khyab pa nyid yin na yang ci'i phyir khyab 'jug bdag nyid kyis khyab 'jug gsod par byed /
analyzed: kun la khyab pa nyid yin na yang ci'i phyir khyab 'jug bdag nyid kyis khyab 'jug gsod par byed /
translated: And if he is all-pervading, why did he kill Vishnu, who is all-pervading, himself?

original: @295b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin na yang bsil byed ma sa'i nang du zhugs par gyur pa 'dis ci'i phyir shes par ma gyur /
analyzed: @295b thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin na yang bsil byed ma sa'i nang du zhugs par gyur pa 'dis ci'i phyir shes par ma gyur /
translated: And if he is omniscient, why did he not know that Sita had entered the earth?

original: yang na 'di dag thams cad rtsed mo'i don du bskyed pa yin na yon tan gyi khyad par med pa'i phyir byis pa chung ngu'i rtsed mo dang 'dra bar rtsed mo 'di mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di dag thams cad rtsed mo'i don du bskyed pa yin na yon tan gyi khyad par med pa'i phyir byis pa chung ngu'i rtsed mo dang 'dra bar rtsed mo 'di mtshon par bya'o //
translated: Or else, if all this is created for the sake of play, then this play is like the play of small children, because there is no difference in quality.

original: lha ma yin gtor ma yang khyab 'jug nyid yin /
analyzed: lha ma yin gtor ma yang khyab 'jug nyid yin /
translated: The asura, the sacrificer, is also Viṣṇu himself.

original: khyab 'jug nyid slu bar byed pa yang ji lta bu /
analyzed: khyab 'jug nyid slu bar byed pa yang ji lta bu /
translated: How can Viṣṇu himself be a deceiver?

original: de ni gzhan yin no zhe na skye dgu 'di kun yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan yin no zhe na skye dgu 'di kun yang ma yin no //
translated: If you say that he is different from that, then he is not all of this creation.

original: mchod gnas ma yin pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: mchod gnas ma yin pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: He is not worthy of worship,

original: gang 'di dang phrad nas gtor mas sa chen po sbyin pa byas pa las bcings pa thob par gyur pas so //
analyzed: gang 'di dang phrad nas gtor mas sa chen po sbyin pa byas pa las bcings pa thob par gyur pas so //
translated: because having met him, the sacrificer gave the great gift of the earth and was bound by it.🔽When the earth was submerged in water, he became a boar and lifted it up. Tell me, where did he stand to lift it up?

original: gang gi tshe sa 'di chu'i nang du nub par gyur pa na phag gi gzugs su gyur nas bteg pa'i tshe gang du gnas nas bteg pa yang smros shig / sa la brten nas so zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sa 'di chu'i nang du nub par gyur pa na phag gi gzugs su gyur nas bteg pa'i tshe gang du gnas nas bteg pa yang smros shig / sa la brten nas so zhe na /
translated: If you say, “On the earth,” then where did he stand to lift up the earth?

original: de lta na ni sa gting du nub pa ma yin no / gting du nub po zhe na ni de la brten par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni sa gting du nub pa ma yin no / gting du nub po zhe na ni de la brten par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: If it sinks into the ground, how can it depend on the ground?

original: des na tshul 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tshul 'di rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This method is not logical.

original: de'i phyir sgra gcan yang 'dis ma bskyed pa nyid yin par rigs kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra gcan yang 'dis ma bskyed pa nyid yin par rigs kyi /
translated: Therefore, it is logical that Rāhu was not created by this creator.

original: bskyed nas mgo bcad pa la yon tan ci yod /
analyzed: bskyed nas mgo bcad pa la yon tan ci yod /
translated: What good is it to create and then decapitate him?

original: 'dis bdag cag gi bdud rtsi phrogs par 'gyur ro zhes kyang shes par ci'i phyir ma gyur /🔽dgras 'jigs nas mtshon cha 'dzin par byed pa gnod par byed pa de lta bu yang bskyed nas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'dis bdag cag gi bdud rtsi phrogs par 'gyur ro zhes kyang shes par ci'i phyir ma gyur / dgras 'jigs nas mtshon cha 'dzin par byed pa gnod par byed pa de lta bu yang bskyed nas ci zhig bya /
translated: Why did he not know that this creator would steal his nectar?🔽What is the use of creating a weapon and then fearing it as an enemy?

original: gang gi tshe 'jigs pa med do zhe na yang mtshon cha bzung nas ci zhig bya gzhan gsad pa'i phyir mtshon cha 'dzin pa yin pas rngon pa dang gdol pa la sogs pa bzhin du shin tu chos dang mi ldan par gyur pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jigs pa med do zhe na yang mtshon cha bzung nas ci zhig bya gzhan gsad pa'i phyir mtshon cha 'dzin pa yin pas rngon pa dang gdol pa la sogs pa bzhin du shin tu chos dang mi ldan par gyur pa nyid yin no //
translated: What is the use of holding a weapon when there is no fear? One holds a weapon in order to kill another. Therefore, the creator is not at all righteous, like a hunter, a butcher, and so on.

original: gal te rang gis bskyed pas bsad kyang chos ma yin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gis bskyed pas bsad kyang chos ma yin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is not unrighteous to kill one’s own self,

original: bu la sogs pa bsad pa ltar ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bu la sogs pa bsad pa ltar ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: then it is not certain that it is unrighteous to kill one’s own son, etc.

original: de la gus par gyur pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes gang 'dod pa de yang de'i chung ma dgras khyer bar gyur pa dang / de'i rgyud rgyun chad par gyur pa yang ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: de la gus par gyur pa ni nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes gang 'dod pa de yang de'i chung ma dgras khyer bar gyur pa dang / de'i rgyud rgyun chad par gyur pa yang ji lta bu yin /
translated: If it is argued that one who is devoted to the self does not fall, then how is it that the self of the one whose wife is carried off by an enemy, or whose continuum is severed, does not fall?

original: rang yang lha ma yin rgas byed kyi mdangs rgyab nas shi bar gyur pa yang ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: rang yang lha ma yin rgas byed kyi mdangs rgyab nas shi bar gyur pa yang ji lta bu yin /
translated: And how is it that the self of the asura who dies from the loss of his luster when he grows old does not fall?🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: des na / gang yang cung zhig dbang phyug ldan //🔽gal te de la gnas yin na //
analyzed: des na / gang yang cung zhig dbang phyug ldan // gal te de la gnas yin na //
translated: If the self is the lord of all,

original: de ni kun la khyab nyid min //
analyzed: de ni kun la khyab nyid min //
translated: then it is not all-pervading.

original: des na gzhung 'di dor bar gyis //
analyzed: des na gzhung 'di dor bar gyis //
translated: Therefore, abandon this doctrine.

original: 'og tu zhugs nas sa bteg pa //🔽khyab pa @296a * //
analyzed: 'og tu zhugs nas sa bteg pa // khyab pa @296a * //
translated: If the self is the support below,

original: yin na ji ltar rung //
analyzed: yin na ji ltar rung //
translated: then how can it be all-pervading?

original: 'on te 'di der ma gnas na'ang //
analyzed: 'on te 'di der ma gnas na'ang //
translated: If it is not the support here,

original: khyab par smra par mi mdzes so //
analyzed: khyab par smra par mi mdzes so //
translated: then it is not proper to say it is all-pervading.

original: 'og tu zhugs nas sa 'dzin par //
analyzed: 'og tu zhugs nas sa 'dzin par //
translated: If the self is the support below,

original: nus na drang srong dmod pa yis //
analyzed: nus na drang srong dmod pa yis //
translated: If you can, then by the curse of the sages

original: rang rigs 'og 'gro gyur pa //
analyzed: rang rigs 'og 'gro gyur pa //
translated: Your own kind will go under.

original: 'dzin par mi byed ji lta bu //
analyzed: 'dzin par mi byed ji lta bu //
translated: How can you not be caught?

original: de la gus pa mi nyams zhes //
analyzed: de la gus pa mi nyams zhes //
translated: “I will not lose respect for her.”

original: gang la de lta'i blo yod na //
analyzed: gang la de lta'i blo yod na //
translated: If you have such a thought,🔽How can you not be caught by the enemy,

original: de la gus pa'i bud med dag / ci gzung dgras khyer ji lta bu //
analyzed: de la gus pa'i bud med dag / ci gzung dgras khyer ji lta bu //
translated: The woman who has respect for you?

original: de 'bar shig kyang ma yin gyi //
analyzed: de 'bar shig kyang ma yin gyi //
translated: She is not burning up,🔽But all the others who see her with respect,

original: bshes dang gnyen dang bu rnams dang // de la gus par mthong ba gzhan //
analyzed: bshes dang gnyen dang bu rnams dang // de la gus par mthong ba gzhan //
translated: Her friends, relatives, sons, and so forth,

original: kun kyang nyams par gyur pa nyid //🔽ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kun kyang nyams par gyur pa nyid // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Are all ruined.

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di lta bu dag ni rigs pa ma yin grub pa'i mtha' mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu dag ni rigs pa ma yin grub pa'i mtha' mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Such things are illogical. You do not understand the tenets.

original: khyab 'jug gi ngo bo nyid ni gnyis yin te /
analyzed: khyab 'jug gi ngo bo nyid ni gnyis yin te /
translated: The nature of Viṣṇu is twofold:

original: lta rdzas kyi ngo bo dang / sa steng gi ngo bo can no //
analyzed: lta rdzas kyi ngo bo dang / sa steng gi ngo bo can no //
translated: The nature of divine substance and the nature of the surface of the earth.

original: de la lha rdzas ni zhi ba gcig pu'o //
analyzed: de la lha rdzas ni zhi ba gcig pu'o //
translated: Among them, the divine substance is the one peaceful one.

original: sa steng gi ni zhe ba ma yin pa rnam pa bcu yin la /
analyzed: sa steng gi ni zhe ba ma yin pa rnam pa bcu yin la /
translated: The surface of the earth is the ten kinds that are not peaceful.

original: de 'dir 'ongs nas gdug pa can 'dul ba'i bya ba bstan pa nyid yin te /🔽gang yang / nya dang rus sbal phag pa dang // seng mgo can mi mi'u thung dang // ra mo ra ma khyab 'jug dang // sangs rgyas ka la ka'i can 'di bcu //
analyzed: de 'dir 'ongs nas gdug pa can 'dul ba'i bya ba bstan pa nyid yin te / gang yang / nya dang rus sbal phag pa dang // seng mgo can mi mi'u thung dang // ra mo ra ma khyab 'jug dang // sangs rgyas ka la ka'i can 'di bcu //
translated: He has come here and has shown the activity of subduing the wicked.

original: zhes bya ba smras pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras pa yin no //
translated: And it is said:🔽Fish, tortoise, pig,🔽lion-headed man, dwarf,🔽goat, ram, Viṣṇu,🔽Buddha, and Kālakeya—these ten.

original: rab tu byed pa gnyis kyis gzhan gyi bsam pa bstan pa //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa gnyis kyis gzhan gyi bsam pa bstan pa //
translated: The other intentions are shown by two chapters.🔽If one imagines that this world

original: 'gro ba byed 'di yi dngos gzhan zhig / zhi bar gal te rtog byed la //🔽gang mthong dul gang yang srid du //
analyzed: 'gro ba byed 'di yi dngos gzhan zhig / zhi bar gal te rtog byed la // gang mthong dul gang yang srid du //
translated: is something else, peaceful,🔽then one sees the tamed, and there is no more

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur gang yin pa //🔽'di yi yod min med ma yin //
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur gang yin pa // 'di yi yod min med ma yin //
translated: rebirth for one who is such.🔽It does not exist, nor does it not exist.

original: yod min med pa min pa'ang min //
analyzed: yod min med pa min pa'ang min //
translated: It is not nonexistent, nor is it existent.

original: des na med phyir yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: des na med phyir yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because it does not exist, because it exists,

original: yod med min phyir de ni mchog / ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: yod med min phyir de ni mchog / ces bya ba ste /
translated: and because it is neither existent nor nonexistent, it is supreme.

original: lha rdzas kyi ngo bo ni bsam gtan gyi mig gis mthong bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi ngo bo ni bsam gtan gyi mig gis mthong bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The nature of the divine is to be seen by the eye of concentration.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de ma mthong na yag 'khor bar lus mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis de ma mthong na yag 'khor bar lus mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi //
translated: If the yogis do not see it, then the manifest body will not be born in cyclic existence.

original: 'on kyang 'chi ba med pa la thim par 'gyur ro //🔽'di ni yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid dam /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'chi ba med pa la thim par 'gyur ro // 'di ni yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid dam /
translated: But it dissolves into immortality.🔽It cannot be taught as existent, nonexistent,

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid du yang bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid du yang bstan par mi nus so //
translated: or both existent and nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir na de ni mchog bla na med pa dam pa gtso bo zhes bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na de ni mchog bla na med pa dam pa gtso bo zhes bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is called the supreme, unexcelled, holy, and principal.

original: 'di la 'di ni thal bar 'gyur ba bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la 'di ni thal bar 'gyur ba bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Here, this is the reductio to be proven.

original: ci nya la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang lha rdzas kyi ngo bo de gzhan zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci nya la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang lha rdzas kyi ngo bo de gzhan zhig yin nam /
translated: Is the nature of fish, etc. and the nature of divine substance the same or different?

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: Or is it not?

original: de la @296b gzhan yin pa nyid du ni mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la @296b gzhan yin pa nyid du ni mi 'grub bo //
translated: It is not established as being different.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: nya sogs ngo bo yod pa'i phyir //🔽gzhan yin na yang 'chi med min //🔽gzhan min nyid na'ang gzhan min phyir //
analyzed: nya sogs ngo bo yod pa'i phyir // gzhan yin na yang 'chi med min // gzhan min nyid na'ang gzhan min phyir //
translated: Because the nature of fish, etc. exists,🔽it is not immortal even if it is different.🔽If it is not different, it is not peace,

original: de ni zhi min gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: de ni zhi min gzhan bzhin no //
translated: like something else.

original: lha rdzas kyi ngo bo ni yod pa la sogs pa brjod par bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi ngo bo ni yod pa la sogs pa brjod par bya ba ma yin la /
translated: The nature of the divine substance is not something that can be expressed as existent, etc.

original: nya la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni yod pa'i gzugs yin pas de'i phyir na 'di las gzhan nyid yin par 'dod du zin kyang /
analyzed: nya la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni yod pa'i gzugs yin pas de'i phyir na 'di las gzhan nyid yin par 'dod du zin kyang /
translated: The nature of fish, etc., is an existent form. Therefore, even if one were to accept that it is different from that,

original: de lta na yang 'chi ba med par bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'chi ba med par bstan par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: still, it is not taught to be immortal.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir dbang phyug la sos par bstan pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir dbang phyug la sos par bstan pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it has a different characteristic, like Īśvara.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rtog par byed na yang ji ltar nya la sogs pa'i ngo bo zhi ba ma yin pa dang nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin pa bzhin du lta rdzas kyang ma zhi ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa la sog pa skyon dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid du rtog par byed na yang ji ltar nya la sogs pa'i ngo bo zhi ba ma yin pa dang nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin pa bzhin du lta rdzas kyang ma zhi ba nyid dang / mi rtag pa la sog pa skyon dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one imagines that it is not different, then just as the nature of fish, etc., is not peaceful and does not perish, the divine substance would also not be peaceful and would be impermanent, and so on.

original: gal te gcig ni zhi bdag nyid //
analyzed: gal te gcig ni zhi bdag nyid //
translated: If one is peaceful by nature,

original: yin na'ang gcig ni ma zhi na //
analyzed: yin na'ang gcig ni ma zhi na //
translated: but one part is not peaceful,

original: bud med 'phyon ma'ang bsngags par 'os //
analyzed: bud med 'phyon ma'ang bsngags par 'os //
translated: then even a prostitute would be praiseworthy,

original: lus kyi phyed ni 'dod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: lus kyi phyed ni 'dod pa'i phyir //
translated: because half of her body is desirable.

original: gal te 'di lha rdzas kyi ngo bo ni zhi ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'di lha rdzas kyi ngo bo ni zhi ba yin la /
translated: If you say that the nature of the divine substance is peace,

original: nya la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni ma zhi ba yin no zhes smras na /
analyzed: nya la sogs pa'i ngo bo ni ma zhi ba yin no zhes smras na /
translated: but the nature of fish, etc., is not peace,

original: 'di dag gang zhe na /🔽med pa nyid yin pas des na bdag gi lus phyed ni gzhan la mi 'gro ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag gang zhe na / med pa nyid yin pas des na bdag gi lus phyed ni gzhan la mi 'gro ba nyid yin la /
translated: what are these?🔽Since they do not exist, it would be praiseworthy for a prostitute to say, “Half of my body does not go to another,

original: byed ni gzhan la 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba'i bud med 'phyon ma yang bsngags par bya ba nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: byed ni gzhan la 'gro ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba'i bud med 'phyon ma yang bsngags par bya ba nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: but the other half does go to another.”

original: 'di lta bu'i lugs ni mi srid pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i lugs ni mi srid pa yang yin no //
translated: But such a system is impossible.

original: seng ge'i mgo can gyi mi la sogs pa'i rjes su dpags na /
analyzed: seng ge'i mgo can gyi mi la sogs pa'i rjes su dpags na /
translated: If one infers from the example of a man with a lion’s head,

original: lha rdzas kyi ngo bo yang ma zhi ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi ngo bo yang ma zhi ba nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: the nature of the divine substance would be not peace.

original: de bzhin du //🔽yod sogs sgra yis brjod min phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin du // yod sogs sgra yis brjod min phyir //
translated: Similarly,🔽It is not tenable to call it supreme

original: mchog ces bya ba'ang rigs pa min //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba'ang rigs pa min //
translated: Because it is inexpressible by words such as “exists.”

original: yod na mchog tu rigs 'gyur la //
analyzed: yod na mchog tu rigs 'gyur la //
translated: If it exists, it is tenable to call it supreme,

original: rgyu nyid du yang rigs pa yin //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du yang rigs pa yin //
translated: But it is not tenable as a cause.

original: dngos po yod pa la ni rgyal po bzhin du gtso bo nyid du yang rigs la /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la ni rgyal po bzhin du gtso bo nyid du yang rigs la /
translated: If it exists, it is reasonable that it is the supreme cause, like a king.

original: de nyid ni sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu nyid yin par yang rigs kyi /
analyzed: de nyid ni sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu nyid yin par yang rigs kyi /
translated: And it is reasonable that it is the cause, like a seed, etc.

original: med par ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni mchog nyid dang rgyu nyid yin par rigs pa ma yin no //
