original: yongs su btags pa smos ci dgos //🔽gal te rnal 'byor ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo yang ci zhig la dmigs pa yin par rtog na ni de yang re zhig dmigs pa'i mtshan ma la rtog pa yin pa'i phyir /🔽grol bar mi 'gyur na gang yang blo gang zhig dngos po'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de ni brdzun pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: yongs su btags pa smos ci dgos // gal te rnal 'byor ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i blo yang ci zhig la dmigs pa yin par rtog na ni de yang re zhig dmigs pa'i mtshan ma la rtog pa yin pa'i phyir / grol bar mi 'gyur na gang yang blo gang zhig dngos po'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa de ni brdzun pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: What need is there to mention the thoroughly imagined?🔽If one imagines that even the non-conceptual mind of the yogi is an observation of something, then that mind would not be liberated, since it would be an apprehension of the signs of an object of observation.

original: bden pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Any mind that is by nature an apprehension of the signs of an entity is false and not true,

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it apprehends signs, like the consciousness of form and so on.

original: gzhan yang / chags sogs kun du spyod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chags sogs kun du spyod pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover,

original: tshangs sogs rnams ni phyugs rdzi bzhin //
analyzed: tshangs sogs rnams ni phyugs rdzi bzhin //
translated: Brahma and so on are like cowherds,🔽Because they engage in attachment and so on.

original: de nyid rig pa spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid rig pa spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they abandon the knowledge of reality,

original: rgyu la mkhas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu la mkhas pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not skilled in the cause.

original: don dam pa'i ye shes la sgrib par byed pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams yod par gyur pa grol bar lta ga la 'gyur /🔽des na 'dod chags la sogs pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i ye shes la sgrib par byed pa 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams yod par gyur pa grol bar lta ga la 'gyur / des na 'dod chags la sogs pa ni 'khor ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: How could one who has attachment, aversion, and confusion, which obscure the wisdom of ultimate reality, be liberated?🔽Therefore, only you, not we, are confused about the cause, namely, that attachment and so on are the cause of cyclic existence,

original: 'dod chags zad pa la sogs pa ni thar pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i rgyu la rmongs pa ni khyed kho na yin gyi kho bo cag ni ma yin no //🔽de'i phyir 'di dag nyid de kho na nyid rig pa yin no zhes zer ba de dgag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags zad pa la sogs pa ni thar pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i rgyu la rmongs pa ni khyed kho na yin gyi kho bo cag ni ma yin no // de'i phyir 'di dag nyid de kho na nyid rig pa yin no zhes zer ba de dgag par bya ba yin te /
translated: and that the exhaustion of attachment and so on is the cause of liberation.🔽Therefore, it is you who should be refuted when you say that Brahma, Vishnu, and Mahesvara are knowers of reality.

original: tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po ni don dam pa rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po ni don dam pa rig pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not knowers of reality,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du spyod pa mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du spyod pa mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: because they are seen to engage in attachment and so on,

original: ri brags pa dang rngon pa la sogs pa'i tshogs bzhin no //🔽gzhan yang / bden pa'i chos ni bstan pa'am //
analyzed: ri brags pa dang rngon pa la sogs pa'i tshogs bzhin no // gzhan yang / bden pa'i chos ni bstan pa'am //
translated: like a group of hunters and trappers.🔽Moreover,🔽through teaching the true Dharma

original: rang nyid sgrub par byed pa yis //
analyzed: rang nyid sgrub par byed pa yis //
translated: or through practicing it oneself,

original: chos ni bsrung bar 'gyur yin na //
analyzed: chos ni bsrung bar 'gyur yin na //
translated: The Dharma will be protected.

original: de la 'di ni gnyi ga med//🔽chos bsrung ba ni rang nyid yang dag par bsgrubs par gyur pa'am //
analyzed: de la 'di ni gnyi ga med// chos bsrung ba ni rang nyid yang dag par bsgrubs par gyur pa'am //
translated: But in this case, neither is the case.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i lam nye bar bstan pas yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i lam nye bar bstan pas yin no //
translated: The protection of the Dharma is accomplished either by one’s own practice or by teaching the unmistaken path.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid kyang phyin ci log tu sgrub pa la gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid kyang phyin ci log tu sgrub pa la gnas pa yin na /
translated: But they are themselves engaged in the practice of error.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la 'god par nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la 'god par nus par 'gyur /
translated: How can they establish others in the practice of truth?

original: de'i phyir na tshangs pa la sogs pa 'di dag la ni chos bsrung ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin pas 'di dag ni rang nyid kyang chos bden pa la zhugs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir na tshangs pa la sogs pa 'di dag la ni chos bsrung ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin pas 'di dag ni rang nyid kyang chos bden pa la zhugs pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, since neither of the two kinds of protection of the Dharma is present in Brahmā and the rest, they themselves are not engaged in the practice of the truth of the Dharma,

original: chos bden pa nye bar ston par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos bden pa nye bar ston par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and they do not teach the truth of the Dharma.

original: kun kyang bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid du //🔽smra la rang bdag tha dad pa //🔽@299a * // gang gi tshig la bden pa'am //
analyzed: kun kyang bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid du // smra la rang bdag tha dad pa // @299a * // gang gi tshig la bden pa'am //
translated: All of them are causes of production.🔽They are the teachers of the world.

original: mi bden par ni brtag par bya //
analyzed: mi bden par ni brtag par bya //
translated: But their words should be examined to see if they are true or false.

original: 'di la re zhig tshangs pa ni 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di la re zhig tshangs pa ni 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Brahmā thinks:

original: 'jig rten rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba 'di dag gis bskyed do snyam du sems so //
translated: I have created this world with its moving and unmoving creatures.

original: de'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba dag 'di skad kyang smra ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brang ba dag 'di skad kyang smra ste /
translated: Those who follow his scriptures say:

original: 'di bskal pa gzhan la ni skal ldan zhes bya /
analyzed: 'di bskal pa gzhan la ni skal ldan zhes bya /
translated: In another eon, he was called Bhavya.

original: dang po la ni rang byung zhes bya /
analyzed: dang po la ni rang byung zhes bya /
translated: In the first, he was called Svayambhu.

original: gnyis pa la ni tshangs pa zhes bya /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni tshangs pa zhes bya /
translated: In the second, he was called Brahmā.

original: gsum pa la ni skye dgu'i bdag po zhes bya /🔽bzhi pa la ni padma'i skye gnas can zhes bya /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni skye dgu'i bdag po zhes bya / bzhi pa la ni padma'i skye gnas can zhes bya /
translated: In the third, he was called Prajāpati.🔽In the fourth, he was called Padmodbhava.

original: lnga pa la ni gdong bzhi pa zhes bya /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni gdong bzhi pa zhes bya /
translated: In the fifth, he was called Caturmukha.

original: drug pa la ni mes po zhes bya /🔽bdun pa la ni gser gyi /
analyzed: drug pa la ni mes po zhes bya / bdun pa la ni gser gyi /
translated: In the sixth, he was called Pitamaha.

original: snying po can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying po can zhes bya'o //
translated: In the seventh, he was called Kanakamuni.🔽In the eighth, he was called Kāśyapa.

original: skye dgu'i bdag po byung nas ni 'jig rten gyi ma brgyad bskyed do //
analyzed: skye dgu'i bdag po byung nas ni 'jig rten gyi ma brgyad bskyed do //
translated: After Prajāpati appeared, he created the eight mothers of the world.

original: de nas nyi ma'i mas ni lha thams cad bskyed do //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma'i mas ni lha thams cad bskyed do //
translated: Then, the mother of the sun created all the gods.

original: sbyin byed ma'i mas ni lha ma yin bskyed do //
analyzed: sbyin byed ma'i mas ni lha ma yin bskyed do //
translated: The mother of Dātṛ created the asuras.

original: mi'i mas ni mi rnams so //🔽klu'i mas ni klu rnams so //
analyzed: mi'i mas ni mi rnams so // klu'i mas ni klu rnams so //
translated: Humans are born from the mother of humans.🔽Nāgas are born from the mother of nāgas.

original: nam mkha' lding gi mas ni nam mkha' lding rnams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi mas ni nam mkha' lding rnams so //
translated: Garuḍas are born from the mother of garuḍas.

original: tshangs pa'i kha nas ni bram ze rnams bskyed do //🔽dpung pa las ni rgyal rigs so //🔽bral dag las ni rje'u rigs so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i kha nas ni bram ze rnams bskyed do // dpung pa las ni rgyal rigs so // bral dag las ni rje'u rigs so //
translated: Brahmins are born from the mouth of Brahmā.🔽Kṣatriyas are born from the shoulders.🔽Vaiśyas are born from the thighs.

original: rkang pa'i mthil dag las ni dmangs rigs zhes bya ba la sogs brjod par byed do //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthil dag las ni dmangs rigs zhes bya ba la sogs brjod par byed do //
translated: Śūdras are born from the feet.

original: khyab 'jug dag ni 'di skad du rjod par byed de skal ldan nor lha 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa /
analyzed: khyab 'jug dag ni 'di skad du rjod par byed de skal ldan nor lha 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa thams cad gzigs pa /
translated: Viṣṇu is described as follows: He is omniscient, all-seeing,

original: 'gro ba thams cad kyi byed pa po thar pa sbyin par byed pa 'dod pa'i lha dang / yang dag pa 'dren par byed pa dang / mi 'gag pa dang / nor gyi lha dang / stobs bzangs dang / 'chi med la sogs pa'i ngo bor ni gtsor gnas par byed la /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad kyi byed pa po thar pa sbyin par byed pa 'dod pa'i lha dang / yang dag pa 'dren par byed pa dang / mi 'gag pa dang / nor gyi lha dang / stobs bzangs dang / 'chi med la sogs pa'i ngo bor ni gtsor gnas par byed la /
translated: the creator of all beings, the giver of liberation, the god of love, the true guide, the unobstructed, the god of wealth, the good powerful one, the immortal, and so on.🔽He is the principal one.

original: kun gyi bdag nyid dang / kun la zhugs pa dang / kun la khyab pa la sogs pa yang yin par smra la /
analyzed: kun gyi bdag nyid dang / kun la zhugs pa dang / kun la khyab pa la sogs pa yang yin par smra la /
translated: It is the nature of all, it is present in all, it pervades all.

original: de rang nyid kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: de rang nyid kyang 'di skad du /
translated: And they themselves say this:

original: da ni me chu rlung yang yin //
analyzed: da ni me chu rlung yang yin //
translated: Now it is fire, water, wind,

original: bza' btung skye dgu'i bdag po'ang da //
analyzed: bza' btung skye dgu'i bdag po'ang da //
translated: Now it is food, drink, lord of beings,

original: da ni bram ze'i lus su gnas //
analyzed: da ni bram ze'i lus su gnas //
translated: Now it dwells in the body of a brahmin,

original: spyod pa po yin sbyin po'ang yin //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra'o //
analyzed: spyod pa po yin sbyin po'ang yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra'o //
translated: Now it is the enjoyer, the giver.

original: dbang phyug chen po byed pa po yin zhes kyang kha cig smra ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po byed pa po yin zhes kyang kha cig smra ste /
translated: And some say that Maheśvara is the creator.

original: sa dang / chu dang / rlung dang / me dang / mchod sbyin dang / nam mkha' dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma zhes bya ba brgyad po 'di dag gi gzugs kyis 'jig rten thams cad la khyab par byas nas gnas so zhes 'dod par byed do //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / rlung dang / me dang / mchod sbyin dang / nam mkha' dang / zla ba dang / nyi ma zhes bya ba brgyad po 'di dag gi gzugs kyis 'jig rten thams cad la khyab par byas nas gnas so zhes 'dod par byed do //
translated: They assert that he pervades the entire world in the form of these eight: earth, water, wind, fire, sacrifice, space, moon, and sun.

original: de'i man ngag nyid @299b las 'di skad kyang smra ste /
analyzed: de'i man ngag nyid @299b las 'di skad kyang smra ste /
translated: And they also say this, according to the very words of their own scriptures:

original: phra zhing rtag la lus bral byed med kun khyab byed pa'o //
analyzed: phra zhing rtag la lus bral byed med kun khyab byed pa'o //
translated: It is subtle, permanent, devoid of body, inactive, and all-pervading.

original: goms byed bsam gtan rnal 'byor goms rnams dri med blo yi yul //
analyzed: goms byed bsam gtan rnal 'byor goms rnams dri med blo yi yul //
translated: The yogi who is familiar with the meditation that is the means of familiarization is the object of a stainless mind.

original: zla nyi ma dang sa chu rlung dang mchod sbyin bdag po'i dngos //
analyzed: zla nyi ma dang sa chu rlung dang mchod sbyin bdag po'i dngos //
translated: The sun, the moon, the earth, water, wind, and the lord of sacrifice are real.

original: dbang phyug grub pa'i zhi ba'i bde ba 'dod pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dbang phyug grub pa'i zhi ba'i bde ba 'dod pa bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on the peace and bliss of the lord who is the cause of the desire of the accomplished one.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: This is what they say.

original: 'di gsum char yang rang rang gi nus pa dang skyed par byed pa yin no zhes mang du smra bar byed pa de dag la gang gi ni bden pa yin zhing gang gi ni ma yin /
analyzed: 'di gsum char yang rang rang gi nus pa dang skyed par byed pa yin no zhes mang du smra bar byed pa de dag la gang gi ni bden pa yin zhing gang gi ni ma yin /
translated: They say a lot about how these three are the causes and the producers of their own powers. But which of them is true and which is not?

original: gang gi ni skyed pa po yin zing gang gi ni ma yin zhes the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi ni skyed pa po yin zing gang gi ni ma yin zhes the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Which is the producer and which is not? Doubt arises.

original: de gcig phyir skyon med ce na //
analyzed: de gcig phyir skyon med ce na //
translated: If you say that there is no fault because they are one,

original: tshangs pa tshangs bsad ci lta bu //
analyzed: tshangs pa tshangs bsad ci lta bu //
translated: how is Brahmā killed by Brahmā?

original: gcig nyid rab tu bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gcig nyid rab tu bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: Because oneness is completely refuted,

original: gcig nyid yin par mi rigs so //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin par mi rigs so //
translated: it is not logical that they are one.

original: 'di dag gi dngos po ni gcig yin la /
analyzed: 'di dag gi dngos po ni gcig yin la /
translated: Their entities are one.

original: tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po zhes bya ba ni gsum yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po zhes bya ba ni gsum yin no zhe na /
translated: Brahma, Vishnu, and Maheshvara are the three.

original: gal te 'di'i ngo bo tha dad pa med na gsal pas mchod sbyin grub pa'i dus su dbang phyug chen pos rgyal gyi so phyung ba dang / skal ba can gyi mig ltung bar byas pa na lta'i tshogs thams cad khros par gyur nas smras pa /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i ngo bo tha dad pa med na gsal pas mchod sbyin grub pa'i dus su dbang phyug chen pos rgyal gyi so phyung ba dang / skal ba can gyi mig ltung bar byas pa na lta'i tshogs thams cad khros par gyur nas smras pa /
translated: If their natures are not different, then when Maheshvara, in order to complete the sacrifice, drew out the tooth of Brahma and the eye of Vishnu, the entire assembly of gods became angry and said:🔽“From what is this evil nature born?”🔽Brahma then manifested a head and said, “I will definitely tell of its birth,” but Maheshvara became angry and cut off Brahma’s head with his fingernails.

original: rang bzhin ngan pa 'di gang las skyes pa zhig yin zhes smras pa dang / tshangs pas gdongs gcig sprul nas 'di'i skye ba nges brjod par bya'o zhes smras pa dang / dbang phyug chen po khros par gyur nas tshangs pa'i mgo de sen mos bcad do zhes grags pa ji ltar na tshad sa pas tshangs pa gsad par byed pa yin /
analyzed: rang bzhin ngan pa 'di gang las skyes pa zhig yin zhes smras pa dang / tshangs pas gdongs gcig sprul nas 'di'i skye ba nges brjod par bya'o zhes smras pa dang / dbang phyug chen po khros par gyur nas tshangs pa'i mgo de sen mos bcad do zhes grags pa ji ltar na tshad sa pas tshangs pa gsad par byed pa yin /
translated: How could Maheshvara kill Brahma?

original: rag gi bdag nyid bsad pa yin no zhe na yang ci'i phyir sdig pa dag par bya ba'i phyir dus ring por brtul zhugs spyod par byed /
analyzed: rag gi bdag nyid bsad pa yin no zhe na yang ci'i phyir sdig pa dag par bya ba'i phyir dus ring por brtul zhugs spyod par byed /
translated: But if you say that the self is killed by the self, then why do you practice austerities for a long time in order to purify sin?

original: des na de kho na nyid kyi shes pa tshol pa'i rab tu byed par dngos po thams cad gcig pa nyid dag tha dad pa nyid du bkag pa yin pas tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa de rnams gcig pa nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de kho na nyid kyi shes pa tshol pa'i rab tu byed par dngos po thams cad gcig pa nyid dag tha dad pa nyid du bkag pa yin pas tshangs pa dang / khyab 'jug dang / dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa de rnams gcig pa nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is refuted in the treatise that seeks to understand reality that all things are the same or different, it is also not reasonable that Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Maheśvara, and so on are the same.🔽Moreover:

original: gzhan yang / bdag las dbye ba mi rigs pas //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bdag las dbye ba mi rigs pas //
translated: Since it is unreasonable to divide the self,

original: gsum nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gsum nyid du yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could there be three?

original: gal te 'di rnams kyis bskyed pa la cha gsum gyi dbye bas dbye ba yod de /
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams kyis bskyed pa la cha gsum gyi dbye bas dbye ba yod de /
translated: If you say that because there is a division by way of the three parts that are produced by these,

original: 'di ni tshangs pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshangs pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: this is produced by Brahmā,🔽this is produced by Viṣṇu,🔽and

original: 'di ni khyab 'jug gis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khyab 'jug gis bskyed pa'o //
translated: this is produced by Maheśvara,

original: 'di ni dbang phyug chen pos bskyed pa'o zhes bya bar yod par gyur na ni de rnams kyi bdag gi ngo bo la yang dbye ba yod @300a * //🔽par 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ni dbang phyug chen pos bskyed pa'o zhes bya bar yod par gyur na ni de rnams kyi bdag gi ngo bo la yang dbye ba yod @300a * // par 'dod pa yin na /
translated: If it were to exist as “the great lord produced these,” then they would assert that the nature of the self has divisions.

original: de lta na yag bdag la dbye ba yod par rigs par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gang yang gsum po 'di rnams nyid kun la zhugs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi skyed pa po yin na de lta na yang dbye ba yod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yag bdag la dbye ba yod par rigs par mi 'gyur ro // gang yang gsum po 'di rnams nyid kun la zhugs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi skyed pa po yin na de lta na yang dbye ba yod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But in that case, it would not be logical for the self to have divisions.

original: gcig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig gi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, if these three are present in all and are the producers of all reincarnating beings, then in that case it is not logical for them to have divisions, because they are of the nature of one, like space.

original: gzhan yang / sdug bsngal rgyu la rmongs rnams la //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sdug bsngal rgyu la rmongs rnams la //
translated: Moreover, for those confused about the cause of suffering,

original: de zhi'i gtam yang ga la yod //
analyzed: de zhi'i gtam yang ga la yod //
translated: how can there be a teaching on its pacification?🔽Moreover, for those who are confused about the cause of suffering, how can there be a teaching on the pacification of suffering?

original: gang yang 'di ltar re zhig rang nyid kyi sdug bsngal lo //🔽'di ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang yang 'di ltar re zhig rang nyid kyi sdug bsngal lo // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: “This is suffering.”🔽“This is the cause of the origin of suffering.”

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: “This is the pacification of suffering.”

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal nye par zhi ba'i lam mo zhes bya bar shes par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal nye par zhi ba'i lam mo zhes bya bar shes par gyur na /
translated: This is the path of the complete appeasement of suffering.

original: de gzhan dag la yang zhi ba'i rgyu ston par byed par nus kyi /🔽gang dag 'di ltar rang nyid kyang //
analyzed: de gzhan dag la yang zhi ba'i rgyu ston par byed par nus kyi / gang dag 'di ltar rang nyid kyang //
translated: He is able to teach the cause of peace to others.🔽But those who do not know the cause of entering and leaving cyclic existence

original: 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu mi shes par gyur pa des ji ltar gzhan dag la grol ba'i lam nye bar ston par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rgyu mi shes par gyur pa des ji ltar gzhan dag la grol ba'i lam nye bar ston par 'gyur //
translated: how can they teach the path of liberation to others?

original: rang gis lam mngon par shes pa yin pas gzhan rnams la yang lam nye bar ston par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gis lam mngon par shes pa yin pas gzhan rnams la yang lam nye bar ston par nus pa yin no //
translated: But he who knows the path by his own experience is able to teach the path to others.

original: yang ji ltar de rnams rgyu la rmongs pa yin par nges par gzung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar de rnams rgyu la rmongs pa yin par nges par gzung bar bya zhe na /
translated: But how can it be known with certainty that they are ignorant of the cause?

original: rigs las rnal 'byor bstan pa ni //🔽de bstan pa las nyams pa'i phyir //🔽chos bsrung bar ni nus pa ye //
analyzed: rigs las rnal 'byor bstan pa ni // de bstan pa las nyams pa'i phyir // chos bsrung bar ni nus pa ye //
translated: The teaching of yoga from the lineage🔽is the cause of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: re zhig chos bden smra mi nus //
analyzed: re zhig chos bden smra mi nus //
translated: But they are not able to protect the Dharma,🔽and they are not able to teach the truth of the Dharma.

original: gang rig byed las nye bar bstan pa'i rnal 'byor de ni thar pa'i rgyu nye bar bstan pa las nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: gang rig byed las nye bar bstan pa'i rnal 'byor de ni thar pa'i rgyu nye bar bstan pa las nyams pa yin te /
translated: The yoga that is taught in the Vedas is a degeneration of the teaching of the cause of liberation.

original: phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is mistaken.

original: des na 'di dag ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos smra bar byed pa ma yin pas chos srung bar byed nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di dag ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi chos smra bar byed pa ma yin pas chos srung bar byed nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since they do not speak the Dharma as it really is, they are not able to protect the Dharma.

original: sgrub pa las ni nyams pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgrub pa las ni nyams pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they have degenerated from practice.

original: gzhan dag zhi bar 'khrid mi nus //
analyzed: gzhan dag zhi bar 'khrid mi nus //
translated: They cannot lead others to peace.

original: ji ltar g-yang sar rang lhung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar g-yang sar rang lhung ba //
translated: Just as one who has fallen into a pit

original: gzhan dag 'dren par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'dren par mi nus so //
translated: cannot pull others out of it.

original: sgrub pa las nyams pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyis lam mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgrub pa las nyams pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bdag nyid kyis lam mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they have degenerated from practice means that they do not know the path themselves.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig rang nyid g-yang sar lhung bar gyur na gzhan dag gdon par mi nus pa ltar de bzhin du rang nyid 'khor ba'i g-yang sar khung bar gyur pa nyid kyis gzhan dag gdon par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig rang nyid g-yang sar lhung bar gyur na gzhan dag gdon par mi nus pa ltar de bzhin du rang nyid 'khor ba'i g-yang sar khung bar gyur pa nyid kyis gzhan dag gdon par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as one who has fallen into a pit cannot pull others out of it, so also they cannot pull others out of the pit of samsara, because they themselves have fallen into it.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rim pa de nyid kyis //🔽rtog pa'i dra bas btags pa yi //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rim pa de nyid kyis // rtog pa'i dra bas btags pa yi //
translated: By the very process that has been explained,🔽The three wrong reasons,

original: log pa'i gtan tshigs gsum po la //
analyzed: log pa'i gtan tshigs gsum po la //
translated: Which are imputed by the net of concepts,🔽Are either reasonable or unreasonable.

original: rigs sam @300b mi rigs dpyad nas ni //
analyzed: rigs sam @300b mi rigs dpyad nas ni //
translated: Having analyzed,

original: gsum po 'di ni gtang ba'i rigs //
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni gtang ba'i rigs //
translated: It is proper to abandon these three.

original: grub pa'i mtha' kun dang 'gal ba'i rtog pa'i dra bas nye bar bsags pa'i 'bru dang / byol song dang / mar dang / chung ma'i 'brel ba'i las la sogs pa can gsum po ni thar pa'i rgyu la phyin ci log dang ldan pa yin pas /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' kun dang 'gal ba'i rtog pa'i dra bas nye bar bsags pa'i 'bru dang / byol song dang / mar dang / chung ma'i 'brel ba'i las la sogs pa can gsum po ni thar pa'i rgyu la phyin ci log dang ldan pa yin pas /
translated: The three, which are accumulated by the net of concepts that contradict all the tenets, which have the activity of the relationship of grain, cattle, butter, and wife, etc., are endowed with error with regard to the cause of liberation.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas rigs pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir lam gsum po gang yin pa de ni gtang bar rigs so zhes smras so //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas rigs pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir lam gsum po gang yin pa de ni gtang bar rigs so zhes smras so //
translated: Therefore, in order to prove that they are contradictory to reason by the process that has been taught, it is said that “it is proper to abandon whatever path is one of these three.”🔽Moreover,

original: gzhan yang / sna tshogs byed pa bde byed sogs //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sna tshogs byed pa bde byed sogs //
translated: The creator, the enjoyer, etc.,

original: rigs pa min par sngar smras so //
analyzed: rigs pa min par sngar smras so //
translated: Were previously said to be unreasonable.

original: byed po yin par bden nyid na //
analyzed: byed po yin par bden nyid na //
translated: If they are true as the agent,

original: 'di dag gis ni ci zhig byas //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni ci zhig byas //
translated: What have they done?

original: de kho na nyid kyi shes pa tshol ba'i rab tu byed par dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams thams cad dgag par byas pa de la brnyas nas yang gal te khyed 'gro ba rnams kyi byed pa po dbang phyug la sogs pa yin no snyam du sems
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi shes pa tshol ba'i rab tu byed par dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams thams cad dgag par byas pa de la brnyas nas yang gal te khyed 'gro ba rnams kyi byed pa po dbang phyug la sogs pa yin no snyam du sems
translated: If you think that Īśvara and so on are the creator of the world,

original: na / dngos po ci zhig de dag gis byas par smra dgos so //🔽de la re zhig bdag ni ma skyes phyir //
analyzed: na / dngos po ci zhig de dag gis byas par smra dgos so // de la re zhig bdag ni ma skyes phyir //
translated: then you must say what things they create.🔽First, we do not assert that it is created by Īśvara

original: de yi byas par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de yi byas par mi 'dod do //
translated: because the self is not produced.

original: chos dang chos min des ma skyed //
analyzed: chos dang chos min des ma skyed //
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue are not produced by him.

original: de yi yon tan ji ltar bzhin //
analyzed: de yi yon tan ji ltar bzhin //
translated: How could they be his qualities?

original: re zhig bdag ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir bskyed par mi nus pas de ni dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: re zhig bdag ni ma skyes pa yin pa'i phyir bskyed par mi nus pas de ni dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: First, because the self is not produced, it cannot be created. Therefore it is not created by Īśvara.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa yang de'i yon tan yin par 'dod pas dbang phyug gis bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa yang de'i yon tan yin par 'dod pas dbang phyug gis bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue are asserted to be his qualities. Therefore they are not created by Īśvara.

original: ji ltar na da ltar gyi chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyus mi la sogs pa nyid byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na da ltar gyi chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyus mi la sogs pa nyid byas pa yin gyi /
translated: Just as now, the human and so on are made by the cause of dharma and adharma,

original: ma byas pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa mi dmigs pa ltar sngon yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa mi dmigs pa ltar sngon yang de bzhin no //
translated: but the non-made dharma and adharma are not observed. It was the same in the past.

original: ji ltar yang /
analyzed: ji ltar yang /
translated: And also:

original: gal te 'di dag byed pos yin //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag byed pos yin //
translated: If these are made by an agent,

original: las kyi bya ba'i ma yin na //🔽las dang bya ba de dag gis //
analyzed: las kyi bya ba'i ma yin na // las dang bya ba de dag gis //
translated: not by the action to be done,🔽then how could there be cause and effect

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu ji ltar 'gyur //🔽bde dang sdug bsngal nyer dmigs pa'i //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu ji ltar 'gyur // bde dang sdug bsngal nyer dmigs pa'i //
translated: from those actions and the action to be done?🔽The body is engaged in those

original: lus kyang de dag la 'jug pas //🔽des na lus can rnams kyi lus //
analyzed: lus kyang de dag la 'jug pas // des na lus can rnams kyi lus //
translated: because of the observation of pleasure and pain.🔽Therefore it is not reasonable

original: dbang phyug sogs kyis byas mi rigs //
analyzed: dbang phyug sogs kyis byas mi rigs //
translated: that the bodies of embodied beings are made by Īśvara and so on.

original: lus can rnams kyi lus kyi 'jug pa yang chos dang chos ma yin pa de dag gis byas pa yin te /
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi lus kyi 'jug pa yang chos dang chos ma yin pa de dag gis byas pa yin te /
translated: The engagement of the bodies of embodied beings is also made by those dharmas and adharmas,

original: ci'i phyir na bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na bde ba dang sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they experience pleasure and pain.

original: des na lus kyang dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na lus kyang dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the body is also not made by Īśvara.

original: gal te yang dang po srid pa'i dus na ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dbang phyug gis byas pa nyid yin la /🔽de phyin chad kyi 'jug pa ni chos @301a * //
analyzed: gal te yang dang po srid pa'i dus na ni chos dang chos ma yin pa dbang phyug gis byas pa nyid yin la / de phyin chad kyi 'jug pa ni chos @301a * //
translated: If you say that at the time of the first eon, the body of the first sentient being was created by Īśvara,

original: ma yin pas byas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma yin pas byas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and that the subsequent engagement of sentient beings is due to non-virtue,🔽then we reply:

original: de la / bskal pa dang po'i lus can lus //
analyzed: de la / bskal pa dang po'i lus can lus //
translated: The body of the first sentient being

original: sngon byas ma mthong rgyu can te //
analyzed: sngon byas ma mthong rgyu can te //
translated: is not seen to have been created by a cause,

original: bde sogs 'byung ba'i rgyu yin phyir //
analyzed: bde sogs 'byung ba'i rgyu yin phyir //
translated: because it is the cause of the arising of pleasure and so on,

original: dper na da ltar lus bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na da ltar lus bzhin no //
translated: like the body in the present.

original: bskal pa dang po ba'i lus can rnams kyi lus byung bar gyur pa yang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid nas de dag gis sngon byas pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyu can nyid yin te /
analyzed: bskal pa dang po ba'i lus can rnams kyi lus byung bar gyur pa yang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nyid nas de dag gis sngon byas pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa'i rgyu can nyid yin te /
translated: The body of the first sentient being in the first eon arose due to the causes of virtue and nonvirtue created by them since beginningless saṃsāra.

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because it is the cause of the arising of pleasure and so on.

original: dper na da ltar gyi lus kyi rgyu chos dang chos ma yin pa ltar bskal pa dang po pa'i lus kyang de bzhin yin pas dbang phyug gis byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi lus kyi rgyu chos dang chos ma yin pa ltar bskal pa dang po pa'i lus kyang de bzhin yin pas dbang phyug gis byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Like the body in the present, which is the result of virtue and nonvirtue, the body of the first sentient being in the first eon is also like that. Therefore it was not created by Īśvara.

original: gzhan yang / gal te dbang phyug gi dbang phyug / de yang bsod nams byas she na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te dbang phyug gi dbang phyug / de yang bsod nams byas she na //
translated: Moreover,🔽If the sovereignty of Īśvara is the result of his merit,

original: de yang bsod nams gzhan dbang phyir //
analyzed: de yang bsod nams gzhan dbang phyir //
translated: then his sovereignty is dependent on another’s merit.

original: dbang phyug dbang phyug min par 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang phyug dbang phyug min par 'gyur //
translated: So Īśvara is not sovereign.

original: 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa gang cung zhig ci yod pa de thams cad ni bsod nams kyis byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa gang cung zhig ci yod pa de thams cad ni bsod nams kyis byas pa yin te /
translated: Whatever excellence there is in the world is the result of merit.

original: lung las / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan gyis longs spyod dang / mtho ris dang / byang grol thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung las / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsam gtan gyis longs spyod dang / mtho ris dang / byang grol thob par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in the scriptures: “One obtains wealth, high status, and liberation through generosity, moral discipline, and meditative concentration.”

original: de la gal te dbang phyug gi dbang phyug kyang bsod nams kyis byas pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: de la gal te dbang phyug gi dbang phyug kyang bsod nams kyis byas pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the sovereignty of Īśvara is the result of his merit,

original: bsod nams kyi gzhan dbang du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dbang phyug nyid nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi gzhan dbang du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dbang phyug nyid nyams pa yin no //
translated: then his sovereignty is dependent on another’s merit. So his sovereignty is undermined.

original: gal te yang /
analyzed: gal te yang /
translated: If you assert that

original: gal te dbang phyug gi dbang phyug / glo bur gyur par 'dod na ni //
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug gi dbang phyug / glo bur gyur par 'dod na ni //
translated: the sovereignty of Īśvara is adventitious,🔽then his sovereignty is not permanent.

original: des na gzhan dang mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: des na gzhan dang mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: Therefore, because of being similar to others,

original: dbang phyug dbang phyug min par 'gyur //
analyzed: dbang phyug dbang phyug min par 'gyur //
translated: Īśvara would not be Īśvara.

original: 'di'i dbang phyug nyid ni rang byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i dbang phyug nyid ni rang byung ba yin gyi /
translated: If you say that his Īśvaratva is self-arisen,

original: bsod nams kyis byas pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams kyis byas pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and not made by merit,

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyang dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyang dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then all of the world would become Īśvara,

original: bsod nams la ltos mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams la ltos mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not need to depend on merit.

original: gzhan yang / dbang phyug shes dngos yin zhe na //🔽des na des byas 'gro ba rnams //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dbang phyug shes dngos yin zhe na // des na des byas 'gro ba rnams //
translated: Moreover, if you say that Īśvara is a knowing thing,

original: rgyu yi rjes su byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu yi rjes su byed pa'i phyir //
translated: then because the world would follow after its cause,

original: kun kyang sems dang ldan par gyur //
analyzed: kun kyang sems dang ldan par gyur //
translated: all would be endowed with mind,🔽because the world would follow after its cause.

original: 'jig rten na ni 'bras bu rgyu dang rjes su mthun par 'byung ba mthong ste /🔽sems med pa'i nas la sogs pa dag las ni sems med pa'i myu gu la sogs pa 'byung la /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni 'bras bu rgyu dang rjes su mthun par 'byung ba mthong ste / sems med pa'i nas la sogs pa dag las ni sems med pa'i myu gu la sogs pa 'byung la /
translated: In the world, effects arise in accordance with their causes.🔽From seeds that are mindless, sprouts that are mindless arise.

original: sems dang bcas pa'i mi la sogs pa dag las ni sems dang bcas pa'i lus can 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems dang bcas pa'i mi la sogs pa dag las ni sems dang bcas pa'i lus can 'byung ngo //
translated: From humans that are endowed with mind, embodied beings that are endowed with mind arise.

original: de la gal te dbang phyug shes pa'i ngo bo zhig yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa 'byung @301b ba yin pa'i phyir des na 'gro ba thams cad sems dang bcas pa yin par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te dbang phyug shes pa'i ngo bo zhig yin na rgyu dang 'bras bu mthun pa 'byung @301b ba yin pa'i phyir des na 'gro ba thams cad sems dang bcas pa yin par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If Īśvara is the nature of consciousness, then because cause and effect would be similar, it follows that all sentient beings would possess consciousness.

original: gzhan yang / gal te dbang phyug rgyu yin na //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te dbang phyug rgyu yin na //
translated: Moreover, if Īśvara is the cause,

original: 'gro ba phra sogs ldan par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba phra sogs ldan par 'gyur //
translated: then the world would possess subtlety and so on.

original: gal te 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyu dbang phyug yin na /
translated: If Īśvara is the cause of all sentient beings,

original: ji ltar dbang phyug phra ba dang / mchod par byas pa dang / yang ba dang / bdag por gyur pa dang / dbang du gyur pa dang / gar yang phyin pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan pa dang / dga' mgur shes pa dang ldan pa ltar de bzhin du 'gro ba rnams kyang dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad dang ldan par 'gyur bar rigs na /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang phyug phra ba dang / mchod par byas pa dang / yang ba dang / bdag por gyur pa dang / dbang du gyur pa dang / gar yang phyin pa dang / 'dod dgur ldan pa dang / dga' mgur shes pa dang ldan pa ltar de bzhin du 'gro ba rnams kyang dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad dang ldan par 'gyur bar rigs na /
translated: then just as Īśvara is subtle, is worshipped, is light, is a lord, is powerful, goes everywhere, possesses whatever he desires, and possesses knowledge of whatever he delights in, it would make sense that sentient beings would possess Īśvara’s eight qualities.

original: 'gro ba rnams ni dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams ni dbang phyug gi yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But sentient beings do not possess Īśvara’s eight qualities.

original: des na 'di ltar 'gro ba rnams kyi byed pa po ni dbang phyug ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar 'gro ba rnams kyi byed pa po ni dbang phyug ma yin no zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that Īśvara is not the creator of beings.

original: gzhan yang 'di ltar /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di ltar /
translated: Moreover,

original: las byed dbang phyug yin zhe na //
analyzed: las byed dbang phyug yin zhe na //
translated: If Īśvara is the agent of action,

original: de yang dmyal ba dag tu 'tshed //
analyzed: de yang dmyal ba dag tu 'tshed //
translated: He would be tormented in the hells.

original: de min gzhan dag 'tshed na ni //
analyzed: de min gzhan dag 'tshed na ni //
translated: If he is not, but others are tormented,

original: byas nyams ma byas phrad par 'gyur //
analyzed: byas nyams ma byas phrad par 'gyur //
translated: Then one would encounter the results of actions not done.

original: gang 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las skye bo dag gis byed pa de'i byed pa po dbang phyug yin nam /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las skye bo dag gis byed pa de'i byed pa po dbang phyug yin nam /
translated: If the agent of the actions done by beings—whether virtuous or nonvirtuous—is Īśvara,

original: 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin /
translated: is he or is he not the agent?

original: gal te byed pa po yin na ni sdig pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po yin na ni sdig pa byed pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If he is the agent, then because he is the doer of evil,

original: dmyal ba'i me 'bar ba'i phreng ba la sogs bdag tu sreg par gyur pa na ji ltar dbang phyug las nyams par gyur pa ma yin ;
analyzed: dmyal ba'i me 'bar ba'i phreng ba la sogs bdag tu sreg par gyur pa na ji ltar dbang phyug las nyams par gyur pa ma yin ;
translated: how is it that he is not deprived of his lordship when he is tormented by the blazing garlands of fire in the hells?

original: 'on te sdig pa byas su zin kyang 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sdig pa byas su zin kyang 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if he is the doer of evil, how is it that the result does not occur?

original: las byas pa rnams chud zos par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: las byas pa rnams chud zos par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The actions that he has done would be wasted.

original: dbang phyug gis byas pa'i las rnams kyis de rnams dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis byas pa'i las rnams kyis de rnams dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that they experience the suffering of hell due to actions created by Īśvara,

original: ma byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa yin pas ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byas pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa yin pas ma byas pa dang phrad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would experience the effects of actions not done, and the error of experiencing the effects of actions not done would ensue.

original: thar pa med pa yang yin te /
analyzed: thar pa med pa yang yin te /
translated: Also, there would be no liberation,

original: rtag tu sdug bsngal rgyu ldan phyir //
analyzed: rtag tu sdug bsngal rgyu ldan phyir //
translated: because they would always possess the cause of suffering.

original: rtag tu sdug bsngal ga la khri //🔽me ni 'bar bar gyur pa yi //
analyzed: rtag tu sdug bsngal ga la khri // me ni 'bar bar gyur pa yi //
translated: How could they be liberated from suffering?🔽Just as one sees that fire

original: tsha ba ma zhi mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: tsha ba ma zhi mthong ba bzhin //
translated: is hot and burning,

original: sdug bsngal gyi byed pa po dbang phyug yin la de yang rtag pa yin pas rtag tu sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi byed pa po dbang phyug yin la de yang rtag pa yin pas rtag tu sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if Īśvara is the creator of suffering and he is permanent, then suffering would always be experienced.

original: sdug bsngal med pa ni thar pa yin na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa ni thar pa yin na /
translated: If the absence of suffering is liberation,

original: de ni rtag pas nam yang gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni rtag pas nam yang gzhan du bya bar mi nus pa yin pa'i phyir //
translated: then that is permanent, and it is impossible to make it otherwise.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu byed pa po dbang phyug rtag tu yod na de zhi bar ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu byed pa po dbang phyug rtag tu yod na de zhi bar ga la 'gyur te /
translated: If the permanent Īśvara, the creator of the cause of suffering, always exists, how could that suffering be pacified?

original: dper na 'bar ba'i phreng bas kun nas bskor ba'i me yod na de'i tsha ba zhi bar @302a * //
analyzed: dper na 'bar ba'i phreng bas kun nas bskor ba'i me yod na de'i tsha ba zhi bar @302a * //
translated: For example, when there is fire surrounded by a garland of flames, its heat is not extinguished.

original: 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is not reasonable that the heat of a fire surrounded by a garland of flames would be extinguished.

original: gcig pu sna tshogs min zhe na //
analyzed: gcig pu sna tshogs min zhe na //
translated: If you say that the one is not various,

original: 'bras bu sna tshogs ji lta bu //
analyzed: 'bras bu sna tshogs ji lta bu //
translated: how is the effect various?

original: 'dod pas sna tshogs yin zhe na'ang //
analyzed: 'dod pas sna tshogs yin zhe na'ang //
translated: If you say that it is various due to desire,

original: gcig pu sna tshogs mi rigs so //
analyzed: gcig pu sna tshogs mi rigs so //
translated: it is not reasonable that the one is various.

original: gal te dbang phyug ni gcig nyid yin gyi sna tshogs ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dbang phyug ni gcig nyid yin gyi sna tshogs ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that God is one and not various,

original: 'bras bu rnams kyang dngos po gcig yin par 'gyur gyi sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro //🔽gal te 'dod pa'i dbang gis sna tshogs nyid yin par 'dod na yang sngar ni gzhan 'dod par byed la /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyang dngos po gcig yin par 'gyur gyi sna tshogs su mi 'gyur ro // gal te 'dod pa'i dbang gis sna tshogs nyid yin par 'dod na yang sngar ni gzhan 'dod par byed la /
translated: the effects would be one thing and not various.🔽If you say that he is various due to desire,

original: phyis kyang gzhan 'dod par byed pas dbang phyug 'di'i ngo bo gcig nyid du mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: phyis kyang gzhan 'dod par byed pas dbang phyug 'di'i ngo bo gcig nyid du mi 'grub bo //
translated: then he would be making something else his desire earlier and making something else his desire later, and so this God would not be established as one entity.

original: gzhan yang / rtag pa cha med phra ba dang // 'gro ba'i byed po gcig po nyid //
analyzed: gzhan yang / rtag pa cha med phra ba dang // 'gro ba'i byed po gcig po nyid //
translated: Moreover, the one who is permanent, partless, subtle,🔽and the creator of the world,

original: kun la khyab pa yin no lo //
analyzed: kun la khyab pa yin no lo //
translated: It is all-pervading.

original: 'di las mtshar ba gzhan ci yod //
analyzed: 'di las mtshar ba gzhan ci yod //
translated: What could be more absurd?

original: rgyu 'gyur ba med pa'i 'bras bu gang gi yang rgyur gyur pa ma yin pas des na 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di'i rtag pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: rgyu 'gyur ba med pa'i 'bras bu gang gi yang rgyur gyur pa ma yin pas des na 'gro ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'di'i rtag pa nyid nyams so //
translated: Since it is not a cause of anything, because it does not change, it is not a cause of the world. Therefore, its permanence is undermined.

original: cha shas med pa yin pa'i phyir dang phra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: cha shas med pa yin pa'i phyir dang phra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir yod pa nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: It is not existent because it is partless and subtle.

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir kun la khyab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir kun la khyab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not all-pervading because it is one.

original: des na rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i tshig 'di lta bu ni ngo mtshar 'ba' zhig tu bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rigs pa dang mi ldan pa'i tshig 'di lta bu ni ngo mtshar 'ba' zhig tu bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, such an irrational statement is just absurd.

original: gal te mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid yin kyang rtsed mo'i don du sna tshogs 'di skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid yin kyang rtsed mo'i don du sna tshogs 'di skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Even if it is not changing, it generates this variety for the sake of play.

original: yang 'gyur ba yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang 'gyur ba yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not change.

original: de bskyed pa'i 'bras bu ni dga' ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bskyed pa'i 'bras bu ni dga' ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The result that it generates is pleasure.

original: gang 'di lta bu'i dga' ba'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di'i dbang phyug nyid nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'di lta bu'i dga' ba'i gzhan dbang du gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di'i dbang phyug nyid nyams pa yin no //
translated: For, being thus overpowered by joy, his sovereignty is lost.

original: snying rje dang bral ba nyid kyis skye bo gdug pa can dang khyad par med par bzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: snying rje dang bral ba nyid kyis skye bo gdug pa can dang khyad par med par bzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras pa /
translated: He should be considered as no different from a wicked person, because he is devoid of compassion.

original: phan tshun za bas 'jigs pa yi //
analyzed: phan tshun za bas 'jigs pa yi //
translated: The animals, who are in fear of devouring each other,🔽and who find pleasure with difficulty,

original: bde ba rnyed dka'i dud 'gro dang // zhib tu 'thag cing gcod 'bigs pa'i //
analyzed: bde ba rnyed dka'i dud 'gro dang // zhib tu 'thag cing gcod 'bigs pa'i //
translated: the hell-beings, who are tormented by suffering,🔽and who are cut, ground, and pierced,🔽the humans, who are wounded by the arrows of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal gyis gzir dmyal ba dang // mi rnams skye rga nad dag dang // sdug bsngal zug rngu'i rma gtod nas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis gzir dmyal ba dang // mi rnams skye rga nad dag dang // sdug bsngal zug rngu'i rma gtod nas //
translated: birth, old age, and disease,

original: dka' gyur gang yin drag po zhes //
analyzed: dka' gyur gang yin drag po zhes //
translated: are the ones who are called “the fierce ones,”🔽because they are difficult to tame.

original: ming don ldan pa de phyag 'tshal //
analyzed: ming don ldan pa de phyag 'tshal //
translated: I pay homage to them, who are rightly named.

original: rtsed mo yin yang bdag dang gzhan bde bar byed pa de ni bya bar rigs na /
analyzed: rtsed mo yin yang bdag dang gzhan bde bar byed pa de ni bya bar rigs na /
translated: It is right to do what is beneficial to oneself and others, even if it is only a matter of play.

original: rtsed mo gang zhig bdag 'ba' zhig bde'i gzhan rnams la shin tu gnod par gyur pa skye bo sdig pa can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par zhugs pa gang yin pa @302b des ci zhig bya //
analyzed: rtsed mo gang zhig bdag 'ba' zhig bde'i gzhan rnams la shin tu gnod par gyur pa skye bo sdig pa can gyi spyod pa dang mthun par zhugs pa gang yin pa @302b des ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the point of a game that only brings happiness to oneself and causes great harm to others, and that is consistent with the behavior of sinful people?

original: dud 'gro rnams gcig la gcig za ba la sogs pa byed pas srog gi ngor shin tu 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pa dang / dmyal ba rnams kyang zhib tu 'thag pa dang / gcad pa dang / dbug pa dang / btso ba dang / bsreg pa dang /
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams gcig la gcig za ba la sogs pa byed pas srog gi ngor shin tu 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pa dang / dmyal ba rnams kyang zhib tu 'thag pa dang / gcad pa dang / dbug pa dang / btso ba dang / bsreg pa dang /
translated: Animals are terrified of being killed by one another, and hell beings are terrified of being ground, cut, stabbed, boiled, and burned.

original: gsad pa la sogs pa dang / mi rnams kyang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal ba mthong ba na dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir des na sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i don gyis drag po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsad pa la sogs pa dang / mi rnams kyang skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba la sogs pas sdug bsngal ba mthong ba na dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir des na sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i don gyis drag po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and when he sees people being killed and so on, and when he sees people suffering from birth, old age, sickness, death, grief, lamentation, suffering, and unhappiness, he feels joy. Therefore, he is called Rudra, in the sense of “one who causes suffering.”

original: de ni don dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi ming don dang ldan pa drag po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni don dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi ming don dang ldan pa drag po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This name is appropriate to his meaning, for he is called Rudra because he is endowed with the meaning of his name.

original: snying rje med pa 'gro ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bsting ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje med pa 'gro ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes bsting ba'o //
translated: So, with sarcasm, the verse says, “Homage to him, the merciless one, who causes the suffering of the world.”🔽If you want to know, tell me: “I see some who are wealthy,

original: gal te ci khyod ci 'dod pa smros shig /'dzin pa can gang nor ldan dang // gzhan gyi 'tsho bcas dge ba can //
analyzed: gal te ci khyod ci 'dod pa smros shig /'dzin pa can gang nor ldan dang // gzhan gyi 'tsho bcas dge ba can //
translated: who live off others, who are virtuous,

original: chos min can 'ga' mthong nas ldan //
analyzed: chos min can 'ga' mthong nas ldan //
translated: who are not religious, and who are endowed with

original: dbang phyug spyod par gsal ba yin //
analyzed: dbang phyug spyod par gsal ba yin //
translated: the conduct of the Lord.”

original: yon tan nor ldan tshe thung dang // ngan par spyod rnams tshe ring dang // gtong ldan dbul po mthong bas na //
analyzed: yon tan nor ldan tshe thung dang // ngan par spyod rnams tshe ring dang // gtong ldan dbul po mthong bas na //
translated: Those who are generous are seen to be poor,🔽while those who are miserly are seen to be wealthy.

original: dbang phyug gis byas gsal ba yin //
analyzed: dbang phyug gis byas gsal ba yin //
translated: This makes it clear that the powerful are the creators.🔽Those who are virtuous and habituated to generosity obtain wealth.

original: gtong ba la goms pa'i dge ba can ni nor 'thob par 'gyur zhing nor dang ldan par gyur nas kyang gtong ba'i dang tshul can du 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gtong ba la goms pa'i dge ba can ni nor 'thob par 'gyur zhing nor dang ldan par gyur nas kyang gtong ba'i dang tshul can du 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Having become wealthy, they become generous.

original: gzhan du 'dzin pa can la nor dang ldan par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du 'dzin pa can la nor dang ldan par mthong ngo //
translated: But those who are miserly are seen to become wealthy.

original: de bzhin du dge ba dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi gdong la blta bar mi 'gyur bar rigs la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi gdong la blta bar mi 'gyur bar rigs la /
translated: Similarly, it is reasonable that those who are virtuous do not look to the faces of others.

original: dge ba can ma yin na ni go 'phang mthon po 'thob par mi rigs na /
analyzed: dge ba can ma yin na ni go 'phang mthon po 'thob par mi rigs na /
translated: But it is unreasonable that those who are not virtuous obtain high status.

original: chos dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi slong mo la slogs pas 'tsho ba mthong la /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ni gzhan gyi slong mo la slogs pas 'tsho ba mthong la /
translated: Those who are righteous are seen to live by begging from others.

original: chos dang mi ldan pa ni go 'phang mthon po la gnas pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: chos dang mi ldan pa ni go 'phang mthon po la gnas pa mthong ngo //
translated: But those who are unrighteous are seen to have high status.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa ni tshe ring la /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa ni tshe ring la /
translated: Those who have good qualities have short lives,🔽while those who are evil have long lives.

original: ngan par spyod pa la zhugs pa ni tshe thung ba dang / gtong ba dang ldan pa ni 'byor pa dang ldan par rigs na /
analyzed: ngan par spyod pa la zhugs pa ni tshe thung ba dang / gtong ba dang ldan pa ni 'byor pa dang ldan par rigs na /
translated: Those who engage in evil conduct have short lives, and those who are generous are wealthy.

original: 'di dag thams cad phyin ci log tu mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad phyin ci log tu mthong ste /
translated: But all of this is seen in reverse.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar nges pa kho nar 'di dag ni dbang phyug gis byas pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar nges pa kho nar 'di dag ni dbang phyug gis byas pa yin no zhes shes par bya'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood with certainty that all of this is created by Īśvara.”

original: 'di dag thams cad rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: We think that all of this is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Why?

original: kha cig sangs rgyas pa yang bde //
analyzed: kha cig sangs rgyas pa yang bde //
translated: Some Buddhists are happy.

original: de la gus pa kha cig sdug /🔽@303a * // dbang phyug bkas ni bsod nams can //
analyzed: de la gus pa kha cig sdug / @303a * // dbang phyug bkas ni bsod nams can //
translated: Some who revere him are miserable.🔽Why don’t the righteous

original: dag kyang ci phyir sdig mi byed //
analyzed: dag kyang ci phyir sdig mi byed //
translated: who are commanded by Īśvara commit evil?

original: gal te thams cad kyi byed pa po dbang phyug yin na /
analyzed: gal te thams cad kyi byed pa po dbang phyug yin na /
translated: If Īśvara is the creator of all,

original: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas pa la yang bde ba dang ldan pa mthong la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sangs rgyas pa la yang bde ba dang ldan pa mthong la /
translated: why is it that some Buddhists are seen to be happy

original: de la gus pa yang sdug bsngal dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de la gus pa yang sdug bsngal dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: and some who revere him are miserable?

original: 'jig rten na kha cig sdig pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa long ba dang / 'on pa dang / nad pa la sogs pa yang mthong na de dag ci'i phyir bsod nams kyi snod du ma gyur /
analyzed: 'jig rten na kha cig sdig pa'i las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa long ba dang / 'on pa dang / nad pa la sogs pa yang mthong na de dag ci'i phyir bsod nams kyi snod du ma gyur /
translated: In the world, some experience the results of sinful karma, such as being blind, deaf, sick, and so on. Why are they not vessels of merit?

original: gang yang gzugs bzang ba dang / stobs dang ldan pa bsod nams kyis las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa yang snang na de dag ci'i phyir dbang phyug gi bka' bzhin du sdig pa spyod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang gzugs bzang ba dang / stobs dang ldan pa bsod nams kyis las kyi 'bras bu la spyod pa yang snang na de dag ci'i phyir dbang phyug gi bka' bzhin du sdig pa spyod par mi 'gyur /
translated: Some who have good physical form and are powerful appear to experience the results of meritorious karma. Why do they not engage in sin as they wish, as if they were under the command of Īśvara?

original: des na 'di ltar ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is logical.

original: sna tshogs las las mi shes pas //
analyzed: sna tshogs las las mi shes pas //
translated: The diversity of the world is not known to be from karma.

original: de rgyu nyid du smra ba yin //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du smra ba yin //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the cause of that.

original: 'gro ba sna tshogs 'di dag gi rgyu ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las nyid yin pas des na sna tshogs 'di dag ni las kyis byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'gro ba sna tshogs 'di dag gi rgyu ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las nyid yin pas des na sna tshogs 'di dag ni las kyis byas pa yin la /
translated: The cause of this diversity of the world is virtuous and nonvirtuous karma. Therefore this diversity is created by karma.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni dbang phyug yin no zhes mi shes pa dag gis sgro 'dogs shing rjod par byed kyang ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas bsgrub par ni dka'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyu ni dbang phyug yin no zhes mi shes pa dag gis sgro 'dogs shing rjod par byed kyang ji skad bstan pa'i rim pas bsgrub par ni dka'o //
translated: The cause of beings is God, so say those who are ignorant and who imagine and speak thus. But it is difficult to establish this by the method taught above.

original: 'di'i skye ba po dang byed pa po nyid dgag pa byas pas tshangs pa dang nag po yang 'dra bar dpyad par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i skye ba po dang byed pa po nyid dgag pa byas pas tshangs pa dang nag po yang 'dra bar dpyad par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since the status of creator and agent of this is refuted, Brahmā and Kṛṣṇa are also to be examined in the same way.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: sna tshogs byed par tshangs pa ni //
analyzed: sna tshogs byed par tshangs pa ni //
translated: Brahmā is not the creator of the world

original: mi rigs sngon du bstan pa bzhin //
analyzed: mi rigs sngon du bstan pa bzhin //
translated: as was previously explained in the case of Īśvara.

original: tshangs pa byed por bden na yang //
analyzed: tshangs pa byed por bden na yang //
translated: Even if Brahmā is the creator,

original: de yis ci zhig byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yis ci zhig byas par 'gyur //
translated: what would he have created?

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: sna tshogs byed po khyab 'jug min //
analyzed: sna tshogs byed po khyab 'jug min //
translated: Viṣṇu is not the creator of the world.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: shi ba'i rgyud las bstan pa'i bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor yang mi rigs pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: shi ba'i rgyud las bstan pa'i bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor yang mi rigs pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to prove that the meditative yoga taught in the Śvetāśvatara Upaniṣad is illogical, he says:

original: dang por sems ni mnyam gzhag pas //
analyzed: dang por sems ni mnyam gzhag pas //
translated: First, by the mind being in equipoise,

original: blo yi sgo rnams legs bsdams la //
analyzed: blo yi sgo rnams legs bsdams la //
translated: the doors of the mind are well restrained.

original: yid la shi ba gzhag par bya //
analyzed: yid la shi ba gzhag par bya //
translated: And the mind should be placed on death.

original: 'di ltar yi ge aom bsgoms te //
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge aom bsgoms te //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the syllable oṃ,

original: snying la gzugs kyis gzung byas pa //
analyzed: snying la gzugs kyis gzung byas pa //
translated: And hold it in the form in the heart.

original: sa sogs gzugs la goms par bya //🔽bde byed mnyes na sdug bsngal las //
analyzed: sa sogs gzugs la goms par bya // bde byed mnyes na sdug bsngal las //
translated: One should practice with the form of earth, and so on.🔽If one is pleased by what is beneficial, one will be liberated from suffering.

original: grol 'gyur zer ba 'di mi bde na //
analyzed: grol 'gyur zer ba 'di mi bde na //
translated: But this is not good.

original: 'di la rnal 'byor pas dang por mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems su byas la /
analyzed: 'di la rnal 'byor pas dang por mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems su byas la /
translated: Here, the yogi should first make the mind equipoised,

original: blo'i sgo dbang po thams cad bsdams te /
analyzed: blo'i sgo dbang po thams cad bsdams te /
translated: and having restrained all the doors of the mind and the senses,

original: phra brtag pa cha shes med pa zhi ba la dmigs par bya ste /
analyzed: phra brtag pa cha shes med pa zhi ba la dmigs par bya ste /
translated: he should focus on the subtle, the partless, the peaceful.

original: tshad gsum dang ldan pa'i yi ge aom brjod cing /
analyzed: tshad gsum dang ldan pa'i yi ge aom brjod cing /
translated: Reciting the syllable oṃ, which has three measures,

original: @303b sa la sogs pa bstan bcos las bstan pa bzhin du gzung bar bya zhing sems la bzung na /
analyzed: @303b sa la sogs pa bstan bcos las bstan pa bzhin du gzung bar bya zhing sems la bzung na /
translated: and holding it in the mind as taught in the treatises on earth, and so on,

original: bsam gtan gyi mig gis dbang phyug chen po mthong bar 'gyur zhing grol ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang 'dod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi mig gis dbang phyug chen po mthong bar 'gyur zhing grol ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang 'dod pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: if one holds it in the mind, it is said that one will see Maheśvara with the eye of concentration and attain liberation. But that is also unreasonable.
